== Description == To use this template, add the {{T|{{BASEPAGENAME}}}} template and fill in the appropriate fields. Fields left blank will not appear in articles. This infobox template uses [[w:Help:Infobox|Fandom's infobox syntax]]. == Syntax == 
{{Album
 | title         = 
 | image         = [e.g. "Example.jpg"]
 | imagecaption  = 
 | artist        = 
 | released      = 
 | recorded      = 
 | length        = 
 | label         = 
 | producer      = 
}}
== Sample output == {{Album | title = Fleur | image = Example.jpg | artist = Marigold | released = June 2012 | recorded = 2011 | length = 88:88 | label = Spring | producer = Daffy }} 
{{Album
 | title         = Fleur
 | image         = Example.jpg
 | artist        = Marigold
 | released      = June 2012
 | recorded      = 2011
 | length        = 88:88
 | label         = Spring
 | producer      = Daffy
}}

{| class="article-table plainlinks" style="width:100%;" |- style="font-size:18px;" ! style="padding:0px;" |
Template documentation
|- | ''Note: portions of the template sample may not be visible without values provided.'' |- | View or edit [[{{{1|Template:{{PAGENAMEE}}/doc}}}|this documentation]]. ([[Template:Documentation|About template documentation]]) |- | Editors can experiment in this template's [{{fullurl:{{FULLPAGENAMEE}}/sandbox|action=edit}} sandbox] and [{{fullurl:{{FULLPAGENAMEE}}/testcases}} test case] pages. |}
{{{{{1|{{PAGENAME}}/doc}}}}}
{{Documentation}}[[Category:Documentation templates]]

==Description== This template is used to insert descriptions on template pages. ==Syntax== Add {{t|Documentation}} at the end of the template page. Add {{t|Documentation|documentation page}} to transclude an alternative page from the /doc subpage. ==Usage== ===On the Template page=== This is the normal format when used: 
TEMPLATE CODE
Any categories to be inserted into articles by the template
{{Documentation}}
''If your template is not a completed div or table, you may need to close the tags just before {{Documentation}} is inserted (within the noinclude tags).'' ''A line break right before {{Documentation}} can also be useful as it helps prevent the documentation template "running into" previous code.'' ===On the documentation page=== The documentation page is usually located on the /doc subpage for a template, but a different page can be specified with the first parameter of the template (see [[#Syntax|Syntax]]). Normally, you will want to write something like the following on the documentation page: 
==Description==
This template is used to do something.

==Syntax==
Type {{t|templatename}} somewhere.

==Samples==
<nowiki>{{templatename|input}}</nowiki> 

results in...

{{templatename|input}}

Any categories for the template itself
[[Category:Template documentation]]
Use any or all of the above description/syntax/sample output sections. You may also want to add "see also" or other sections. Note that the above example also uses the [[Template:T]] template. [[Category:Documentation templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description A template link with a variable number of parameters (0-20).
;Syntax :{{t|t|parameter1|parameter2|parameter3|parameter4|...|parameter20}} <!-- self-referential examples! -->
;Source :Improved version not needing t/piece subtemplate developed on [http://templates.fandom.com Templates wiki] see the [http://templates.fandom.com/index.php?title=Template:T&action=history list of authors]. Copied here via CC-By-SA 3.0 license.
;Example :{{t|t|param1|param2}}

{| style="width:100%; margin-top:1em; border:1px solid #999; font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- ! style="padding:0.2em 0.5em;" nowrap="nowrap" class="color1" | {{{header}}} |- | style="padding:0.2em 0.5em;" | {{{body}}} |}<noinclude> {{documentation}}</noinclude>

;Description :This template is used to create a basic navigation box. You can do so by calling the template, via the steps under "Syntax", but it is recommended to '''copy the code verbatim''' via the steps under "Navbox Creation". ;Navbox Creation type=create prefix=Template: preload=Template:Navbox editintro=Template:Navbox/doc buttonlabel=Make your navbox! default = Navbox Foo #Think of a name for your navbox, like "Navbox Foo". Type it in the above field, press the button, and save the page immediately. Be ready to return to ''this'' page to see the rest of the instructions. #Edit the resulting page in source mode. #Replace {{{header}}} with the text you would like to appear in the header. #Replace {{{body}}} with the text you would like to appear in the body. #To add another section, copy these four lines of code immediately below the lines in the existing code that they resemble: 
|-
! style="padding:0.2em 0.5em;" nowrap="nowrap" class="color1" | {{{header}}}
|-
| style="padding:0.2em 0.5em;" | {{{body}}}
Save the page once you have added as many sections as you needed, and filled them with content. You may also want to create a /doc subpage explaining that to call the resulting template, one must only type {{Navbox Foo}}, or rather, whatever we decided to name the template in step 1. ;Syntax 
{{navbox
|header=Land of Bob
|body=This [[place]] and that [[place]].
}}
:Results in... {{navbox |header=Land of Bob |body=This [[place]] and that [[place]]. }} [[Category:Navbox templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :This template is used to mark images as being copyrighted, but the copyright holder has given permission for its use. ;Syntax :Type {{t|permission}} on the image information page. [[Category:Image license templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]
;Description :This template is used to mark images as fair use. ;Syntax :Type {{t|fairuse}} on the image information page. [[Category:Image license templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :This template is used to mark images as having been uploaded by the photographer or author. ;Syntax :Type {{t|self}} on the image information page. [[Category:Image license templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :This template is used to mark images as having been uploaded on [[wikipedia:|Wikipedia]] or another [[wikimedia:|Wikimedia]] project. ;Syntax :Type {{t|From Wikimedia}} on the image information page. [[Category:Image license templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :This template is used to mark images with the CC-BY-SA license. ;Syntax :Type {{t|CC-BY-SA}} on the image information page. [[Category:Image license templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :This template is used to mark images with a free license not covered by other image templates. ;Syntax :Type {{t|Other free}} on the image information page. [[Category:Image license templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :This template is used to mark images as being in the public domain. ;Syntax :Type {{t|PD}} on the image information page. [[Category:Image license templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

== Description == This template uses your wiki's SITENAME and strips off the word "wiki" leaving what is in most cases the text describing the topic of your wiki. To use this template in its basic form, simply add the {{T|{{BASEPAGENAME}}}} template wherever you want your topic to appear in a sentence or section. If your wiki's SITENAME minus the word "wiki" is not a good descriptor for your wiki's topic, you may also simply edit the template and replace it with just the text you want displayed. == Syntax == 
{{Topic}}
== Sample output == {{Topic}} [[Category:Templates]][[Category:Template documentation|{{PAGENAME}}]]

==Description== To use this template, enter the following and fill in the appropriate fields. Most fields left blank will not show up. ==Syntax== 
{{Quote
 | quote   = 
 | speaker = 
 | source  = 
}}
As an alternative, these can be placed in positional order. ==Samples== {{Quote | quote = When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die. | speaker = [[w:c:gameofthrones:Cersei Lannister|Cersei Lannister]] | source = [[w:c:gameofthrones:You Win or You Die|"You Win or You Die"]] }} 
{{Quote
 | quote   = When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die.
 | speaker = [[w:c:gameofthrones:Cersei Lannister|Cersei Lannister]]
 | source  = [[w:c:gameofthrones:You Win or You Die|"You Win or You Die"]]
}}
or 
{{Quote
 | When you play the game of thrones, you win or you die.
 | [[w:c:gameofthrones:Cersei Lannister|Cersei Lannister]]
 | [[w:c:gameofthrones:You Win or You Die|"You Win or You Die"]]
}}
== Technical details == This template uses the [[w:Help:Lua|Lua templating language]], and more information can be found [[w:c:dev:Global_Lua_Modules/Quote|on the Global Lua Module page]]. '''For a traditional wikitext version of this template, see [[w:c:templates:Template:Quote|Quote on Templates Wiki]]'''. [[Category:Quote templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :Marks an article as a disambiguation page, adding a banner to the article and categorizing it under [[:Category:Disambiguations]]. ;Syntax :Add {{t|disambiguation}} at the top of a disambiguation page. [[Category:Notice templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

{{t|Dialogue}} facilitates the writing of dialogue in a standard format. The template can handle most standard formats of writing dialogue, and can be indented, bulleted or numbered. '''This template ''cannot'' be subst:'d'''. This template uses the [[w:Help:Lua|Lua templating language]], and more information can be found [[w:c:dev:Global_Lua_Modules/Dialogue|on the Global Lua Module page]]. '''For a traditional wikitext version of this template, see [[w:c:templates:Template:Dialogue/wikitext|Dialogue on Templates Wiki]]'''. ==Syntax== This is how to write the template in [[w:Help:wikitext|wikitext]] onto your article: 
{{dialogue
|short=full
|short=full
|short=full
...
|Character|Speech
|Character|Speech
|Character|Speech
...
|cite = dialogue description
}}
These parameters are explained more fully below. ==Parameters== '''Named parameters specify name shortcuts. They are all optional.''' They are placed at the top of the template call, like this: 
{{dialogue
|short=full
|short=full
|short=full
...
Name shortcuts apply to your main dialogue text. If you use a shortcut specified here for a character name, then the full name will be replaced for it. Named parameters of the form "mood1", "mood2", "mood3", etc., up to "mood10", specify moods for the corresponding line number (e.g. "mood1" specifies line 1). They are placed in a line like this: 
...
|Character|Speech|mood1=angry
|Character|Speech|mood2=quiet
|Character|Speech|mood3=ecstatic
...
Positional parameters form the text of the dialogue (i.e. any line not containing an "=" will be construed as part of the dialogue. :;Parameter 1 ''(required)'' : Character name speaking :;Parameter 2 ''(optional)'' : Line to speak :;Parameter 3 ''(optional)'' : Next character :;Parameter 4 ''(optional)'' : Next line :;Parameter 5 ''(optional)'' : Next character :;Parameter 6 ''(optional)'' : Next line :;Parameter 7 ''(optional)'' : so on... Note: if any character is called "action" then that line will be construed as an action line. It still counts as a ''line'' nonetheless. To write a dialogue description/source, use cite = ==Examples== Here is an example of a full template usage: 
{{dialogue
|harry=Harry Enfield
|bryan=Bryan Adams

|harry|Hello!                |mood1=happy
|bryan|Oh hello there        |mood2=surprised
|harry|How are you?          |mood3=inquisitive
|bryan|Quite fine thank you. |mood4=reserved
|harry|Oh that's spiffing.   |mood5=spiffed
|bryan|It is, isn't it?!     |mood6=multo-spiffed
|harry|Quite so.             |mood7=bored
|bryan|Well, I'm off!        |mood8=joyous
|harry|Ta-ta!                |mood9=relieved
|bryan|Au revoir!            |mood10=sarcastic
}}
The above would generate: {{dialogue |harry=Harry Enfield |bryan=Bryan Adams |harry|Hello! |mood1=happy |bryan|Oh hello there |mood2=surprised |harry|How are you? |mood3=inquisitive |bryan|Quite fine thank you. |mood4=reserved |harry|Oh that's spiffing. |mood5=spiffed |bryan|It is, isn't it?! |mood6=multo-spiffed |harry|Quite so. |mood7=bored |bryan|Well, I'm off! |mood8=joyous |harry|Ta-ta! |mood9=relieved |bryan|Au revoir! |mood10=sarcastic }} The below code demonstrates examples of extended use: 
{{dialogue
|george=Georgie Boy
|rachel=Rachel

|action|Enter: George and Rachel
|george|Good morrow dearest Rachel!|mood2=happy
|action|Rachel turns to see him
|rachel|Oh, George, it's you!
|george|...
|rachel|Why won't you say anything?!|mood6=worried
|action|Enter: Guards
|Guards|We are announcing George's arrest!
|rachel|Oh my!|mood9=horrified
|action|George is dragged away.
}}
The above would generate: {{dialogue |george=Georgie Boy |rachel=Rachel |action|Enter: George and Rachel |george|Good morrow dearest Rachel!|mood2=happy |action|Rachel turns to see him |rachel|Oh, George, it's you! |george|... |rachel|Why won't you say anything?!|mood6=worried |action|Enter: Guards |Guards|We are announcing George's arrest! |rachel|Oh my!|mood9=horrified |action|George is dragged away. }} ===Notes=== You can number, bullet or indent your dialogue: 
:{{dialogue|Me|Hello|You|Howdido!}}
:{{dialogue|Me|Hello|You|Howdido!}} 
#{{dialogue|Me|Hello|You|Howdido!}}
#{{dialogue|Them|Good afternoon|Us|What a load of rubbish!}}
#{{dialogue|Me|Hello|You|Howdido!}} #{{dialogue|Them|Good afternoon|Us|What a load of rubbish!}} 
*{{dialogue
|angel=Fortitude
|angel|I am an angel!|Crowd|We don't believe you!}}
*{{dialogue
|angel=Fortitude
|angel|But I'm being quite serious!|Crowd|Too bad for you then!}}
*{{dialogue |angel=Fortitude |angel|I am an angel!|Crowd|We don't believe you!}} *{{dialogue |angel=Fortitude |angel|But I'm being quite serious!|Crowd|Too bad for you then!}} You will get the odd spacing error (e.g. "Speech") if you lay out your dialogue on multiple lines. [[Category:Quote templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

This is the {{t|Namespace}} meta-template. It helps other templates detect what type of page they are on. It detects and groups all the different [[Wikipedia:Namespace#Enumeration|namespaces]] used on Fandom into several types: ; main : Main (i.e. article) space, where normal articles are kept. ; talk : Any talk space, including page names that start with "Talk:", "User talk:", "File talk:", etc. ;user ;file ;mediawiki ;template ;help ;category : The remaining namespaces. ; other : Any namespaces that were not specified as a parameter to the template (see explanation below). For backwards compatibility, this template handles '''image''' as if '''file'''. '''image''' ([[Image:...]]) is now deprecated. '''Note:''' For most cases it may be better to use the simpler namespace detection templates (see the [[#See also|see also]] section below). This template is more prone to human errors such as misspelling parameter names. This template uses the [[w:Help:Lua|Lua templating language]], and more information can be found [[w:c:dev:Global_Lua_Modules/Namespace_detect|on the Global Lua Module page]]. '''For a traditional wikitext version of this template, see [[w:c:templates:Template:Namespace_detect|Namespace_detect on Templates Wiki]]'''. == Usage == This template takes one or more parameters named after the different page types as listed above. Like this: 
{{Namespace
 | main  = Article text
 | talk  = Talk page text
 | other = Other pages text
}}
If the template is on a main (article) page, it will return this: : {{Namespace |demospace=main | main = Article text | talk = Talk page text | other = Other pages text }} If the template is on any other page than an article or a talk page, it will return this: : {{Namespace | main = Article text | talk = Talk page text | other = Other pages text }} The example above made the template return something for all page types. But if we don't use the '''other''' parameter or leave it empty, it will not return anything for the other page types. Like this: 
{{Namespace
 | file     = File page text
 | category = Category page text
 | other    =
}}
On any pages other than file and category pages the code above will render nothing. : {{Namespace | file = File page text | category = Category page text | other = }} By using an empty parameter, you can make it so the template doesn't render anything for some specific page type. Like this: 
{{Namespace
 | main  = 
 | other = Other pages text
}}
The code above will render nothing when on mainspace (article) pages, but will return this when on other pages: : {{Namespace | main = | other = Other pages text }} == Demospace and page == For testing and demonstration purposes, this template can take two parameters named '''demospace''' and '''page'''. '''demospace''' understands any of the page type names used by this template, including the '''other''' type. It tells the template to behave like it is on some specific type of page. Like this: 
{{Namespace
 | main  = Article text
 | other = Other pages text
 | demospace = main
}}
No matter on what kind of page the code above is used, it will return this: : {{Namespace | main = Article text | other = Other pages text | demospace = main }} The '''page''' parameter instead takes a normal pagename, making this template behave exactly as if on that page. The pagename doesn't have to be an existing page. Like this: 
{{Namespace
 | user  = User page text
 | other = Other pages text
 | page  = User:Example
}}
No matter on what kind of page the code above is used, it will return this: : {{Namespace | user = User page text | other = Other pages text | page = User:Example }} It can be convenient to let your template understand the '''demospace''' and/or '''page''' parameter and send it on to the {{T|Namespace}} template. Like this: 
{{Namespace
 | main  = Article text
 | other = Other pages text
 | demospace = {{{demospace|}}}
 | page  = {{{page|}}}
}}
If both the '''demospace''' and '''page''' parameters are empty or undefined, the template will detect page types as usual. == Parameters == List of all parameters: 
{{Namespace
| main  = 
...
| other =
| demospace = {{{demospace|}}} / main / talk / user /
              file / mediawiki / template /
              help / category / other
| page  = {{{page|}}} / User:Example
}}
== Technical details == If you intend to feed tables as content to the numbered parameters of this template, you need to know this: [[w:Help:Template|Templates]] have a problem handling parameter data that contains pipes "|" unless the pipe is inside another template {{name|param1}} or inside a piped link [[w:Help:Template|help]]. Thus templates can not handle [[w:Help:Table|wikitables]] as input unless you escape them by using the {{!}} [[w:Help:Magic words|magic word]]. This makes it hard to use wikitables as parameters to templates. Instead, the usual solution is to use HTML wikimarkup for the table code, which is more robust. [[Category:General wiki templates]]{{#ifeq:{{SUBPAGENAME}}|sandbox|[[Category:Namespace manipulation templates]]}}[[Category:Template documentation]]

-- This Module is used for making templates based in the Lua language. -- See more details about Lua in [[w:Help:Lua]]. -- The Fandom Developer's Wiki hosts Global Lua Modules that can be imported and locally overridden. -- The next line imports the Dialogue module from the [[w:c:dev:Global Lua Modules]]. local Dialogue = require('Dev:Dialogue') -- See more details about this module at [[w:c:dev:Global_Lua_Modules/Dialogue]]
-- The last line produces the output for the template return Dialogue

-- This Module is used for making templates based in the Lua language. -- See more details about Lua in [[w:Help:Lua]]. -- The Fandom Developer's Wiki hosts Global Lua Modules that can be imported and locally overridden. -- The next line imports the Hatnote module from the [[w:c:dev:Global Lua Modules]]. local H = require('Dev:Hatnote') -- See more details about this module at [[w:c:dev:Global_Lua_Modules/Hatnote]]
-- The last line produces the output for the template return H

-- This Module is used for making templates based in the Lua language. -- See more details about Lua in [[w:Help:Lua]]. -- The Fandom Developer's Wiki hosts Global Lua Modules that can be imported and locally overridden. -- The next line imports the Mbox module from the [[w:c:dev:Global Lua Modules]]. local Mbox = require('Dev:Mbox') -- See more details about this module at [[w:c:dev:Global_Lua_Modules/Mbox]]
-- The imported Module is overwritten locally to include default styling. -- For a more flexible Mbox experience, delete the function below and import -- https://dev.fandom.com/wiki/MediaWiki:Global_Lua_Modules/Mbox.css -- or paste (and modify as you like) its contents in your wiki's -- [[MediaWiki:Wikia.css]] (see [[w:Help:Including_additional_CSS_and_JS]]) -- or look at https://dev.fandom.com/wiki/Global_Lua_Modules/Mbox -- for more customization inspiration
-- -- BEGIN DELETION HERE --
local getArgs = require('Dev:Arguments').getArgs local localCSS = mw.loadData('Module:Mbox/data').localStyle
function Mbox.main(frame) local args = getArgs(frame)
-- styles local styles = {} if args.bordercolor then styles['border-left-color'] = args.bordercolor elseif args.type then styles['border-left-color'] = 'var(--type-' .. args.type .. ')' end
if args.bgcolor then styles['background-color'] = args.bgcolor end
-- images local image = args.image or '' local imagewidth = args.imagewidth or '80px' local imagelink = '' if args.imagelink then imagelink = '|link=' .. args.imagelink end
local imagewikitext = ('%sFile:%s|%s%s' .. ']]'):format('[[', image, imagewidth, imagelink)
-- id for closure local id = args.id or 'mbox'
local container = mw.html.create('div') :addClass('mbox') :addClass(args.class) :css(styles) :css(localCSS['mbox']) :cssText(args.style)
local content = container:tag('div') :addClass('mbox__content') :css(localCSS['mbox__content'])
if args.image then local image = content:tag('div') :addClass('mbox__content__image') :addClass('mw-collapsible') :attr('id', 'mw-customcollapsible-' .. id) :css(localCSS['mbox__content__image']) :wikitext(imagewikitext) if args.collapsed then image:addClass('mw-collapsed') end end
local contentwrapper = content:tag('div') :addClass('mbox__content__wrapper') :css(localCSS['mbox__content__wrapper'])
if args.header then contentwrapper:tag('div') :addClass('mbox__content__header') :css(localCSS['mbox__content__header']) :wikitext(args.header) end
if args.text then local text = contentwrapper:tag('div') :addClass('mbox__content__text') :addClass('mw-collapsible') :attr('id', 'mw-customcollapsible-' .. id) :css(localCSS['mbox__content__text']) :wikitext(args.text) if args.collapsed then text:addClass('mw-collapsed') end
if args.comment then text:tag('div') :addClass('mbox__content__text__comment') :css(localCSS['mbox__content__text__comment']) :wikitext(args.comment) end end
contentwrapper:tag('span') :addClass('mbox__close') :addClass('mw-customtoggle-' .. id) :css(localCSS['mbox__close']) :attr('title', 'Dismiss')
if args.aside then local aside = content:tag('div') :addClass('mbox__content__aside') :addClass('mw-collapsible') :attr('id', 'mw-customcollapsible-' .. id) :css(localCSS['mbox__content__aside']) :wikitext(args.aside) if args.collapsed then aside:addClass('mw-collapsed') end end
return container end
-- -- END DELETION HERE --
-- The last line produces the output for the template return Mbox

;Description This template trims whitespace from the beginning and end of the supplied value. It works by using the simple hack of filtering it through the #if parser function. ;Syntax {{trim| value }} [[Category:General wiki templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description This template allows you to clear the left side, right side, or both sides of the page. Clearing means that the content following the template will not be displayed until the existing content on the specified sides (for example, "hanging" or floating images or blocks) is displayed completely. This template is often used so that the text does not flow around unrelated images. The template adds the following code to the page:
(the value after clear depends on the parameters). This code affects elements with the CSS property float, including files floated to the side (for example, [[File:Image.png|right]]). ;Syntax * To clear both sides of the page, add the code {{t|Clear}}. * To clear only the left side of the page, add the code {{t|Clear|left}}. * To clear only the right side of the page, add the code {{t|Clear|right}}. You can also use {{t|-}} instead of {{t|Clear}} as a shorthand call for this template. __NOTOC__ ;Example 

=== Section 1 ===
[[File:Example.jpg|200px|right]]
Section 1 text.

=== Section 2 ===
Section 2 text.
{{Clear|right}}

=== Section 3 ===
Section 3 text.
This code produces the following result: ---- === Section 1 === [[File:Example.jpg|200px|right]] Section 1 text. === Section 2 === Section 2 text. {{Clear|right}} === Section 3 === Section 3 text. ---- As you can see above, the example image added in section 1 is displayed to the right and extends down through section 2, while the {{t|Clear}} template is called at the end of the second section, resulting in the example image not being next to section 3. Thus, one use of the {{t|Clear}} template is to control which elements are displayed next to which other elements. == See also == * [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/clear CSS property clear on MDN] * [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/float CSS property float on MDN] [[Category:General wiki templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

<includeonly><infobox> <title source="title"> <default>{{PAGENAME}}</default> </title> <image source="image"> <caption source="caption"/> </image> <data source="developer"><label>Developer</label></data> <data source="publisher"><label>Publisher</label></data> <data source="engine"><label>Engine</label></data> <data source="version"><label>Version</label></data> <data source="platform"><label>Platform</label></data> <data source="releasedate"><label>Release date</label></data> <data source="genre"><label>Genre</label></data> <data source="mode"><label>Mode</label></data> <data source="rating"><label>Rating</label></data> <data source="media"><label>Media</label></data> <group collapse="open"> <header>System requirements</header> <data source="requirements"></data> </group> </infobox></includeonly><noinclude>{{Documentation}}</noinclude>

== Description == To use this template, add the {{T|{{BASEPAGENAME}}}} template and fill in the appropriate fields. Fields left blank will not appear in articles. This infobox template uses [[w:Help:Infobox|Fandom's infobox syntax]]. == Syntax == 
{{Game
 | title         = The game's name, displayed on top of the infobox
 | image         = [e.g. "Example.jpg"]
 | developer     = 
 | publisher     = 
 | engine        = The engine the game runs on
 | version       = Most recently released version of the game. If your wiki does patch notes, you may wish to link to those.
 | platform      = Platform(s) the game is available on
 | releasedate   = When the game released
 | genre         = Genre(s) the game is classified as
 | mode          = Singeplayer, multiplayer, etc.
 | rating        = ESRB / PEGI, etc. ratings
 | media         = What media the game is available on (digital, cartridge, cd, etc.)
 | requirements  = System requirements
}}
== Sample output == {{Game | title = The Game of Flower | image = Example.jpg | developer = | publisher = | engine = | version = | platform = PC | releasedate = Soon | genre = RPG | mode = Single player | rating = | media = | requirements = Cutting edge hardware }} 
{{Game
 | title         = The Game of Flower
 | image         = Example.jpg
 | developer     = 
 | publisher     = 
 | engine        = 
 | version       = 
 | platform      = PC
 | releasedate   = Soon
 | genre         = RPG
 | mode          = Single player
 | rating        = 
 | media         = 
 | requirements  = Cutting edge hardware
}}
[[Category:Infobox templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

;Description :This template is used to create the box used by the various image license templates. The default styling is currently geared to a light-themed wiki. If your wiki has a dark theme and this template is too bright relative to the other elements on your wiki, simply change the following style parameters: :background-color: This is the color of the background and is currently set to: #fefefe :border-color: This is the color of the borders and is currently set to: #d6d6d6 :color: This is the color of the text and is currently set to: #333 ;Syntax :Type {{t|LicenseBox|text{{=}}License text}} on the image information page. revision.text:
This module stores configuration data for Module:Namespace detect. Here you can localise the module to your wiki's language.
To activate a configuration item, you need to uncomment it. This means that you need to remove the text "-- " at the start of the line.

 | language  =

revision.comment: Created page with "__NOTOC__ This template is used to [[Wikipedia:WP:CITE|cite sources]] in Wikipedia. It is specifically for web sites which are not news sources. This template replaces deprec..."
revision.text:
__NOTOC__ This template is used to [[Wikipedia:WP:CITE|cite sources]] in Wikipedia. It is specifically for web sites which are not news sources. This template replaces deprecated [[Wikipedia:Template:Teb reference|template:web reference]]. It provides lower case parameters only. A general discussion of the use of templates for adding citation of open-source web content to Wikipedia articles is available at [[Wikipedia:Citation templates|citation templates]]. This page uses [[w:Wikia:Licensing|Creative Commons Licensed]] content from [[w:c:Wookieepedia:Template:Cite web|Wookieepedia]] == Usage == ;Common form for cases where little is known about authorship of the page (with current date) {{Cite web |url= |title= |accessdate={{CURRENTYEAR}}-{{CURRENTMONTH}}-{{CURRENTDAY2}} |format= |work= }} ;Using last, first (with current date) {{Cite web |url= |title= |accessdate={{CURRENTYEAR}}-{{CURRENTMONTH}}-{{CURRENTDAY2}} |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |year= |month= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= }} ;Using author (with current date) {{Cite web |url= |title= |accessdate={{CURRENTYEAR}}-{{CURRENTMONTH}}-{{CURRENTDAY2}} |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |year= |month= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= }} ;Using non-linked retrieved date, last, first {{Cite web |url= |title= |accessmonthday= |accessyear= |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |year= |month= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= }} ;Using non-linked retrieved date, author {{Cite web |url= |title= |accessmonthday= |accessyear= |author= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |year= |month= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= }} ;All parameters, horizontal format (delete the ones you don't need) {{Cite web |url= |title= |accessdate= |accessmonthday= |accessdaymonth = |accessyear= |author= |last= |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |date= |year= |month= |format= |work= |publisher= |pages= |language= |archiveurl= |archivedate= |quote= }} ;All parameters, vertical format 
{{Cite web
| url = 
| title = 
| accessdate = 
| accessdaymonth = 
| accessmonthday = 
| accessyear = 
| author = 
| last = 
| first = 
| authorlink = 
| coauthors = 
| date = 
| year = 
| month = 
| format = 
| work = 
| publisher = 
| pages = 
| language = 
| archiveurl = 
| archivedate = 
| quote = 
}}
=== Required parameters === * '''url''': URL of online item. * '''title''': Title of online item. ''For producing a [[Wikipedia:WP:CONTEXT#Dates|wikilinked date]] of retrieval:'' :* '''accessdate''': Full date when item was accessed, in [[Wikipedia:ISO 8601|ISO 8601]] YYYY-MM-DD format, for example "accessdate = {{CURRENTYEAR}}-{{CURRENTMONTH}}-{{CURRENTDAY2}}". ''Must not be wikilinked'' ''For producing a non-wikilinked date of retrieval:'' :* '''accessmonthday''' and '''accessyear''': Month and day when item was accessed, for example "accessmonthday = May 10", and year when item was accessed, for example "accessyear = 2005". Produces: ''Retrieved on May 10, 2006.'' :* '''accessdaymonth''' and '''accessyear''': Month and day when item was accessed, for example "accessmonthday = 10 May", and year when item was accessed, for example "accessyear = 2005". Produces: ''Retrieved on 10 May 2006.'' === Optional parameters === * '''author''': Author ** '''last''' works with '''first''' to produce last, first ** '''authorlink''' works either with '''author''' or with '''last''' & '''first''' to link to the appropriate wikipedia article. Does not work with URLs. ** '''coauthors''': allows additional authors * '''date''': Full date of publication, preferably in [[Wikipedia:ISO 8601|ISO 8601]] YYYY-MM-DD format, e.g. ''2006-02-17''. May be wikilinked. ** OR: '''year''': Year of publication, and '''month''': Name of the month of publication. If you also have the day, use ''date'' instead. Must not be wikilinked. * '''format''': Format, e.g. PDF. HTML implied if not specified. * '''work''': If this item is part of a larger work, name of that work. * '''publisher''': Publisher, if any. * '''pages''': ''pp. 57'': first page and optional last page. This is for listing the pages relevant to the citation, not the total number of pages in the book. This is especially useful for PDF format, where the page can be linked to with the #page=''number'' anchor tagged on the end of the URL: *: pages = [http://www.example.org/file.pdf#page=123 p. 123] * '''language''': language of publication (don't specify "English" as this is the default). * '''archiveurl''': URL of the archive location of the item (requires '''archivedate''') * '''archivedate''': Date when the item was archived (requires '''archiveurl'''), in [[Wikipedia:ISO 8601|ISO 8601]] YYYY-MM-DD format, e.g. ''2006-02-17''. Must not be wikilinked; it will be linked automatically. * '''quote''': Relevant quote from online item. == Examples == ;Some standard use cases * {{Cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | publisher=Open Publishing | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | publisher=Open Publishing | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org | accessdate=2005-07-06 }} * {{Cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org | accessdate=2005-07-06 }} * {{Cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.example.org | accessdate=2005-07-06}} * {{Cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | author=Doe, John | title=My Favorite Things Part II | url=http://www.example.org | accessdate=2005-07-06}} * {{Cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | url=http://www.example.org | accessdate=2005-07-06}} * {{Cite web | url=http://www.nfl.com/fans/ | title=Digest of Rules | publisher= National Football League | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | url=http://www.nfl.com/fans/ | title=Digest of Rules | publisher= National Football League | accessdate=2005-07-06 }} ;Non-linking date of retrieval (using accessmonthday and accessyear) * {{Cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessmonthday=July 6 | accessyear=2005 }}
{{cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessmonthday=July 6 | accessyear=2005 }} ;Using format * {{Cite web | title=List of psychotropic substances under international control | publisher = International Narcotics Control Board | url=http://www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | title=List of psychotropic substances under international control | publisher = International Narcotics Control Board | url=http://www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate=2005-07-06}} ;language * {{Cite web | author=Joliet, Franois | title=Honnit soit qui mal y pense | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 | language=French }}
{{cite web | author=Joliet, Franois | title=Honnit soit qui mal y pense | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.example.org | accessdate=2005-07-06 | language=French}} ;coauthors * {{Cite web | first=John | last=Doe | coauthors=Peter Smith, Jim Smythe | title=My Favorite Things Part II | publisher=Open Publishing | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2006-05-16 }}
{{cite web | first=John | last=Doe | coauthors=Peter Smith, Jim Smythe | title=My Favorite Things Part II | publisher=Open Publishing | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2006-05-16 }} ;No author * {{Cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | publisher=Open Publishing | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2006-05-16 }}
{{cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | publisher=Open Publishing | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2006-05-16 }} ;No author, no publisher * {{Cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | work=Encyclopedia of Things | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }} * {{Cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }}
{{cite web | title=My Favorite Things Part II | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.example.org/ | accessdate=2005-07-06 }} * {{Cite web | title=List of psychotropic substances under international control | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate=2005-07-06 | language=Greek }}
{{cite web | title=List of psychotropic substances under international control | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate=2005-07-06 | language=Greek }} ; Using archiveurl and archivedate to refer to items that went away but are available from an archive site * {{Cite web | title=List of psychotropic substances under international control | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate=2005-07-06 | archiveurl=http://www.archive.org/2005-09-11/www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | archivedate=2005-09-11 }}
{{cite web | title=List of psychotropic substances under international control | date=2005-04-30 | url=http://www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate=2005-07-06 | archiveurl=http://www.archive.org/2005-09-11/www.incb.org/pdf/e/list/green.pdf | archivedate=2005-09-11 }} * {{Cite web |url=http://joanjettbadrep.com/cgi-bin/fullStory.cgi?archive=currnews&story=20060405-01shore.htm |title=Interview with Maggie Downs |date=2006-03-31 |publisher=The Desert Sun |archiveurl=http://72.14.207.104/search?q=cache:JAxf4v-pQmgJ:joanjettbadrep.com/cgi-bin/fullStory.cgi%3Farchive%3Dcurrnews%26story%3D20060405-01shore.htm |archivedate=2006-04-26 }}
{{cite web |url=http://joanjettbadrep.com/cgi-bin/fullStory.cgi?archive=currnews&story=20060405-01shore.htm |title=Interview with Maggie Downs |date=2006-03-31 |publisher=The Desert Sun |archiveurl=http://72.14.207.104/search?q=cache:JAxf4v-pQmgJ:joanjettbadrep.com/cgi-bin/fullStory.cgi%3Farchive%3Dcurrnews%26story%3D20060405-01shore.htm |archivedate=2006-04-26}} ; Using quote * {{Cite web | title = My Favorite Things Part II | work = Encyclopedia of Things | url = http://www.example.org/ | accessdate = 2005-07-06 | quote = Lorem ipsum dolor. }}
{{cite web | title = My Favorite Things Part II | work = Encyclopedia of Things | url = http://www.example.org/ | accessdate = 2005-07-06 | quote = Lorem ipsum dolor. }} ;No parameters (error) * {{Cite web}}
{{cite web}} [[Category:General wiki templates]][[Category:Template documentation]]

Below is a suggested set of rules to follow when editing this wiki. Administrators of this wiki should read these rules and adapt them as necessary.
# '''Keep it civil''': Do not make personal attacks on other people. If you need to criticize another users argument, do so without attacking them as a person. Do not use bigoted language, including slurs which degrade another person or group of people based on gender, race, sexual orientation, nationality, religion, etc. # '''Be a productive member of the wiki''': Contribute to the wiki in line with the established processes and conventions. Need help? Ask an [[Special:ListUsers/sysop|administrator]]! Disrupting the wiki with edit warring over differing opinions of a topic with another user or group of users is not productive. # '''Do not engage in excessive self-promotion''': The wiki is a collaborative community resource for the topic at hand. It is NOT a free place to advertise your related website, YouTube channel, blog, social media account, etc. Have a question about whether your link would be welcome? Ask an administrator! # '''Do not harass other users''': If somebody asks you to stop posting certain content on their wall, respect their wishes. It is their wall. # '''Do follow community guidelines for formatting''': When a community has established formatting, its important to adhere to that, especially when spoiler content is involved.
[[Category:{{SITENAME}}]]

{{{text|}}}
Embeds a customizable [[w:c:dev:Discord|Discord]] widget on the page, independent from the rail widget. Useful for the main page which doesn't have a traditional rail element but often has a column design. == Parameters == ; id : The Discord widget ID. It can also be the first numbered parameter passed to the template. Defaults to the ID configured on MediaWiki:Custom-Discord-id. ; theme : The theme name. Should be one of dark or light, other theme names will default to dark but allow further custom CSS to affect it. ; invite : The invite URL to be used in the join button. Defaults to an invite URL generated by Discord. ; header : Whether to add the header above the widget or not. Any value other than 0 is considered truthy. Default: 0 ; width : The widget's width. Aliases: w ; height : The widget's height. Aliases: h ; text : The placeholder text while the widget is loading. Not required. Defaults to an empty string. ; branding : The colors and the logo used for the widget. Should be either new or old.

revision.text:
{{Station |image1= File:Fanory Mill Platform View.jpg|Day File:Fanory Mill Platform View Night.png|Night File:Fanory Mill Station Building.png|Station Building File:Fanory Mill Signal Box v1.2.png|Signal Box |preceding_other=[[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]] |following_other=[[Satus Services]] |preceding_steam= Terminus
''Future: [[Greenwood]] (Planned)'' |following_steam= |singal_box=[[Fanory Mill Signal Box]] |station_code= FM |number_of_platforms=3 |number_of_tracks=3 + 2 sidings |dispatching= No }} '''Fanory Mill''', commonly shortened to '''FM''', is currently the northernmost operational station in game, housing the [[Fanory Mill Signal Box]] and three platforms. There also is a siding with the spawn point for the [[List of Trains|Class 377]]. The tracks preceding the station lead to [[Benyhone Loop]], which is currently under development. ==Tracks==
''Sidings ([[List of Trains|Class 377]])''
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
''Sidings''
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''1''' - Terminating Services from [[Satus Services]] and Through Services towards [[Benyhone Loop]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
''' 2''' - Terminating Services from [[Satus Services]] and Through Services from [[Benyhone Loop]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
==Trivia== *Previously, if players wanted to turn around, they had to go to Platform 1, as it had the straightest platform. *Using admin commands, the [[Class 323]] spawns here. *Previously, [[Greenwood]] was located past the station, but it was replaced with a new line containing the [[Benyhone Loop]] in version 1.1. *A [[Turntables|Turntable]] existed near the station, but it was removed. *The [[Dovedale Central]] overhaul update added some scenery additions to the station, like a better waiting area and fencing. *In version 1.1, a spawner for the [[Class 43]] was added to the station's sidings, but this was soon reverted. ==Gallery== File:Fanory Mill Overview.jpg|Overview of Fanory Mill. File:Fanory Mill Winter.png|The station during winter. File:Fanory Mill Platforms Winter.jpg|The platforms during winter. === Previous versions of the station === Fanory mill v.10.png|The station in Version 1.0. File:OldFanoryMill.png|An old photo of the station. File:Fanory Mill Boat.png|The boat near the station. File:Artificial brook.png|A small siding of water near the station. There would be water flowing out too from a pipe. File:Fanory Mill Ahead.png|A sign from Greenwood that shows Fanory Mill is ahead. File:Old Fanory Mill Legacy Signal.png|Legacy Semaphore signal at Fanory Mill, before the v1.0 update. File:fanory view 1.png|Old Day View FM night-time station.png|Old Night View RobloxScreenShot20230910_170819886.png|Old Signal Box fanory turntable.png|Old Turntable [[Category:Stations]]
== Summary == Placeholder Image. Owned by enews

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:Satus Services.jpg|Day File:Satus Services Night.jpg|Night File:Satus Platform View.jpg|Platforms File:Satus Signal Box Outside.png|Signal Box File:Satus Sidings.png|Sidings |preceding_other=[[Fanory Mill]] |following_other=[[Jaiden's House]] |preceding_steam= |following_steam= |singal_box=[[Satus Signal Box]] |station_code= SAT |number_of_platforms= 2 |number_of_tracks= 4 |dispatching= No }} '''Satus Services''', often abbreviated to '''Satus''' or '''SAT''', is a small station between [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Dovedale East]]. It has 2 platforms with benches and shelters and houses a ticket counter. Having single-track lines at both ends and two tracks in between, the layout of the station is similar to the one of [[Benyhone Loop]]. Next to the station is the [[Satus Signal Box]], a small but essential signal box that controls the station and parts of the lines to [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Dovedale East]] as well as having the control panel for the [[Satus Level Crossing]], which is located on the road next to the box. A small walkway leads to the main road, which is connected to other nearby stations. Satus Services is currently one of the two stations, the other one being [[Dovedale East]], where there are NPC passengers that will board your train when you stop there. == Operations == The station is mostly served by [[List of Trains|Class 377]] trains from [[Fanory Mill]] and fewer [[Class 450]] and [[Class 158]] trains from [[Dovedale Central]]. [[Class 43]] trains are rather uncommon at this station due to the distance to the [[Masonfield]] sidings and the low amount of players who spawn those trains. Although they are express trains, they have to stop at Satus Services most of the times due to the lines on both ends of the station being single-track. == Tracks ==
''' 1''' - Through & stopping trains towards [[Fanory Mill]] (bi-directional)
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
''' 2''' - Through & stopping trains towards [[Dovedale East]] (bi-directional)
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
''Sidings''
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Trivia == * A derelict [[Class 91]] could be seen near the station prior to Version 1.0. * Satus Services used to be the main spawn point for all players, until the [[Dovedale Central]] overhaul update, which added [[Dovedale Central]] as a possible spawn point. ** There was a 50% chance of players spawning at Satus Services, and a 50% chance at [[Dovedale Central]]. * This station used to house a SPAD trap, located at Signal 9 of Satus Services prior to V1.0. * The entrance signals to [[Satus Services]] from [[Dale Green]] were moved back to ensure people could see the signals before the track point switch during the [[Dovedale Central]] station overhaul. * Previously, there were no seats at this station. * There used to be a turntable at the spawn tracks. * There used to be only 1 spawn point track. A new one was added to alleviate station stress. * The original roofing was tin, before being changed to another material. Currently, the station has no roof. * A worker called Susan would be building and fixing up the roof, as seen in a few photos and messages. * This was the very first station to be added in game. * Before [[Steam Train|Steam Trains]] were removed, Satus Services contained the only spawn area for them. == Gallery == File:Satus Services Platform View Night.jpg|The platforms at night File:Satus Winter.png|The station during winter File:Satus Winter 2.png|Another view of the station during winter File:Satus Platforms Winter.jpg|The platforms during winter === Old Satus === File:Satus old 91.png|The old Class 91 at [[Satus Services]]. File:Susan falling down.png|Susan falling at Satus, around July 2023. File:Satus Early Shot.png|A very old photo of the station. Susan could be spotted, scenery was sparse, and a entirely different signal box was there. File:Maxwell in the shed.png|Maxwell in a wooden shed. File:Old SAT1.png|Entrance to the old station from [[Steynbath Crossing]] ([[Dovedale East]] side). File:Old SAT2.png|Entrance to the old station from [[Dale Green]] ([[Fanory Mill]] side). File:Old SAT3.png|An overview of the station from above.

[https://www.roblox.com/games/12018816388/Dovedale-Narrowgauge-Railway Dovedale Wiki]
'''{{NUMBEROFARTICLES}} Pages | {{NUMBEROFEDITS}} Edits | {{NUMBEROFFILES}} Files | Since 9th September 2023'''
{| style="padding-bottom: 1em; margin-top: 5px; width: 100%" | [[File:DiscordLogoWhite.svg|24x24px|left]] [https://da.gd/dovedale-w Discord Server ] {{PlayDovedaleButton}} |} {| style="padding-bottom: 1em; margin-top: 5px; width: 100%" |- |
About the Game
|- |
Dovedale Railway is a british-based Roblox railway simulator game, where you can drive, dispatch, signal and take care of the railway. The game features multiple in-depth signalling systems, trains, and stations.
| |}

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1=Screenshot 2023-09-11 212439.png |preceding_other=[[Fanory Mill]] ''(Terminus)'' |following_other=[[Satus Services]] |preceding_steam=[[Fanory Mill]] ''(Terminus)'' |following_steam=[[Dale Green]] |singal_box=Controlled by [[Satus Signal Box]] |station_code= DG |number_of_platforms= 1 |number_of_tracks= 1 |dispatching= No }} '''Dale Green''' was a small intermediate stop between [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Satus Services]], connected to and serving a small farmland between the two stations. It had a single curved platform with a brick shelter, alongside some decorations. Dale Green was removed in Version 1.0. The shelter housed a seating area, as well as a noticeboard with the [[Map|map]]. At the side, there were boxes, a tourism poster, and the 'museum of ball', with 2 signboards, and a ball. {{Quote|BALL was created by an unknown man and has been turned into a meme in the dovedale community. It is now being preserved in this museum owened by Meowtwotonnezoom.
DO NOT MOVE PENALTY OF DEATH}} == Tracks ==
''' 1''' - Through & stopping trains towards [[Fanory Mill]] or [[Satus Services]].
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Trivia == * This station had a special sculpture, the BALL. * This was the only single tracked station to include a shelter. * It was also the only single tracked station to include a map. * A barn was planned to be added, but this was never done. https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1114201748253442158/1117205070199672882 == Gallery == File:Dale green shelter.png|The shelter inside. File:Dale green outside.png|The outside area of Dale Green. File:323 dale.png|A [[Class 323]] at the station just an hour post release. File:Dale Green Siding.png|A picture of the Dale Green siding. == References ==

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:Steynbath Halt Abandoned.jpg|Day File:Steynbath Halt Abandoned Night.png|Night |preceding_other=[[Satus Services]] |following_other=[[Dovedale East]]
''Future: [[Docks]]'' |preceding_steam=[[Satus Services]] |following_steam=[[Dovedale East]] ''Terminus'' |singal_box=Controlled by [[Satus Signal Box]] |station_code= SH |number_of_platforms= 1 |number_of_tracks= 1 |dispatching= No }} '''Steynbath Halt''' is a former railway halt located in the Steynbath area. The halt is located near the [[Steynbath Crossing]]. The small halt had only one platform with two benches. The halt used to be of importance when the line only served services from Steynbath Halt to [[Satus Services]]. The line since was extended, and the halt was abandoned in Version 1.0. In version 1.1, the new halt [[Jaiden's House]] was added nearby, and one side of the station was repurposed and restored for a standard gauge line. == Tracks ==
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''1''' - Standard Gauge services, terminating or towards [[Satus Services]]
'''N/A''' - Passing Services, towards [[Satus Services]] or [[Dovedale East]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Trivia == * Other than [[Dale Green]] and [[Lighthouse]], this was the only station with one track. ** [[Gleethrop End]] was previously on the list, before a platform was added during the [[Dovedale Central]] overhaul update. * This station had the fewest facilities out of all operating stations. * This was the second station to be built. == Gallery == File:Steynbath Halt Abandoned Winter.png|The abandoned platform in version 1.1 during winter File:steynbath halt day.png|The station before version 1.0 File:Steynbath Halt Night.png|The station at night before version 1.0 File:Steynbath Siding.png|thumb|The station used to feature a small siding, most likely for a singular [[Steam Train]]. == References ==

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= <gallery> File:Dovedale East Day.jpg|Day File:Dovedale East Night.jpg|Night File:Dovedale East Platform View.jpg|Platform view File:DEBox Daytime.png|Signalling Centre </gallery> |preceding_other=[[Jaiden's House]] |following_other=[[Dovedale Central]] |preceding_steam=[[Steynbath Halt]] |following_steam=[[Glassbury Junction]] & ''Terminus'' |singal_box= [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] |station_code= DE |number_of_platforms= 4 |number_of_tracks= 4 |dispatching= Yes (Panel) }} '''Dovedale East''' is a major station located between [[Jaiden's House]] and [[Dovedale Central]]. It acts as a stop for services between [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Dovedale Central]]. The station is controlled by the largest signal box in the game, the [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]]. Due to the line from [[Satus Services]] to Dovedale East being single-track, trains sometimes have to queue before departing.
The station has 4 tracks and is divided into two parts. While the part in the direction of [[Satus Services]] houses the short platforms 1A and 2A and the bypasses 1A and 2A, the part in the direction of [[Dovedale Central]] houses the curved and longer platforms 1B and 2B as well as the bypasses 2B and 1B. Between both parts of the station, there are multiple points that can be used to move trains between the bypasses and the platforms.
Dovedale East also houses a ticket counter, the [[Dovedale East Bus Terminal]], [[Meow Caf]] and the [[Railway Museum]] which showcases the history of the game.
Dovedale East is currently one of the two stations, the other one being [[Satus Services]], where there are NPC passengers that will board your train when you stop there.
== Tracks == {| ! '''Pl. 1B (long)''' - Services to [[Dovedale Central]] [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] '''Bypass 1B''' [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] '''Bypass 2B''' [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] '''Pl. 2B (long)''' - Services to [[Satus Services]] [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] ! '''Pl. 1A (short)''' - Services to [[Dovedale Central]] [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] '''Bypass 1A''' [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] '''Bypass 2A''' [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] '''Pl. 2A (short)''' - Services to [[Satus Services]] [[File:RailwayTrack.png]] |} ==Trivia == *This was the place where players could head towards [[Cosdale Harbour]] or the [[Cosdale Coal Depot]] before the aforementioned stations where removed from the game. * In the [[Dovedale Central]] overhaul update, the new [[Railway Museum]] was added here. *This is the only station with a ticketing counter. *While steamers could go until [[Dovedale Central]], [[Dovedale East]] was the only proper terminating station down the line where they could shunt. *The [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] also got a overhaul during the [[Dovedale Central]] station overhaul update. *Uniquely, the shunting steam tracks and platforms were controlled by [[Cosdale Cabin]], not [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] *The old [[Dovedale Central]] station structure is located under the station, near the [[Railway Museum]]. * Prior to the [[Dovedale Central]] overhaul, the old Dovedale East signalling box was located under [[Dovedale Central]]. *Up until 17th September 2023, all [[Steam Trains|steam trains]] were required to terminate here, with the possibility of shunting between Platforms 4 and 5 to return towards [[Satus Services]] and [[Fanory Mill]]. From 17th September 2023, steam services were allowed to continue onwards to terminate [[Dovedale Central]], though they still had the option to terminate here. *Recently added, the [[Meow Caf|Meow cafe]] is located in the Dovedale East waiting room. *Platform 3 at the older version of the station used to feature a [[Class 156]] spawn. ==Gallery== <gallery> File:DEBox Daytime.png|Dovedale East with the [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]]. File:Dovedale East Ticket Counter.png|The ticket counter at platform 2B. File:Dovedale East Overview Night.jpg|Overview of Dovedale East with the [[Railway Museum]] and the [[Dovedale East Bus Terminal]] at night. File:Dovedale East Winter.jpg|Dovedale East during winter. File:Dovedale East Overview Winter.jpg|Overview of the station during winter. File:Dovedale East Winter Night.jpg|Dovedale East during winter at night. File:Dovedale East Ticket Counter Winter.jpg|The ticket counter during winter. </gallery>
=== Old version of the station === <gallery> File:Old de box.png|The old Dovedale East signalling box, previously located under [[Dovedale Central]]. File:Trains at dove east.png|Trains, including a special Class 37, at [[Dovedale East]]. File:DE Class 43 Zoomed.png|A Class 43 that just arrived into [[Dovedale East]]. File:dovedale east signalling .png|The Signalling Area at the old Dovedale East. File:Old DE1.png|Entrance to the old station from [[Satus Services]]. File:Old DE2.png|Old station view at night. File:Old DE3.png|View from the station towards [[Glassbury Junction]] and [[Dovedale East Crossing]]. File:Old DE4.png|Entrance to the old station from [[Glassbury Junction]]. File:Old DE5.png|View of the old station from above. File:Old DE6.png|View from the old station towards [[Steynbath Halt]] (also [[Steynbath Crossing]]) and [[Satus Services]]. </gallery>

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:glassbury v2.png|Day File:GJ Night.png|Night File:GlassburyWaitingRm.png|Waiting Area File:Glassbury Toilet.png|Toilet |preceding_other=[[Dovedale East]] |following_other=[[Dovedale Central]] |singal_box= [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] (Up to the end of Platform 1)
[[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] (Up to the end of Platform 2) |preceding_steam=[[Dovedale East]] |following_steam=[[Dovedale Central]] (''Terminus'') Future: [[Gleethrop End]] |station_code= GJ |number_of_platforms= 2 |number_of_tracks= 2 |dispatching= Yes (Panel) }} '''Glassbury Junction''' was a small station in between the two bigger stations [[Dovedale East]] and [[Dovedale Central]]. The station had a few unique features that couldn't be found found anywhere else on the [[Map|map]] like a toilet and a Signal-Passed-At-Danger (SPAD) trap indicator. '''Glassbury Junction''' was the start and end of the [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] operations. The station was removed in Update 1.0. == Tracks ==
'''2''' - Through Services towards [[Dovedale East]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''1''' - Through Services towards [[Dovedale Central]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
* Services at platform 2 were usually stopped by the SPAD trap. * Services at platform 1 were usually stopped by the exiting dovedale east signal, DED3. == Trivia == * This station was widened during the [[Dovedale Central]] overhaul update. It could therefore more comfortably accommodate longer trains such as [[Class 43]] or the [[Class 91]]. * This was the only station to feature a SPAD trap, located at signal DE E1. * This was one of the few stations to be controlled by two boxes simultaneously. == Gallery == File:old Glassbury day overview.png|Old Station Day File:oldGlassburyExterior.png|Old Station Night

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:Dovedale Central.jpg|Day File:Dovedale Central Night.jpg|Night File:Dovedale Central Through Platforms.jpg|Through Platforms (Day) File:Dovedale Central Terminating Platforms.jpg|Terminating Platforms (Day) File:DC Through Platforms.jpg |Through Platforms (Night) File:DC Terminus Platforms.jpg|Terminating Platforms(Night) |preceding_other=[[Dovedale East]]
Previously [[Glassbury Junction]] |following_other=[[Pallion Harbour]]
[[Lighthouse (Station)|Lighthouse]] Station No longer accesible
[[Gleethrop End]] |singal_box= [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] |station_code= DC |number_of_platforms= 8 |number_of_tracks= 8 |dispatching= Yes (Panel) }} '''Dovedale Central''' is the largest station in the game. After multiple reworks, it now houses 8 platforms, 4 for terminating trains and 4 through platforms towards the [[Gleethrop End]] and [[Pallion Harbour]]. Parts of the station, such as its arches are modelled after [[wikipedia:London King's Cross railway station|London King's Cross railway station]]. In the station, new game features like digital arrival boards (only currently available on the terminating platforms) can be seen. == Tracks ==
'''8''' - Terminating Services
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''7''' - Terminating (Spawn point for [[Class 450]] trains)
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''6''' - Terminating Services
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''5''' - Terminating (Spawn point for [[Class 158]] trains)
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''4''' - Through Services to [[Masonfield]] & [[Gleethrop End]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''3''' - Through Services from [[Masonfield]] & [[Gleethrop End]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''2''' - Through Services towards [[Masonfield]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''1''' - Through Services from [[Masonfield]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
==Trivia== *The station was previously missing a physical link for some platforms, meaning people had to walk on the tracks, an act that is discouraged. *During the first few days of release, there was a small gap between the main entrance and Platform 4. *Previously, there were non-operational and permanently crossed out signals labelled DCA0 at the terminating platforms. *An earlier version of the station used the [[Releovka System]] for train routing. ==Gallery== File:Dovedale Central East Side.jpg|Overview of the east side of Dovedale Central File:Dovedale Central Winter.jpg|Dovedale Central during winter File:Dovedale Central Platforms Winter Night.jpg|The through platforms during winter and at night File:Dovedale Central West Side Winter Night.jpg|The west side of Dovedale Central during winter and at night File:Dovedale Central East Side Winter Night.jpg|The east side of Dovedale Central during winter and at night File:DC Arrival Boards v1.2.png|The digital arrival boards at the terminus platforms === Old versions of the station === File:Old Dc day station.png|Second generation Station File:Old DC overview.png|Second generation Station File:Dc 91.png|A [[Class 91]] departing the station File:DC terminating platforms night .png File:Dc day plat thru.png File:Entrance night.png File:Dc day back.png File:DC Winter.png| Dovedale Central decked out for the holidays. File:Winter DS DC.png| A dispatcher dispatching on boxing day 2023

revision.text:
{{PolicyNavigation}} |-| Wiki Rules = == Wiki Rules == Please follow these rules when editing or creating articles. Our [[Project:Staff|Wiki Staff]] have the final say in punishments. You may be blocked for something that is not on the list, but is sufficient to warrant such actions. Loopholing any rules will result in a punishment too. Note: We have specific guidelines for discussions, you can view those [https://dovedale.fandom.com/f/g here]. The punishments listed may be extended depending on the case. Questions? Ask on our message wall or ping @enews or @ellafellah in the Dovedale Community Discord. 1) No vandalism
''2 week block'' Do not vandalise the wiki. Vandalising includes adding unnecessary song lyrics, posting overly large images or adding falsified information. This can include jokes, or a fake statistic. If you wish to suggest, discuss it instead. If it is obvious that it is vandalism, a block will be issued.
2) No Spamming
''3 day block'' Examples of spamming include flooding articles or discussions, sending the same message over and over again, or re-uploading files multiple times. Encouraging people to spam is not allowed - this will warrant a warn, that is shorter. Repeats of this action can lead to a warn or a temporary ban.
3) Follow the guidelines
''3 day block'' When editing, please follow the guidelines posted [[Dovedale Railway Wiki:Guidelines|here]]. Examples include using British English over American English, or using the correct terms. These Guidelines help make our wiki readable and accessible, while allowing anyone to contribute.
4) Accuracy
''Case-by-case basis'' When editing, please maintain a Neutral point-of-view (NPOV) and ensure that all the articles come from verified sources. A 'NPOV' means that content is written objectively and without bias, merely presenting the facts and notable viewpoints of others. no articles should contain not contain articles that favour particular viewpoints. Striving for a neutral point-of-view helps prevent articles from becoming viewpoints and personal talk pages.
Also ensure that articles should contain only material that has been published by reliable sources, such as the developers. For example, no self made lore on the site, with the exception of discussion pages/profiles. Verified sources include but are not limited to the [[Dovedale Railway Wiki:Discord|Dovedale Community Discord Server]] and the Roblox page. When editing, you should provide citations as far as possible.
You are also NOT to use any source of artificial intelligence program such as ChatGPT, Bing AI, Google Bard or Midjourney unless prior permission has been obtained. Such content is prohibited on the wiki as it might constitute as plagarism in the form of images, or may be inaccurate when consulting text based AI.
5) Be Civil
''Case-by-case basis'' Being civil entails remaining polite and assuming good faith when interacting with others, and focusing on the content of edits rather than on personal issues. In its essence, participate in a respectful and considerate way, without ignoring the positions and conclusions of others. If you are caught up in any arguments, please try not to escalate it - and if necessary staff are always here to help. You should not use slurs, and keep swearing to a minimum - so as to respect others.
6) Do not leak information
'' Permanent Ban'' Using the Wiki as a platform to promote or post your leaked information is strictly not allowed - for example Staff Codes to be used in game, or another users personal information.
7) NO NSFW
''Permanent Ban'' Posting NSFW - Not Safe For Work or suggestive content on the Wiki is strictly NOT allowed. This rule applys to any image show on site - include profile pictures. Note: We do not have liberty over ads controlled over Fandom. We apologise if you have seen any suggestive ads. Please send a message over to Fandom at [[Special:Contact]] to report the ad if you can. 8) No Underage Users
''Ban until you are of age'' While you may access the website and its services, an account is encouraged for the full suite of services like chatting and profiles. You need to be over 13 to have a Fandom account. If you are in Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus (All), Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, the minimum age is 16.
|-| Game Rules = == Game Rules == 1.1 Follow all Roblox terms of service. 1.2 Do not troll - examples include taking over boxes without permission, intentionally ruining gameplay for others. 1.3 Do not abuse the Admin Call system. 1.4 Moderators have the final say. Please listen to them. 1.5 Do not spam whistles or horns. It can get annoying to those around you. 1.6 Players Spamming in-game chat is forbidden. 1.7 Signallers should signal to the best of their ability. 1.8 Be nice to everyone in-game. Racism, homophobia and NSFW topics will result in moderation. |-| Discord Rules = == Discord Rules == 2.1 Roblox and Discord terms of service apply. 2.2 Keep this server a friendly environment for everybody. Please do not spam or troll. 2.3 Do not flood the chat. Anything over 6 lines that is not related to the current topic should not be sent. 2.4 Players should not use offensive language, or express hate to anyone. Racial slurs can result in a ban. 2.5 Swearing is allowed, but do not direct it to anybody! 2.6 Please use channels for their intended purpose. 2.7 Advertising is strictly forbidden without permission from HRs+. 2.8 Scamming and malicious links are strictly forbidden and can result in a ban. 2.9 For moderation purposes, please speak English in the server. Translation apps might help if you have issues. 2.10 No technicalities, loopholes will be accepted as excuses to break the rules. Moderators have the final say. Please listen to them. |-| Code of Conduct (Full) = [[File:Dovedale Railways General Code of Conduct.pdf]]

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:Gleethrop End New.jpg|Day File:Gleethrop End New Night.jpg|Night |preceding_other=[[Dovedale Central]] |following_other= [[Perthtyne]] |singal_box=[[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] |preceding_steam=No Operation |following_steam=No Operation |station_code= GE |number_of_platforms= 2 |number_of_tracks= 3 |dispatching= No }} '''Gleethrop End''' is the intermediate station on the branch line from [[Dovedale Central]] to [[Perthtyne]]. This station has 3 tracks and 2 platforms each with [[Off Indicator|TDEU]]s. This station is generally quiet due to most of the trains going to [[Pallion Harbour|Pallion Habour]] and lack of shunting from [[Class 450|Class 450s]] and [[Class 158|Class 158s]] spawning at [[Dovedale Central]]. In version 1.2, the station received a roof, an overpass, benches and an additional platform in the middle. == Tracks ==
'''2''' - Terminating services from [[Dovedale Central]] / Spawn point for [[Class 411]] trains
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
''Bypass track''
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''1''' - Through Services towards [[Perthtyne]] and [[Dovedale Central]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Gallery == File:GEWithRoof.png|The Perthtyne-facing side of the station. ===Old versions of the station=== File:Gleethrop End Platforms Winter.png|Pre-1.2 platforms during winter. File:Gleethrop End Platform View.png|Old platform view File:Gleethrop end day.png|Old Day View File:GleethropEndStation.png|Old Night View

revision.text:
{{Train | image1= <gallery> File:Class323 Exterior.png|Exterior File:Class323 Interior.png|Interior File:Class 323 Cab.png|Cab View </gallery> | top_speed=60 mph | powered_by=Electric Overhead Wires | spawn_points= [[Fanory Mill]] | coaches=3 | doors=12 | status=Admin Only | date_added=August 20, 2023 }} The '''Class 323''' is an admin-only electric multiple unit (EMU) commuter train that was previously public. It can be spawned by admins at the [[Fanory Mill]] sidings. It has a full interior in the cab and coaches, and is painted in yellow, white and blue.
It was first released on the 20th of August 2023 and then withdrawn due to performance issues<ref> https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1113532700121378899/1143559907380052159</ref>. This was later rectified and the train was re-added in September, until it was finally made admin-only again in Version 1.0.
== Trivia == * This was the first non-steam train in game to have a full proper working interior. * Driving it usually causes lag spikes for the driver only. * The train is powered by electric overhead lines, even though there is no overhead line equipment in the game. *The sound of the train is exactly the same to the [[Class 91]].
== Gallery == [[Category:Trains]] [[Category:Admin Only]]

<tabber> |-| Crocs CountryX = {{Class43 CrocsCountryX}} |-| Virquin = {{Class43 Virquin}} |-| Track Inspection = {{Class43 Track Inspection}} </tabber>
<!-- Nested Templates are used. for infoboxes !--> == Trivia== *The Virquin and the CrocsCountry classes spawn on the same platform at [[Masonfield]], though at different sections of the same platform. ** The Track inspection can only be inserted, as it is not in game files. *[[wikipedia:God Save the King|The British National Anthem - God Save the King]] is coded into the Class 43 Track Inspection.
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Class 43 at Pallion.png|Class 43 HST waiting at Pallion Harbour to enter Dovedale Central. File:DE Class 43 Zoomed.png|Class 43 at the old Dovedale East Station before Version 1.0. File:Class43DepartDE.png </gallery> [[Category:Trains]]
== References ==

{{Train | image1= <gallery> File:37 sneak peek.png|Exterior File:37 cab view.png|Front Cab View File:37 back cab view.png|Back Cab View </gallery>
| top_speed=80 mph | powered_by=Diesel | spawn_points= Admin Only Spawn | coaches= Any number of [[Mark 1]] coaches | doors= 4 | status=Admin Only | date_added=Unknown }}
The '''Class 37''' is an admin-only diesel locomotive with a top speed of 80 mph. It spawns via commands at a point near the [[Docks]]. For ideal operations, it should be coupled with a (few) [[Mark 1]] coaches to carry passengers.
With Version 1.0, the Class 37 was not updated to the new gauge, although it can be spawned and driven to an extent.
== Gallery ==
<gallery> File:37 demo 2|Sneak peek of the Class 37. The UI is incorrect. File:37skeap peek2.png|Class 37 at the old [[Satus Services]] File:37 sneak peek.png|A Sneak peek in photo form. Class37 DE Night.png|Class 37 at the new [[Dovedale East]]. </gallery>
== Trivia == * The Class 37 was one of the few trains that could be turned around safely anywhere without derailing, as it is only formed of one 'part'. This however changed with the refurbished 'Swap Sides' system introduced in Update 1.0.
== References== [[Category:Locomotives]] [[Category:Trains]] [[Category:Admin Only]]
