revision.text:
'''Trains''' are the main way players get around the map. The following is a list of all trains in the game. Some trains are currently restricted to certain users (admins), as they are unstable. Most of the admin-only trains are planned to be eventually released, once they become more stable.
== List of Trains==
{| class="sortable mw-collapsible fandom-table" !Train Name !Variant !Image !Number of Coaches !Max Speed (mph) !Status/Availability !Interior !Spawn Location(s) !Family !Propulsion |- | rowspan="2" |[https://dovedale.wiki/Steam_Train '''Steam Train'''] |[https://dovedale.wiki/Steam_Train Steam Train] |[[File:Steamer front.png|200px]] | rowspan="2" |1 |30 | rowspan = "2" style="background-image: linear-gradient(to left, gray 50%, #1e0c1b)" |Removed (Display only) | rowspan = "3" style="background-image: linear-gradient(to right, green , #1e0c1b)" | Yes |[https://dovedale.wiki/Railway_Museum Railway Musuem (on display)] | rowspan="2" |Unknown | rowspan="2" |Steam |- |[https://dovedale.wiki/Red_Steamer Red Steamer]

= Disambiguation page for Lighthouse (Station) = The following is a list of links to pages that might share the same title. Please follow one of the disambiguation links below or search to find the page you were looking for if it is not listed. If an internal link led you here, you may wish to change the link to point directly to the intended article.
* [[Lighthouse (Station)]] - The out of service station, serving the Lighthouse. * [[Lighthouse (Structure)]] - The page for the physical lighthouse structure near Pallion Harbour, Dovendale Central and Gleethrop End. [[Category:Disambiguations]]

revision.comment: use capital letters + removed unfinished sentence
revision.text:
[[Category:Stations]] {{Disambiguation|link to the alternate page=[[Lighthouse_(Structure)|Lighthouse (Structure)]]}} {{Station |image1= <gallery> File:Lighthouse Station Day.jpg|Day File:Lighthouse Station Night.png|Night File:Lighthouse Station Platform View.jpg|Platform view </gallery> |preceding_other=Previously [[Dovedale Central]] |following_other= Terminus |singal_box= None |preceding_steam=No Operation |following_steam=No Operation |station_code= LH |number_of_platforms= 1 |number_of_tracks= 1 |dispatching= No }}
'''Lighthouse station''' is a disused station in the game. Prior to the [[Dovedale Central]] revamp, the station was accessible by admins only, or for regular users with the help of admins to flip a switch under the map. After the revamp, the station was physically disconnected from the system, with only its tracks and station structure left.
In Version 1.0, the whole station was put in a state of disuse, with rusting signals, and outdated tracks.
== Trivia == * This is only station to be closed on the line, with a physical station structure.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Lighthouse Station Winter.jpg|The abandoned station during winter File:lighthouse station day.png|Old Lighthouse Station in Version 7072 (Day) File:lighthouse_station.png|Old Lighthouse Station in Version 7072 (Night) </gallery>

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:Pallion Harbour.jpg|Day File:Pallion Harbour Night.png|Night File:Pallion Harbour Station Building.jpg|Cabin |preceding_other=[[Dovedale Central]] |following_other=[[Masonfield]] |preceding_steam=No Operation |following_steam=No Operation |singal_box=[[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] and [[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]] |station_code=PH |number_of_platforms=2 |number_of_tracks=2 |dispatching=None }} Pallion Harbour is a station in the game ==Tracks==
'''2''' - Through Services towards [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Masonfield Masonfield]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''1''' - Through Services towards [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Signals Dovedale Central]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
* Platform 2 - Signal DC 31 * Platform 1 - Signal MC 01 ==Trivia== *For a day after the update, there was a signal that could not be changed. It was replaced by DCL1. *An admin switch exists under the map to switch DC point 6, near this station. *Nearby was a [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Turntables Turntable] that was not regularly in use, with a line that branched out to nowhere. *The Turntable was impossible to get to without administrator permissions. *Previously, a switch track was located just before signals DCN2 and DCA4, allowing for services to switch sides if they are turning from [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Masonfield Masonfield], which had no place to switch tracks.

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:Masonfield Platform View.jpg|Day File:Masonfield Platform View Night.png|Night File:Masonfield Station Building.png|Station building File:Masonfield Signal Box v1.2.jpg|Signal box |preceding_other=[[Pallion Harbour]] |following_other=Terminus |Signal_box= [[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]] |station_code= MS |number_of_platforms= 3 |number_of_tracks= 4 |dispatching= No }} '''Masonfield''' is the terminal station for all services from [[Fanory Mill]]. It houses three platforms, a station building and a ticket counter. The nearby sidings also hold the [[Class 43]] and [[Class 158|Class 158 ('Saltire' livery)]] spawn points, as well as the spawn points for a few other admin trains. The station can get regularly busy and chaotic, especially since [[Masonfield Signal Box]] is often unmanned. In version 1.2, the station was updated. Platform roofs, an overpass and a station building were added, and more equipment was added to the platforms. Past the station, an extension is planned and being developed. https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1114201706650140692/1153803039879200818 == Tracks ==
'''4''' - Through Services (towards [[Fanory Mill]])
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''3''' - Terminating Services (from [[Fanory Mill]]), [[Class 43]] Spawn
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''2''' - Through Services (towards ''unknown''), [[Class 158]] Spawn
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
'''1''' - Terminating Services (from [[Fanory Mill]])
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Sidings == The centre track and the track with the Class 158 spawner are controlled by a ground frame that can be unlocked from the [[Masonfield Signal Box]].
[[Class 43]] Spawner
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
Unknown
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
[[Class 158]] Spawner
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
==Trivia== *Terminating services from [[Fanory Mill]] previously couldn't turn around at [[Masonfield]]. Their only option was to continue until [[Pallion Harbour]] and turn there, which could cause issues with congestion and signalling. *The switch for Platform 2 and 3 used to be located a few meters up in the air. *Prior to V1.0, The [[Class 91]] spawned in at Platform 3 using admin commands, while both of the [[Class 43]]s and the older version of the [[Class 37]] spawned in at Platform 2. **Currently the [[Class 43]] (Track 3) and [[Class 158]] (Track 2) can be spawned at the sidings which are further down Tracks 2 & 3. *Before version 1.2, the station was generally barren, with only a few benches on the platforms and an abandoned steam train in one of the sidings. ==Gallery== File:Masonfield Station Entrance.png|The entrance of the station. File:Masonfield New.jpg|Masonfield Station seen from its signal box. File:Masonfield Winter.jpg|The station during winter. File:Masonfield Platform View Winter.jpg|Platform view during winter. File:Old Masonfield with Countdown.png|Old Masonfield, with a countdown timer to the Version 1.0 update. File:Mason extension.png|The unfinished extension beyond Masonfield. File:Masonfield Abandoned Steam Train.png|The abandoned steam train near platform 1. File:MS sunset.png|Masonfield during sunset. ==References==

{{Train | image1= <gallery> File:Steamer front.png|Front File:steamer side.png|Side </gallery> | top_speed=30sps | powered_by=Steam & Coal | spawn_points=[[Satus Services]] (removed) | coaches=[[Steam Carriage]] | doors=0 (Open air) | date_added=Unknown | date_removed=Unknown | status=Removed }}
The '''Steam Train''' is the most basic class of train in the game, which can no longer be spawned by the general public, previously only at the sidings at [[Satus Services]]. With a top speed of 30sps, it was the slowest type of train in the game.
Players could attach small coaches that house two people to the trains. As coaches have to be attached to a main unit, the only way to change directions were shunting at [[Dovedale East]] or [[Fanory Mill]].
The steamer was limited to driving between Fanory Mill and Dovedale East whilst it was still available, though it could physically run until [[Glassbury Junction]].
== Trivia == * While unlimited coaches can be attached, the steamer gets slower as more coaches are added. * The front smokebed door can be opened.
== References == [[Category:Locomotives]] [[Category:Trains]]

{{Train | image1=File:Class 156.png | caption-image1=A Class 156 at the old [[Dovedale Central]] | top_speed=60 mph | powered_by= Diesel | spawn_points=Previously [[Fanory Mill]], [[Dovedale Central]] and [[Dovedale East]], now impossible to spawn | coaches= 2 per set | doors= 8 per set | date_added=Unknown | status=Admin only }} The '''Class 156''' was an admin-only diesel multiple unit (DMU) in the sprinter family of trains with a top speed of 60 mph. It was formerly admin only<ref>https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1116458853610037298/1120434944389414922</ref> but was made public, prior to being removed.
The '''Class 156''' was spawnable at Platform 2 of [[Dovedale Central]], or on the sidings near the turntable at [[Fanory Mill]], both using admin commands. Two sets could be coupled up to form a double unit of 4 coaches, although this was not advisable as you couldn't turn around safely.
The train was retired during V1.0, and replaced with the [[Class 158]].
== Trivia == * The Class 156 was able to be coupled into a double unit. ** It was recommended to spawn them inside of one another without clipping, and then driving one set to 'couple' them. * The Class 156, along with the [[Class 150]] and [[Class 158]] are all the members of the Sprinter family of trains.
== Gallery == [[File:RobloxScreenShot20231015 181326511.png|thumb|156 longest train ]]
==References== [[Category:Trains]] [[Category:Admin Only]]
<references />

revision.text: <center> <choose uncached> <option> Holding 'E' zooms in your camera? </option> <option> The red box in [[Fanory Mill Signalling Box]] is a [[wikipedia:en:Token (railway signalling)|key-token instrument?]] </option> <option> There is a custom special van called the [[Dovedale Maintenance Van]]? </option> <option> Players can drive past [[Benyhone Loop]] to go see the in-development [[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]] station? </option> <option> [[Pallion Harbour]] is the only station controlled by two [[Signal Boxes]]? </option> <option> [[Lighthouse (Station)|Lighthouse Station]] is the only station to be ever physically disconnected but not removed? </option> <option> The disused lever 9 from the old [[Satus Signal Box]] can be found laying on the ground next to lever 1 of the [[Masonfield Signal Box]]? </option> <option> The gate near the [[Training Centre]] can only be opened via an admin command? </option> <option> There are only two testers in the game that have admin commands? </option> <option> The branch line from [[Marigot Crossing]] leads to an unnamed station? </option> <option> The line after [[Masonfield]] features an unfinished truss bridge? </option> <option> All radio [[Soundtracks]] are from Scott Bradlee's Postmodern Jukebox? </option> <option> The [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] charts were made by user @enews01? </option> <option> [[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]] is named after a real place in Wales? </option> <option> Before [[Benyhone Loop]] was added, [[Greenwood]] was to be on the line after [[Fanory Mill]]? </option> <option> For a short time, a [[Class 43]] spawner existed in the [[Fanory Mill]] sidings? </option> <option> Before version 1.0, there were three turntables in the game? </option> <option> [[Satus Services]] was the very first station to be added in game? </option> <option> [[Jaiden's House]] originated from a joke by BoyPro? </option> <option> There is a caf called [[Meow Caf]] in the [[Dovedale East]] and [[Masonfield]] stations? </option> <option> Parts of [[Dovedale Central]] are modelled after [[wikipedia:London King's Cross railway station|London King's Cross railway station]]? </option> <option> There is an abandoned [[Steam Train]] near platform 1 of [[Masonfield]]? </option> <option> There was a countdown timer to the v1.0 update at [[Masonfield]] before it was released? </option> <option> [[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]] uses the Route Relay Interlocking System? </option> <option> [[Cosdale Cabin]] is the only signal box to ever be removed from the game? </option> <option> The [[Railway Museum]] can be found in the [[Dovedale East]] station building? </option> <option> The [[Class 43]] comes in three different variants, but only one is publicly accessible? </option> <option> The [[Class 43]] was limited to 63 mph as of Version 1.1.4 to improve its stability? </option> <option> The [[Class 450]] is the first train to receive the [[Guarding Guide|Guard System]]? </option> <option> There are two variants of the [[Class 158]] that can be spawned at [[Dovedale Central]] and [[Masonfield]]? </option> <option> A line branches off at the [[Satus Services]] sidings? </option> <option> There is a 'King Lever' in the [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] that locks all levers and therefore all points and signals to their current status? </option> </choose> </center>

| usage=To load and unload cargo. | closest_station=[[Glassbury Junction]] }}
'''Cosdale Harbour''' is a harbour located near [[Dovedale East]] that trains will load cargo from ships at.
On 13 November 2023, the land was purchased by [[Satus Locomotive Services]], with plans to utilise the area for their yard operations. In Version 1.2, this was implemented with the [[SLS Maintenance Yard]].
This area was created by [[Staff/RAYE|RAYE]].
== Trivia == * Cosdale Harbour was planned to have freight trains coming here to pick up freight<ref> https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1114201706650140692/1149741705432666132 </ref>. However, this was never implemented in the game.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Docks Night.png|The old harbour at night. File:Future freight at docks.png|A train rake at the old harbour. File:Image37 at docks.png|A [[Class 37]] at the old harbour. File:Atdockstunnel.png|A tunnel at the old harbour. File:Docks Night.png|Old harbour during night. File:Docks misty.png|Old harbour during day. File:Cosdale Harbour Winter.png|Cosdale Harbor during winter. </gallery> [[Category:Landmarks]] == References == <references />

[[Category:Level Crossings]] {{Crossing | image1= <gallery> File:Steynbath Crossing Exeterior.png|Exterior File:Steynbath Crossing Hut Exterior.png|Cabin Area File:Steynbath Crossing Hut Interior.png|Cabin Interior </gallery> | singal_box=[[Satus Signal Box]]/Steynbath Crossing Hut | tracks=1 | road_lanes=1 | gate_operation=Manual | crossing_code=SC | nearest_station=[[Steynbath Halt]] & [[Satus Services]] | xp_requirment=100 }}
'''Steynbath Crossing''' was a small crossing located just after [[Satus Services]], and situated nearby [[Steynbath Halt]].
It had the lowest XP entry requirement in the game, 100XP, which made it a great starting point for many novice players, with its function of levers, communication and crossing operation. The crossing was removed in Version 1.0 and replaced with the [[Satus Level Crossing]].
== Operations == === How to Operate === Below is a guide on how to operate the crossing. Ensure to turn on automatic operations when leaving the box, and nobody is available to takeover.
[[File:SC Crossing Operations.png|663x663px]] ===Sequence=== The operations sequence is as follows: #Receive a bell from [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] or [[Satus Signal Box]] about an incoming train. #Set Signals 1&2 accordingly. #Close the gates to allow trains to pass. #Ring the warning bell. #Once trains have passed, bell the appropriate box or centre. #Open the gates to traffic and turn off the warning bell.
===Bell Codes=== '' See more at [[Bell Codes]]'' {| class="fandom-table" !Beat !Meaning |- |1 |Call Attention |- |1-2 |Freight Train Inbound |- |1-3 |Passenger Train Inbound |- |1-4 |Other train type inbound |- |2-1-3 |Train Arrived |- |2-2 |Acknowledge Train |- |5-2 |Signal Defective |- |5-5-5 |Opening of crossing box |- |6 |Obstruction danger |- |9 |Train passed without tail lamp |- |(Call)-Pause-2 |Fast |- |Rapid Beats in Succession |Emergency |}
==Trivia==
==References==

[[Category:Level Crossings]] {{Crossing | image1= <gallery> File:Narmouth Crossing.png|Day File:Narmouth Crossing Night.png|Night File:Fanory Mill Crossing Operations Panel.jpg|Crossing Operations Panel at FM </gallery> | singal_box=[[Fanory Mill Signal Box]] | tracks=2 | road_lanes=2 | gate_operation=By [[Fanory Mill Signal Box]] | crossing_code=NM | nearest_station=[[Fanory Mill]] | xp_requirment=1000XP }}
'''Narmouth Crossing''' is a railway crossing on the line between [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Benyhone Loop]]. Whilst it was originally planned to be a semi - automatic crossing, it has been changed to be manually operated as of 14 September 2023. <!-- references? !-->
== Operations ==
The crossing is controlled by [[Fanory Mill Signal Box]] and can be operated using the Crossing Operations Panel that is located there.
== Trivia ==
* A currently unused track diverts from the line on the crossing.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Narmouth Crossing Winter.png|The new Narmouth Crossing during winter. File:Narmouth fanory view.png|An old version of the crossing. </gallery>
== References ==

[[Category:Level Crossings]] {{Crossing | image1= <gallery> File:Dovedale East Crossing.jpg|Day File:DE Crossing Night.png|Night File:Dovedale East Crossing Controller.png|Crossing Operations Box File:Placeholder.png|Operations Map </gallery> | singal_box=[[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] | tracks=2 | road_lanes=Unknown | gate_operation=Semi-Automatic | crossing_code=Unknown | nearest_station=[[Dovedale East]] | xp_requirment= 2000XP
}}
'''Dovedale East Crossing''' is a railway crossing located between [[Dovedale East]] and [[Dovedale Central]]. It is operated by the [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]].
== Operations ==
== Trivia ==
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Dovedale East Crossing Winter.png|The crossing during winter. File:Dovedale East Crossing Winter 2.jpg|Another view of the crossing during winter. </gallery>
== References ==

revision.text: <image source="image1"> <caption source="caption-image1"/> </image> <data source="seats"> <label>Seats</label> </data> <data source="spawns_at"> <label>Spawns at</label> </data> <data source="doors"> <label>Doors</label> </data> <data source="coupled_with"> <label>Coupled With</label> </data> <data source="status"> <label>Admin/Public?</label> </data> </infobox> </includeonly> <noinclude> Example usage: <pre> {{Coach | title1=Example | image1=Example | caption-image1=Example | seats=Example | spawns_at=Example | doors=Example | coupled_with=Example | status=Example }} </pre> <templatedata> {"params":{"title1":{"suggested":true},"image1":{"suggested":true},"caption-image1":{"suggested":true},"seats":{"suggested":true},"spawns_at":{"suggested":true},"doors":{"suggested":true},"coupled_with":{"suggested":true}},"sets":[],"maps":{}} </templatedata> </noinclude>

{{Coach |title1 = Mark 1 (Mk1) | image1= <gallery> File:mk1 exterior.png|Exterior File:Mk1 interior LIGHT.png|Light Interior File:mk1 interior dark.png|Dark Interior </gallery> | seats=32 | spawns_at=[[Docks]] | doors=5 (Excluding Gangway Doors) | coupled_with=[[Class 37]] | status=Removed }}
The '''Mark 1''' was a blue and white coach with ample space for passenger seating, ideally meant to be coupled with the [[Class 37]] for passenger operations. Prior to being removed, it was one of the largest capacity trainsets in the game, having space for 32 passengers inside.
Alongside with the [[Class 37]], the Mark 1 coach spawned nearby at [[Cosdale Harbour]].
Due to it not having couplers, it could not be coupled to any locomotive without the assistance of a developer.
== Trivia == *This was the only type of carriage to have an odd number of doors.
[[Category:Carriages]] [[Category:Admin Only]]

revision.text:
{{Coach |title1 = Steam Carriage | image1= File:Steam Carrige.png|The Carrige | seats=4 | spawns_at= N/A
(formerly [[Satus Services]]) | doors=N/A | coupled_with=[[Steam Train]] | status=Removed }} The '''Steam Carriage''' was a simple blue carriage that seated four people - 2 at each section, and was pulled along by the [[Steam Train]]. The carriage had a wooden stepping up area that allowed people to easily get on, and two parallel wooden benches inside for seating. It also had a delete button allowing people to directly delete it with a few clicks. It was removed in the V1.0 update, alongside the [[Steam Train]], and all steam train services. Before it was removed, it could only be spawned at [[Satus Services]], and was only permitted to run between [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Dovedale East]], although it physically could run until [[Glassbury Junction]]. [[Category:Carriages]]

{{Train |title1 = Class 43 CrocsCountry | image1= <gallery> File:43 cross country front view.png|Front View File:CrocsCountry Livery.png|Coaches </gallery> | top_speed=100 mph (Limited to 63 mph) | powered_by=Diesel-Electric | spawn_points= Masonfield | coaches=4 | doors=24 | status=Public | date_added=Unknown }}
The '''Class 43 CrocsCountry''' is a fairly recent addition to the game, with it previously being locked to admin only access. It is a high speed train, with the highest top speed of any public train in the game, clocking a maximum of 100 mph. The CrocsCountry livery comes from the real life operator, CrossCountry which formerly operated the same trains on their intercity routes.
Aside from the paintjob and livery being different, there are no differences between the three liveries of the Class 43.
This train was known for being very unstable and derailing randomly even at low speeds. As of Version 1.1.4, the maximum speed of the Class43 CrocsCountry has been limited to 63 mph and its stability has been improved.<ref>https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1113532700121378899/1192166544944406710</ref>

revision.text:
{{Train |title1=Class 43 Virquin | image1= <gallery> File:Vqfront.png|Front View File:Vqsign.png|Coaches </gallery> | top_speed=100 mph | powered_by=Diesel | spawn_points=Masonfield | coaches=4 | doors=14 | status=Admin only | date_added=Unknown }} The '''Class 43 Virquin''' is an admin-only train in the game which was previously public. The Virquin livery comes from the real life operator, VirginTrains which operates the same trains.
Aside from the paintjob and livery being different, there are no differences to the CrocsCountry variant of the Class 43.

[[Category:Shunting Cabins]] {{SignalBox |image1 = <gallery> File:cosdale outside.png|Exterior File:cosdale inside.png|Interior File:Cosdale_2.png|Charts </gallery> |stations_controlled=[[Dovedale East]] [[Steam Train]] shunt area |nearest_station=[[Dovedale East]] |signal_type=Semaphore Signals |xp_requirment=300XP}}
'''Cosdale Cabin''' was a switching room located in [[Dovedale East]]. It controlled the switches for the terminating area for [[Steam Train|Steam trains]] at [[Dovedale East]]. The cabin had 5 switches, each with interlocks. Inside the cabin, there was a radio playing [[Soundtracks|music]], a small lamp as well as a map placed on the ledge, and a chart with the location of switches and the tracks displayed on that chart.
During September 2023, a series of updates were implemented onto the cabin, like adding a protective lever box, removing clutter and adding a chart to guide players routing trains. There were no signals or shunt signals included in the Cabin.
Cosdale Cabin was removed along with [[Steam Train|Steam Trains]] and their shunting area in version 1.0.
Since March of 2024, there has been a ground frame located near the place where Cosdale Cabin used to be. Known as the SLS Ground Frame, it can be considered a "replacement" to Cosdale Cabin, as there is a new branch that leads to [[SLS Maintenance Yard]] and the former [[Cosdale Harbour]] area.
== Trivia == * The tracks that Cosdale Cabin controlled also had shunt signals, although these were not yet operational. * This was the smallest Signal Box or 'Switch room' in the game. * As of version 1.1, this is the only signal box to ever be removed from the game.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Cosdale outside.png|The outside of Cosdale Cabin. File:Cosdale inside.png|The interior of Cosdale Cabin. File:Cosdale 2.png|The charts inside Cosdale Cabin to guide players using the switches. </gallery>

revision.text:
[[Category:Signal Boxes]] {{SignalBox |image1 = <gallery> File:Fanory Mill Signal Box v1.2.png|Exterior (day) File:Fanory Mill Signal Box Night.png|Exterior (night) File:Fanory Mill Signal Box Interior.jpg|Interior File:Fanory Mill Signal Board.png|Board </gallery> |stations_controlled=[[Fanory Mill]] |crossings_controlled=[[Narmouth Crossing]] |nearest_station=[[Fanory Mill]] |signal_type=[[Signalling Guide|Semaphore Signals]] |home_signals_controlled=12 |distant_signals_controlled=4 |points_controlled=6 |shunt_signals_controlled=6 |xp_requirment=1000XP}}
The '''Fanory Mill Signal Box''' is a signal box that players unlock at 1000XP. It controls the [[Fanory Mill]] station and its sidings which house the [[Class 377]] spawner, as well as parts of the lines leading to the adjacent signal boxes. The region the box controls is located between [[Satus Services]] and [[Benyhone Loop]].
This signal box mainly gets traffic from its spawner sidings and from Satus Services, depending on the player count. Trains from Benyhone Loop are rarely seen due to there being no public train spawners on the line from Benyhone Loop to [[Abermoore]].
==Trivia== *Fanory Mill Signal Box was previously statistically rated as one of the most hard-to-operate signal boxes. This was due to there being no identification on the levers or switches. *Fanory Mill Signal Box was also rated one of the most boring signal boxes to be operated. This is due to the Signal box being situated on the end of the line. *Fanory Mill had a [[Turntables|Turntable]] that players were able to use in the Fanory Mill sidings. *[[Class 377]]<nowiki/>s spawning at Fanory Mill sidings often SPAD due to many inexperienced drivers spawning trains there.
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Fanory Mill Signal Box Interior Night.jpg|The interior of the box at night File:Fanory Mill Signal Box Winter.jpg|The signal box during winter </gallery>
===Old versions of the box=== <gallery> File:Fanory box.png|The exterior of Fanory Mill Signal Box File:Fanory Signal Close up exterior.png|The entrance to Fanory Mill Signal Box. File:Fanory turntable.png|The Fanory Turntable File:Fanory crossing box and cam.png|Fanory Mill Signal Box crossing controls File:Fanory Mill Levers2.png|The switch levers with edited identification at Fanory Mill Signal Box. </gallery>

[[Category:Signal Boxes]] {{SignalBox |image1 = <gallery> File:Marigot Crossing Signal Box.png|Exterior File:Marigot Crossing Signal Box Interior.jpg|Interior File:Marigot Crossing Wheel.png|Wheel </gallery> |stations_controlled= |crossings_controlled=[[Marigot Crossing]] |nearest_station=[[Pallion Harbour]], [[Masonfield]] |signal_type=Semaphore Signals |xp_requirment=5000XP}}The '''Marigot Crossing Signal Box''' is a signal box that is based next to the [[Marigot Crossing]] between [[Pallion Harbour]] and [[Masonfield]]. It houses around 13 Stop Semaphore Signals and 3 Distant Semaphore Signals. Additionally, Marigot Crossing can be controlled by this box using a wheel. To use it, signallers must use the proximity prompts by holding R to close and F to open the crossing.
While Marigot Crossing Signal Box box controls platform 2 of Pallion Harbour, platform 1 is controlled by [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]].
The box will sometimes receive traffic from incoming [[Class 43|Class 43 HSTs]] and [[Class 158]]s travelling from Masonfield towards [[Dovedale Central]]. There is less traffic in the other direction due to the big distance to the [[Fanory Mill|Fanory Mill Sidings]] which house the only spawner facing that direction.
== Route Relay Interlocking System == Marigot Crossing Signal Box is the only box in the game that uses the Route Relay Interlocking System (see section 2.2 of the [[Signalling Guide]]).
[[File:Route Relay Interlocking System marigot.png|none|thumb|The signalling table of the Marigot Crossing Signal Box.]]
== <big>Trivia</big> ==
* Marigot Crossing Signal Box is known for having a quiet atmosphere due to the lack of traffic that is present, apart from Class 43 HSTs and Class 158s coming from [[Masonfield]]. * Only the entry signal of platform 1 and the exit signal of platform 2 at [[Pallion Harbour]] are controlled by this signal box. Both other signals at Pallion Harbour are controlled by [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]]. * The Marigot Crossing Signal Box has an XP requirement of 5000, making it the box with the highest amount of XP required. * Previously, there weren't any bells or block indicators at Marigot Crossing Signal Box which meant that signallers could only use chat to communicate with the adjacent signal boxes. This was later fixed.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Marigot Crossing 2.jpg|Marigot Crossing Signal Box exterior during the day. File:Marigot Crossing Signal Box Night.jpg|Marigot Crossing Signal Box during the night. File:Marigot Crossing Signal Box Interior.jpg|The interior of the Marigot Crossing Signal Box. File:Marigot Crossing Winter.png|Marigot Crossing and its signal box during winter. File:Marigot Crossings operation wheel.png|Old levers and the wheel of the Marigot Crossing Signal Box. File:Marigot Crossing Interior.png|Old interior of the Marigot Crossing Signal Box. File:Marigot Board.png|Old charts of the Marigot Crossing Signal Box. </gallery>

{{SignalBox |image1= <gallery> File:DEBox Daytime.png|Exterior File:DEBoxInterior.png|Interior File:Dovedale East Board.png|Board </gallery> |stations_controlled=[[Dovedale East]] |crossings_controlled=[[Dovedale East Crossing]] |nearest_station=[[Dovedale East]] |signal_type=[[Signalling Guide|Semaphore Signals]] |xp_requirment=2000XP}}The '''Dovedale East Signalling Centre (DESC)''' is the largest signal box in the game, housing around 26 Stop Semaphore Signals, 2 Distant Semaphore Signals, 16 shunt signals and 15 switches that control the [[Dovedale East]] station. While the [[Cosdale Coal Depot]] is in the area, it is no longer physically connected to the system, thus it is not controlled.
The box will usually see lots of traffic from [[Satus Services]] and [[Dovedale Central]]. Due to the line between Dovedale East and Satus Services only being single-track, trains often have to wait before proceeding to Satus Services. This can sometimes create queues at Dovedale East which often extend as far back as Dovedale Central.
Charts for the Signal Box can be found on the [[Charts|Charts page]].
== Operation == DESC controls the area between Dovedale Central and the Status West Single line.
=== Platforming === All platforms are signalled to be bi-directional. However, with platform 2 it's not recommended to send trains continuing through to Dovedale Central as they would be running on the wrong line. Each platform is its own individual 'Block' Between 2 signals. Permissive Working is technically possible if the person you're signalling knows what they're doing. Express services (Belled as 4) can mostly run through the bypass lines uninterrupted.
=== SPaD Countermeasures === While not technically having any trap or catch points, the crossovers Between the Bypass and Platforms can be used to catch SPaDders before they do any real harm. If a train has SPaD at Dovedale Central and they couldn't catch them there, points 10A/B can be used to catch them out
=== Block Indicators/Bells === DESC contains a block indicator and bell combo as well as the most detailed track circuits in the game so you can provide a good grasp of detail to the other signallers when they've got trains going to and from Dovedale East.
== Trivia ==
*Dovedale East Signal Box is statistically rated as the most busiest and most stressful signal box in the game, this is generally due to how chaotic it is trying to deal with all the traffic coming from Satus Services or [[Fanory Mill]], which include the [[Class 377]] and the [[Class 43]]. The signallers at this box also have to control the traffic from Dovedale Central, which include the Class 43, the [[Class 450]] and the [[Class 158]].
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Dovedale East Signalling Centre Winter.png|Dovedale East Signalling Centre during winter File:DE Box Interior Winter.jpg|The interior of the box during winter </gallery>
=== Old versions ===
<gallery> File:Trains at dove east.png|An admin controlled Class 91 and Class 43 at Dovedale East Station. File:DE Class 43 Zoomed.png|A Class 43 HST departing Dovedale East Station File:Class43ApprochDE.png|A Class 43 HST approaching Dovedale East on the up line towards Status Services. File:Class43DepartDE.png|A Class 43 HST waiting at danger signal E4 at Dovedale East towards Satus Services. File:SGatDE.png|A Qualified Signaller at Dovedale East Signalling Centre belling Satus Services Box. File:DELevers.png|Levers inside the Dovedale East Signalling Centre that used to operate the entrance to Dovedale East from Satus Services. File:DEB3SignalDE.png|A Semaphore home signal located outside of the Dovedale East Signalling Centre File:WaitingatsignalDE.png|A Class 323 waiting at a Semaphore home signal set to 'Danger'. File:Old DE Box.png|Interior of the older box. File:Old DE Box2.png|View of the box from the older [[Dovedale East]] station. File:DE Circuit Board.png|Old circuit board. File:DE Diagram Old.png|thumb|Old station diagram. </gallery> [[Category:Signal Boxes]]

[[Category:Signal Boxes]] {{SignalBox |image1 = <gallery> File:Satus Signal Box Outside.png|Exterior File:Satus Signal Box Interior.png|Interior File:Satus Signal Box Board.png|Board </gallery> |stations_controlled=[[Satus Services]], [[Jaiden's House]] |crossings_controlled=[[Satus Level Crossing]] |nearest_station=[[Satus Services]] |signal_type=Semaphore Signals |xp_requirment=750XP}}The '''Satus Signal Box''' is the first 'Real' Signal Box that players can unlock, housing around 15 Semaphore Stop Signals, 4 Distant Semaphore Signals, 5 Shunt Signals and 3 switches. It controls [[Satus Services]], [[Jaiden's House]], [[Steynbath Crossing]] and the entrance to [[Fanory Mill]]. The line which the box controls is almost entirely single track and traffic builds up easily due to the spawn points at [[Fanory Mill]], which often leads to the line being blocked to oncoming traffic from [[Fanory Mill]] or [[Dovedale East]].
With 750XP, it has the lowest XP requirement of all signal boxes.
== Trivia == * Satus Signal Box is statistically rated as the worst signal box in the game, this is generally due to how cyanotic it does trying to deal with all the steam trains trying to enter the mainline from the spawn point. * Satus Signal Box is rated as the best 'Real' Signal box to start in if anybody is new. * Satus signal box has a plaque dedicated to the grandfather of one of the games administrators, Coldy. * According to a sign on the front of it, the address of the signal box is "10 Satus View Drive".
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Satus Signal Box Winter.jpg|Satus Signal Box during winter File:Satus Signal Box Night.png|The exterior of Satus Signal Box at night </gallery>
=== Old versions of the box === <gallery> File:SatusSB outside.png|An old version of Satus Signal Box during the day. File:Satus signal box.png|The interior of Satus Signal Box. File:Satus platforms.png|Satus services platforms 1 and 2, controlled by Satus Signal Box. File:Satus Spawn Sidings.png|Satus spawn sidings. File:SatusTDEUs.png|Satus Services platform TDEU systems. File:Sat overview.png|An overview of Satus station and Signal Box. File:Old SAT Box1.png|View of the box from the station. File:Old SAT Box2.png|Old box block monitor panel. File:Old SAT Box3.png|The interior of the old box. File:Old SAT Box4.png|thumb|Old station layout board. </gallery>

'''Coaches''' are extra carriages that can be pulled by different locomotives. In the past, there were only two types of coaches in game, both of which have since been removed.
{| class="fandom-table" |+ !Name !Image !Coupled with !Gangway doors !Status !Spawn Location !Seats !Doors |- |[[Mark 1]] |[[File:Mk1 exterior.png|310px]] |[[Class 37]] | style="background-image: linear-gradient(to left, green , #1e0c1b)" |Yes | rowspan=2" style="background-image: linear-gradient(to right, gray , #1e0c1b)" |Removed |[[Docks]] |32 |5 |- |[[Steam Carriage]] |[[File:Steam Carrige.png|250px]] |[[Steam Train]] | style="background-image: linear-gradient(to left, #e73d3d , #1e0c1b)" |No |N/A |4 |N/A |} [[Category:Lists]]

A '''signal''' is a tool that displays an indication of the track status ahead for drivers. There are several types of signals listed below that can be found in game. All of the signals are controlled by [[Signal Boxes]]. Refer to the [[Signalling Guide]] to learn how to operate signal boxes. ==Semaphore Stop Signal== The main signal is the most basic type of stop signal. Drivers must not pass it without authority of the signaller. The clearance of a home signal proves that the route ahead is clear of all obstructions. [[File:Semaphore Signal Clear.webp|right|100px]] When cleared, main signals: * Tell the driver that they may proceed towards the next stop signal. * Are raised or lowered at a 45 degree angle. * Display a green light. [[File:Semaphore Signal Danger.webp|right|100px]] When at danger, Main signals: * Do not allow the driver to pass the signal. * Are horizontal; at a 90 degree angle. * Display a red light. Some home signals are provided with a white diamond sign on the post. These indicate that the presence of a train is repeated in the signal box, and drivers do not need to notify the signaller if they are waiting at it. ==Semaphore Distant Signal== Distant signals provide advanced warnings as to whether the next stop signals will be at danger or not. This is necessary due to the long breaking distance of trains. If the signal is at caution, you must slow down, expecting the next stop signal to be at danger. A semaphore distant signal applies to all signals until the next distant signal or until the end of the section that the signal box controls, not just the first one, so you must be prepared to stop at all other signals even if the first one is cleared. [[File:Distant Signal Clear.webp|right|120px]] When cleared, distant signals: * Inform the driver all associated stop signals are cleared, and there is no need to slow down. * Are raised or lowered at a 45 degree angle. * Display a green light. [[File:Distant Signal Caution.webp|right|120px]] When at caution, distant signals: * Inform the driver that they should expect one of the following stop signals to be at danger and must slow down. * Are horizontal; at a 90 degree angle. * Display a yellow light. === Fixed distant boards === [[File:Fixed.png|frameless]] At areas approaching a stop board, areas where a normal distant would almost never be in the off position or on the approach to an area you'd need to slow down, you may find a board with what appears to be a distant signal, fixed at caution. These boards should be treated as a distant signal displaying caution. == Semaphore Subsidiary Signal == [[File:FM03 siding singal.png|right|150px]] Subsidiary signals can be found alongside home signals. They allow the driver to proceed off the mainline into a siding or similar. When cleared, they allow drivers to pass the home signal and proceed ''as far as the line is clear, preparing to stop short of an obstruction.'' This means they can be used to signal trains into an occupied area''.'' When cleared, subsidiary signals: * Allow the driver to pass the main signal cautiously. * Are raised or lowered at a 45 degree angle. * Display a green light. When at danger the driver must obey the main home signal. Subsidiary signals: * Are horizontal; at a 90 degree angle. * Display a red light. ==Shunt Discs== Unlike other types of signal, shunt discs are ground mounted. They are generally found at the exit of sidings, stations or routes on the mainline against the normal direction of traffic. Unlike a home signal, shunt discs only allow a train to proceed ''as far as the line is clear, preparing to stop short of an obstruction'', so can be used to signal trains into an occupied area. [[File:Shunt Disc Clear.webp|right|120px]] When cleared, shunt discs: * Allow the driver to proceed at no more than 15 mph. * Are rotated 45 degrees. * Display a green light. [[File:Shunt Disc Danger.webp|right|120px]] When at danger, shunt discs: * Do not allow the driver to pass the signal. * Are horizontal. * Display a red light. == Semaphore Signals Out of Use (Removed) == [[File:Crossed out singal.png|right|150px]] If a semaphore signal is out of use, whether due to failure or not being in operation, they are provided with a cross. Crosses can be placed and removed by holding "E". Signals that are signed out of use are '''not''' to be obeyed. If they are accompanied by other signals that are in use, they '''must''' be obeyed. Signals in-game do not currently fail, so do not try to put crosses on signals. The ability to 'cross up' signals was removed in Version 1.2, as signals were reworked to no longer break in earlier versions. ==Banner Repeater Signals== [[File:repeaters and OFF indicator at MS.png|200px|right|A banner repeater at Masonfield]] [[File:OFF Banner.gif|right|OFF position]][[File:ON banner.gif|right|ON Position]] Where the sighting of a signal is adversely affected by curvature or an intervening over bridge or station canopy, etc., an extra signal called a Banner Repeater can be installed to give drivers of approaching trains an earlier view of the indication shown.
These are similar to semaphore distant signals. When a banner repeater is at its 'on' state, with a horizontal line, it can be passed, but indicates that the home signal ahead is at danger and must stop at the signal ahead. When a banner repeater is at its 'off' state, with a diagonal line, it can be passed, and indicates that the home signal ahead can be passed safely. There are two types of Banner Repeater Signals in the game, with one being digital, commonly found at stations, lit up on a dot matrix format, and the other being standard banner repeaters found on the line. Banner repeaters can be found in places like [[Masonfield]] and the track stretch nearby [[Jaiden's House]] Station. == OFF/CD/RA Indicators == ''Main page: [[Off Indicator]] '' File:Repeaters and OFF indicator at MS.png|An OFF indicator at Masonfield. File:OFF Sign.png|An OFF indicator showing OFF. File:CD RA Sign.png|OFF indicators showing CD and RA respectively. File:SatusTDEUs.png|The TDEU at [[Satus Services]]. [[Off Indicator|OFF Indicators]] are found at stations with dispatching capabilities, and used to inform the driver if they can move on from the station, and what to do. They are controlled by Train Dispatch Equipment Units (TDEU), which are usually at the side of the platform in blue. These are currently present at [[Masonfield]], [[Dovedale Central]] and [[Fanory Mill]], and could previously be found at [[Satus Services]] and [[Glassbury Junction]]. * An illuminated OFF indication means the associated signal is showing a proceed aspect, and they can proceed on. * An illuminated indication CD (close doors) is an instruction to close the train's power-operated doors. * An illuminated indication RA or R (right away) means that station duties are complete and the train may depart.
'''OFF''' - Signal ahead is clear
'''CD''' - Close Doors
'''RA''' - Right Away == SPAD Indicator == A SPAD indicator is a separate indicator which may be positioned after a main signal where there is a likelihood of a serious collision at a junction if a SPAD (signal passed at danger) occurs at the main signal. https://www.rssb.co.uk/standards-catalogue/CatalogueItem/RS521-Iss-6 They are normally unlit, but following a SPAD they display a steady red light between two flashing red lights arranged vertically. Any driver who sees a SPAD indicator illuminated must stop their train immediately and subsequently contact the signaller for further instructions, even if they can see that the signal pertaining to their line is showing a proceed aspect. SPAD indicators are mounted against a blue backplate and dot matrix lights. == References == [[Category:Features]]

revision.text:
'''OFF Indicators''' are designed to assist [[Dispatching Guide|dispatchers]] to relay information onto drivers. These indicators can now be found at [[Masonfield]], [[Dovedale Central]] and [[Fanory Mill]], and were formerly present at [[Satus Services]] and [[Glassbury Junction]]. Prior the V1.0, the indicators were controlled by Train Dispatch Equipment Units (TDEU), which are based on the units built by Dewhurst Ltd. They are now controlled automatically once a signal has been cleared, or via a small panel next to the train.
==Indicator States== OFF Indicators have two states, either blank or OFF. They are shown on the digital screen in a similar fashion to a dot matrix display.
When the display is blank, it means that the associated signal is at danger. An illuminated indication CD (close doors) is an instruction to close the train's power-operated doors. An illuminated indication RA or R (right away) means that station duties are complete, and the train may depart. ==Train Dispatch Equipment Units == Train Dispatch Equipment Units, or TDEUs were used to control the OFF indicator at the platform, and let the signaller know that the train is ready to start. They had a platform label at the top, and the previous version of them included a screen displaying the current state of the OFF Indicator, along with a panel to control the state of the OFF Indicator. These were present at [[Satus Services]] and [[Glassbury Junction]] before the TDEUs and OFF indicators were removed.
There were also TDEUs present at [[Dovedale Central]] and [[Gleethrop End]], and were solely used to indicate a TRTS to the signaller, and had an empty openable box.
There are TRTS buttons at [[Dovedale East]] platforms that notify the signaller of a TRTS, although these are not TDEUs.
== Gallery == === Current === <gallery> File:Dovedale Central TRTS Indicators.png|The TRTS indicators inside the [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]], which have a light and a bell, activating when the TRTS is operated. File:Dovedale East TRTS Indicator.png|A TRTS indicator in the [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]], with a light and a bell, activating when the TRTS is operated on the platform. File:Jen.jpg </gallery>
=== Removed === <gallery> File:SatusTDEUs.png|The previous TDEUs at Satus Services. File:PlatformOccupiedIndicator.png|The old platform indicators at Dovedale East Signalling Centre. File:GlassburyTDEU.png|The TDEU at the now removed [[Glassbury Junction]]. File:Gleethrop End TDEU.png|One of the two TDEUs at [[Gleethrop End]]. File:Dovedale Central TDEU.png|A TDEU at [[Dovedale Central]] (platform 4), with the box open. File:OFF Sign.png|An old OFF indicator showing OFF. File:CD RA Sign.png|an old OFF indicator showing CD and RA respectively. File:SatusTDEUs.png|The TDEU at the former [[Satus Services]]. File:GlassburyOFF.png|An Off Indicator in the OFF state at [[Glassbury Junction]]. </gallery> [[Category:Features]]

revision.text:
Hello, I am Logic. You probably know me as that guy who is an Administrator in Fourth Rail or as one of the Bureaucrats at the [https://britishrailway.fandom.com/wiki/British_Railway_Wiki British Railway Roblox wiki].
You will probably see me here once in a while making minor changes when I run out of stuff to update on the FR wikis.

revision.text:
[[Category:Signal Boxes]] {{SignalBox |image1 = <gallery> File:dc box outside.png|Exterior File:DC Signal Box Interior.jpg|Interior File:DC Signal Box Board.png|Board File:dc box walkway.png|Walkway </gallery> |stations_controlled=[[Pallion Harbour]], [[Gleethrop End]], [[Perthtyne]], [[Dovedale Central]] |crossings_controlled=N/A |nearest_station=[[Dovedale Central]] |signal_type=Semaphore Signals |home_signals_controlled='''35''' |distant_signals_controlled='''7''' |points_controlled='''10''' |shunt_signals_controlled='''12''' |xp_requirment=2000XP }}
The '''Dovedale Central Signal Box''' is the signal box controlling [[Dovedale Central]] as well as the areas around it, including the stations [[Gleethrop End]], [[Perthtyne]] and [[Pallion Harbour]] (platform 1 only). While the [[Lighthouse (Station)|Lighthouse Station]] is also located in the area, it is no longer physically connected to the system and thus not controlled since the Dovedale Central Update.
The box will usually see lots of traffic from incoming [[Class 43|Class 43 HST]]s and [[Class 158]]s from [[Masonfield]] which are travelling towards [[Fanory Mill]]. This can sometimes create traffic between the section from [[Marigot Crossing]] and [[Pallion Harbour]]. There is also usually some, but less trains down towards [[Gleethrop End]], [[Dovedale Central]] Terminating Platforms and [[Masonfield]].
Charts for the Signal Box can be found on the [[Charts|Charts page]].
== Operation == The Dovedale Central Signal box controls the area from the DE fringe at the [[Dovedale East Crossing]] and the [[Marigot Crossing Signal Box|Marigot Crossing]] Fringe at Pallion Harbor as well as the line to Perthtyne.
=== Platforming === Platforms 1 and 2 are for through trains to and from [[Masonfield]], while platforms 3 and 4 are for through trains towards [[Gleethrop End]] as well as Masonfield. Platforms 5-8 are terminating platforms, however they will require you to send the train down the wrong line to DE. If the driver is willing to cooperate, you can terminate them at platform 4, then turn them round there and use point 61 to make sure they're on the right side of the track.
=== SPaD Countermeasures === Trains that have spawned at DC can be stopped at points 11, 9 and 5. This is a relatively common occurrence due to the influx of new drivers spawning at DC. HSTs and Class 158s coming from Masonfield can be stopped at points 25/27 or points 5.
=== Block Indicators/Bells === The bell to the [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre|DESC]] is inside a combined instrument with the block indicators, however the Bell to MC is a separate instrument.
== Trivia == * This is the only box in the game with 'King Lever', a lever that locks all levers and therefore all points and signals to their current status. * Signal DCL1 was the most recent to be added to the box, controlling trains entering [[Dovedale Central]] from [[Pallion Harbour]]. * During the first few days, a few platforms (5&6) were not accessible due to track point bugs. This has since been fixed. * During the first few days since release, a few signals could not be changed - B1,C1,D1 etc. ** This has since been fixed. * Prior to Version 1.0, all DCA0 signals were not operational. They have all since been removed. * This is the only box in game that did not get majorly revamped in the Version 1.0 update. * Only the exit signal of platform 1 and the entry signal of platform 2 at [[Pallion Harbour]] are controlled by this signal box. Both other signals at Pallion Harbour are controlled by [[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]]. * Although [[Gleethrop Crossing]] is located in the area of the signal box, it is not controlled by it because it is automatic.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:DC Signal Box Board.png|The current version of the board. File:Dovedale Central Signal Box Winter.jpg|The box during the Winter 2023 Update. File:WinterDCBOx.png|The box during the Winter 2023 Update at night. </gallery>
=== Old versions of the box === <gallery> File:DC overview new.png|A fly by overview of the station. File:Old inaccurate board.png|The old, inaccurate board. This was released with many issues. File:DC Charts in box.png|A corrected board, made by [[User:Enewssg|enews]], that was removed in Version 1.0. File:Class 91 DC Box.png|A Class 91 passing near the box. File:DC Front Levers.png|Levers in the old Signal Box. File:Dc old bells and indicators.png|Bells and indicators in the old Signal Box. File:DC fireplace old.png|The old box fireplace. </gallery>

{{Place | image1= <gallery> File:Railway Museum Building.jpg|Outside File:Railway Museum Hallway.jpg|Hallway File:Railway Museum Interior.jpg|Inside File:STAFFROOMRAILWAYMUSEUM.png|Ticketing </gallery> | usage=Museum | closest_station=[[Dovedale East]] }} The '''Railway Museum''' is a museum located at [[Dovedale East]]. It documents the development history of the game and also shows off the equipment used to run it. It shares the Dovedale East station building with a ticket counter.
== Exhibits ==
* An old decommissioned [[Steam Train|steam train]] called Grace. * A station sign from the old Dovedale East that used to sit on the front of the old [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre|Dovedale East Signal box]]. * The [[Signalling Guide|Signalling Board]] from the old Dovedale East Signal box, in a poor condition. * The Museum of BALL, an tiny museum set up to preserve the BALL, an inside joke shared by some members of the community. Its origins are unknown according the plaques found inside the museum. * An example of one of the radios found in many signal boxes throughout the game. It does not play [[Soundtracks|music]]. * 2 signs from [[Satus Services]], one in pristine condition with the word "Engineering" on it and an orange colour-scheme, and the other that is incredibly rusty with the word "Diesel" on it and a blue colour-scheme. * A development timeline of the game documenting from the 3rd of January through to the end of August 2023. * Multiple pieces of signage from around the railway including 2 [https://www.railsigns.uk/sect13page3.html speed limit signs], a triangular [https://www.railsigns.uk/sect15page1.html whistle board] and a curved metal "Dovedale" sign. * Examples of [[Signals|distant signals]], [[Signals|Home signals]] and [[Signals|Shunt signals]] on a concrete platform. * A [[Off Indicator|platform TDEU]], which is a dispatching tool used to communicate with drivers by changing an [[Off Indicator|off indicator]] on the platform. * There are multiple images around the museum of old stations, one picture shows the old Dovedale East at night with full platforms, another shows the old [[Dovedale Central]] with a [[Class 156]] at it. The final image shows a steam train passing [[Steynbath Crossing]]. * A stand with a rotating display of the [https://www.roblox.com/groups/32670248/Dovedale-Community-Staff#!/store Dovedale Merchandise] and an option to buy it for your own [https://roblox.fandom.com/wiki/Avatar Roblox avatar].
== History == The original railway Museum was added to the game around May to June, 2023, and stood at the old Dovedale East station. It was much more simple then the one that stands today and had a lot less information and exhibits in it.
When Dovedale East received its big update, originally the Railway Museum wasn't at the station anymore and was removed from the game for a substantial amount of time. It wasn't until the 17th of September when the big Dovedale Central update released and the museum came back to the game. Since its release it hasn't had any major updates itself, although the ticket counter it shares the station building with got an updated interior on the 23rd of September.
== Trivia ==
* In the development history, one of the panels shows development being spelt wrong as "deveolopment" * The museum has existed for quite a while, but it was unable to be released due to unfinished work around the Dovedale Central update. * The Merchandise found here used to be in [[Cosdale Cabin|Cosedale Cabin]]. ** After the old museum was removed the developers needed to put the merchandise seller somewhere, so they put it in Cosedale Cabin. It was moved back into the museum when the new one was created. * The existence of Grace the steam engine suggests there could possibly be lore added to the game at a later date.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Railway Museum Night.png|The Railway Museum at night File:Railway Museum Winter.jpg|The Railway Museum during winter </gallery>
=== Old version of the railway museum === <gallery> File:Railstory outside (museum).png|The outside of the station building housing the museum as seen from the platform File:Railstoryinside.png|The interior of the Rail Story Museum File:Railstory outside.png|The main entrance of the Rail Story Museum File:Ticketing area de.png|The interior of the ticket counter found in the same building as the museum </gallery> [[Category:Landmarks]]

{{Place | image1=File:cosdale coal depot.png | usage=Coal Loading/ Shunting | closest_station=[[Dovedale East]] }}
The '''Cosdale Coal Depot''' is a landmark in the game. It is speculated to be a possible possible coal loading and unloading location, that will be integrated with the future freight line. It consists of a building, loading bridge, a roundabout track with a section in the middle, and many trees.
Trains can currently use this place to make a 'U-Turn' back to where they came from, if changing sides is not possible.
== Gallery ==
<gallery> File:Cosdale Coal Depot Winter.jpg|The abandoned Cosdale Coal Depot during winter </gallery> [[Category:Landmarks]]

== XP == '''XP''' is the main form of points/currency in the game. Players earn 1 XP for every 10 seconds of playing the game. <ref> [[File:XP Code (Improved).png|300px]] </ref> Players can also purchase 25, 50, 500 and 1000 XP for 15, 35, 300, 500 Robux respectively.
== List of XP Requirements==
All [[List of Signal Boxes|signal boxes]] require a certain amount of XP to be entered.
{| class="fandom-table" !Signal Box !XP requirement |- |[[Satus Signal Box]] |1250 |- |[[Fanory Mill Signal Box]] |1000 |- |[[Benyhone Loop Signal Box]] |1000 |- |[[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]] |2000 |- |[[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] |2000 |- |[[Masonfield Signal Box]] |3500 |- |[[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]] | 5000 |}
==Ranks==
'''Ranks''' are a way to show the achievements and skill level of players in the game. Ranks are automatically given to players, depending on their XP. The more XP earned, the higher the rank the user gets. The highest XP requirement for a rank is 60,000 XP.
Different from ranks are also roles, Like Testers, Moderators, Developers, and Head Developers. They are used to tell apart [[Project:Staff|Dovedale Staff]] from regular users.
==List of Ranks== {| class="fandom-table" !Name !XP required |- | style="background-color: #e69138;" |Trainee Driver |0 |- | style="background-color: #e69138;" |Qualified Driver |50 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Crossing Operator |100 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Senior Crossing Operator |200 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Shunter |300 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Senior Shunter |500 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Junior Signaller |750 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Experienced Signaller |850 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Senior Signaller |1,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Signalling Supervisor |2,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Station Manager |4,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Mobile Operations Manager <sub>Previously known as Mobile Operations Supervisor prior to V1.0</sub> |8,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Head Signaller |16,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Signalling Director | 32,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Network Supervisor | 40,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Network Manager | 50,000 |- | style="background-color: #ff6161;" |Network Director |60,000 |}
== References== [[Category:Features]]
<references />

{{Station |image1= <gallery> File:greenwood overview.png|Overview File:greenwood closeup.png|Closeup </gallery>
|preceding_other=No Operation |following_other=No Operation |preceding_steam=Terminus |following_steam=[[Fanory Mill]] |singal_box=N/A |station_code=GW |number_of_platforms= 2 |number_of_tracks= 5 |dispatching= No }}
'''Greenwood''' was a station that was planned to come after [[Fanory Mill]], evident by old maps. In Version 7072, it had a few lines branching out, with no structure or baseplate. It was completely removed in Version 1.0, and its place was taken by the [[Benyhone Loop]] in Version 1.1.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:GW1.png|A view of the planned station from [[Fanory Mill]]. File:GW2.png|thumb|An overview of the station from a very old<ref>https://www.roblox.com/games/15476910702/Dovedale-Railway-Classic</ref> version of the game. </gallery> == References == [[Category:Stations]]

revision.text: The following is a list of all of the past and present '''Level Crossings''' featured in the game. Level crossings are intersections between roads and train tracks where cars can safely run over train tracks if there is no train crossing. Trains take priority over cars, while cars have to wait for the train(s) to pass. All level crossings in the game are equipped with gates (With one exception being [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Perthtyne Crossing Perthtyne Crossing]). They are controlled by the crossing operator, which is usually the section signaller. Before it was removed, [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Steynbath Crossing Steynbath Crossing] was controlled by a separate person. {| class="fandom-table" !Image !Crossing !Signal Box !Preceding Station !Following Station !Status |- |[[File:Masonfield Crossing.png|250px]] |[https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Masonfield_Crossing Masonfield Crossing] |[https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Masonfield Signal Box revision.text:
-- Function allowing for consistent treatment of boolean-like wikitext input. -- It works similarly to the template {{yesno}}.
return function (val, default) -- If your wiki uses non-ascii characters for any of "yes", "no", etc., you -- should replace "val:lower()" with "mw.ustring.lower(val)" in the -- following line. val = type(val) == 'string' and val:lower() or val if val == nil then return nil elseif val == true or val == 'yes' or val == 'y' or val == 'true' or val == 't' or val == 'on' or tonumber(val) == 1 then return true elseif val == false or val == 'no' or val == 'n' or val == 'false' or val == 'f' or val == 'off' or tonumber(val) == 0 then return false else return default end end

revision.text:
-- This module provides easy processing of arguments passed to Scribunto from -- #invoke. It is intended for use by other Lua modules, and should not be -- called from #invoke directly.
local libraryUtil = require('libraryUtil') local checkType = libraryUtil.checkType
local arguments = {}
-- Generate four different tidyVal functions, so that we don't have to check the -- options every time we call it.
local function tidyValDefault(key, val) if type(val) == 'string' then val = val:match('^%s*(.-)%s*$') if val == '' then return nil else return val end else return val end end
local function tidyValTrimOnly(key, val) if type(val) == 'string' then return val:match('^%s*(.-)%s*$') else return val end end
local function tidyValRemoveBlanksOnly(key, val) if type(val) == 'string' then if val:find('%S') then return val else return nil end else return val end end
local function tidyValNoChange(key, val) return val end
local function matchesTitle(given, title) local tp = type( given ) return (tp == 'string' or tp == 'number') and mw.title.new( given ).prefixedText == title end
local translate_mt = { __index = function(t, k) return k end }
function arguments.getArgs(frame, options) checkType('getArgs', 1, frame, 'table', true) checkType('getArgs', 2, options, 'table', true) frame = frame or {} options = options or {}
--[[ -- Set up argument translation. --]] options.translate = options.translate or {} if getmetatable(options.translate) == nil then setmetatable(options.translate, translate_mt) end if options.backtranslate == nil then options.backtranslate = {} for k,v in pairs(options.translate) do options.backtranslate[v] = k end end if options.backtranslate and getmetatable(options.backtranslate) == nil then setmetatable(options.backtranslate, { __index = function(t, k) if options.translate[k] ~= k then return nil else return k end end }) end
--[[ -- Get the argument tables. If we were passed a valid frame object, get the -- frame arguments (fargs) and the parent frame arguments (pargs), depending -- on the options set and on the parent frame's availability. If we weren't -- passed a valid frame object, we are being called from another Lua module -- or from the debug console, so assume that we were passed a table of args -- directly, and assign it to a new variable (luaArgs). --]] local fargs, pargs, luaArgs if type(frame.args) == 'table' and type(frame.getParent) == 'function' then if options.wrappers then --[[ -- The wrappers option makes Module:Arguments look up arguments in -- either the frame argument table or the parent argument table, but -- not both. This means that users can use either the #invoke syntax -- or a wrapper template without the loss of performance associated -- with looking arguments up in both the frame and the parent frame. -- Module:Arguments will look up arguments in the parent frame -- if it finds the parent frame's title in options.wrapper; -- otherwise it will look up arguments in the frame object passed -- to getArgs. --]] local parent = frame:getParent() if not parent then fargs = frame.args else local title = parent:getTitle():gsub('/sandbox$', '') local found = false if matchesTitle(options.wrappers, title) then found = true elseif type(options.wrappers) == 'table' then for _,v in pairs(options.wrappers) do if matchesTitle(v, title) then found = true break end end end
-- We test for false specifically here so that nil (the default) acts like true. if found or options.frameOnly == false then pargs = parent.args end if not found or options.parentOnly == false then fargs = frame.args end end else -- options.wrapper isn't set, so check the other options. if not options.parentOnly then fargs = frame.args end if not options.frameOnly then local parent = frame:getParent() pargs = parent and parent.args or nil end end if options.parentFirst then fargs, pargs = pargs, fargs end else luaArgs = frame end
-- Set the order of precedence of the argument tables. If the variables are -- nil, nothing will be added to the table, which is how we avoid clashes -- between the frame/parent args and the Lua args. local argTables = {fargs} argTables[#argTables + 1] = pargs argTables[#argTables + 1] = luaArgs
--[[ -- Generate the tidyVal function. If it has been specified by the user, we -- use that; if not, we choose one of four functions depending on the -- options chosen. This is so that we don't have to call the options table -- every time the function is called. --]] local tidyVal = options.valueFunc if tidyVal then if type(tidyVal) ~= 'function' then error( "bad value assigned to option 'valueFunc'" .. '(function expected, got ' .. type(tidyVal) .. ')', 2 ) end elseif options.trim ~= false then if options.removeBlanks ~= false then tidyVal = tidyValDefault else tidyVal = tidyValTrimOnly end else if options.removeBlanks ~= false then tidyVal = tidyValRemoveBlanksOnly else tidyVal = tidyValNoChange end end
--[[ -- Set up the args, metaArgs and nilArgs tables. args will be the one -- accessed from functions, and metaArgs will hold the actual arguments. Nil -- arguments are memoized in nilArgs, and the metatable connects all of them -- together. --]] local args, metaArgs, nilArgs, metatable = {}, {}, {}, {} setmetatable(args, metatable)
local function mergeArgs(tables) --[[ -- Accepts multiple tables as input and merges their keys and values -- into one table. If a value is already present it is not overwritten; -- tables listed earlier have precedence. We are also memoizing nil -- values, which can be overwritten if they are 's' (soft). --]] for _, t in ipairs(tables) do for key, val in pairs(t) do if metaArgs[key] == nil and nilArgs[key] ~= 'h' then local tidiedVal = tidyVal(key, val) if tidiedVal == nil then nilArgs[key] = 's' else metaArgs[key] = tidiedVal end end end end end
--[[ -- Define metatable behaviour. Arguments are memoized in the metaArgs table, -- and are only fetched from the argument tables once. Fetching arguments -- from the argument tables is the most resource-intensive step in this -- module, so we try and avoid it where possible. For this reason, nil -- arguments are also memoized, in the nilArgs table. Also, we keep a record -- in the metatable of when pairs and ipairs have been called, so we do not -- run pairs and ipairs on the argument tables more than once. We also do -- not run ipairs on fargs and pargs if pairs has already been run, as all -- the arguments will already have been copied over. --]]
metatable.__index = function (t, key) --[[ -- Fetches an argument when the args table is indexed. First we check -- to see if the value is memoized, and if not we try and fetch it from -- the argument tables. When we check memoization, we need to check -- metaArgs before nilArgs, as both can be non-nil at the same time. -- If the argument is not present in metaArgs, we also check whether -- pairs has been run yet. If pairs has already been run, we return nil. -- This is because all the arguments will have already been copied into -- metaArgs by the mergeArgs function, meaning that any other arguments -- must be nil. --]] if type(key) == 'string' then key = options.translate[key] end local val = metaArgs[key] if val ~= nil then return val elseif metatable.donePairs or nilArgs[key] then return nil end for _, argTable in ipairs(argTables) do local argTableVal = tidyVal(key, argTable[key]) if argTableVal ~= nil then metaArgs[key] = argTableVal return argTableVal end end nilArgs[key] = 'h' return nil end
metatable.__newindex = function (t, key, val) -- This function is called when a module tries to add a new value to the -- args table, or tries to change an existing value. if type(key) == 'string' then key = options.translate[key] end if options.readOnly then error( 'could not write to argument table key "' .. tostring(key) .. '"; the table is read-only', 2 ) elseif options.noOverwrite and args[key] ~= nil then error( 'could not write to argument table key "' .. tostring(key) .. '"; overwriting existing arguments is not permitted', 2 ) elseif val == nil then --[[ -- If the argument is to be overwritten with nil, we need to erase -- the value in metaArgs, so that __index, __pairs and __ipairs do -- not use a previous existing value, if present; and we also need -- to memoize the nil in nilArgs, so that the value isn't looked -- up in the argument tables if it is accessed again. --]] metaArgs[key] = nil nilArgs[key] = 'h' else metaArgs[key] = val end end
local function translatenext(invariant) local k, v = next(invariant.t, invariant.k) invariant.k = k if k == nil then return nil elseif type(k) ~= 'string' or not options.backtranslate then return k, v else local backtranslate = options.backtranslate[k] if backtranslate == nil then -- Skip this one. This is a tail call, so this won't cause stack overflow return translatenext(invariant) else return backtranslate, v end end end
metatable.__pairs = function () -- Called when pairs is run on the args table. if not metatable.donePairs then mergeArgs(argTables) metatable.donePairs = true end return translatenext, { t = metaArgs } end
local function inext(t, i) -- This uses our __index metamethod local v = t[i + 1] if v ~= nil then return i + 1, v end end
metatable.__ipairs = function (t) -- Called when ipairs is run on the args table. return inext, t, 0 end
return args end
return arguments
