revision.text: require('strict') local getArgs local yesno = require('Module:Yesno') local lang = mw.language.getContentLanguage() local CONFIG_MODULE = 'Module:Message box/configuration' local DEMOSPACES = {talk = 'tmbox', image = 'imbox', file = 'imbox', category = 'cmbox', article = 'ambox', main = 'ambox'} -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Helper functions -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- local function getTitleObject(...) -- Get the title object, passing the function through pcall -- in case we are over the expensive function count limit. local success, title = pcall(mw.title.new, ...) if success then return title end end local function union(t1, t2) -- Returns the union of two arrays. local vals = {} for i, v in ipairs(t1) do vals[v] = true end for i, v in ipairs(t2) do vals[v] = true end local ret = {} for k in pairs(vals) do table.insert(ret, k) end table.sort(ret) return ret end local function getArgNums(args, prefix) local nums = {} for k, v in pairs(args) do local num = mw.ustring.match(tostring(k), '^' .. prefix .. '([1-9]%d*)$') if num then table.insert(nums, tonumber(num)) end end table.sort(nums) return nums end -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Box class definition -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- local MessageBox = {} MessageBox.__index = MessageBox function MessageBox.new(boxType, args, cfg) args = args or {} local obj = {} -- Set the title object and the namespace. obj.title = getTitleObject(args.page) or mw.title.getCurrentTitle() -- Set the config for our box type. obj.cfg = cfg[boxType] if not obj.cfg then local ns = obj.title.namespace -- boxType is "mbox" or invalid input if args.demospace and args.demospace ~= '' then -- implement demospace parameter of mbox local demospace = string.lower(args.demospace) if DEMOSPACES[demospace] then -- use template from DEMOSPACES obj.cfg = cfg[DEMOSPACES[demospace]] elseif string.find( demospace, 'talk' ) then -- demo as a talk page obj.cfg = cfg.tmbox else -- default to ombox obj.cfg = cfg.ombox end elseif ns == 0 then obj.cfg = cfg.ambox -- main namespace elseif ns == 6 then obj.cfg = cfg.imbox -- file namespace elseif ns == 14 then obj.cfg = cfg.cmbox -- category namespace else local nsTable = mw.site.namespaces[ns] if nsTable and nsTable.isTalk then obj.cfg = cfg.tmbox -- any talk namespace else obj.cfg = cfg.ombox -- other namespaces or invalid input end end end -- Set the arguments, and remove all blank arguments except for the ones -- listed in cfg.allowBlankParams. do local newArgs = {} for k, v in pairs(args) do if v ~= '' then newArgs[k] = v end end for i, param in ipairs(obj.cfg.allowBlankParams or {}) do newArgs[param] = args[param] end obj.args = newArgs end -- Define internal data structure. obj.categories = {} obj.classes = {} -- For lazy loading of [[Module:Category handler]]. obj.hasCategories = false return setmetatable(obj, MessageBox) end function MessageBox:addCat(ns, cat, sort) if not cat then return nil end if sort then cat = string.format('[[Category:%s|%s]]', cat, sort) else cat = string.format('[[Category:%s]]', cat) end self.hasCategories = true self.categories[ns] = self.categories[ns] or {} table.insert(self.categories[ns], cat) end function MessageBox:addClass(class) if not class then return nil end table.insert(self.classes, class) end function MessageBox:setParameters() local args = self.args local cfg = self.cfg -- Get type data. self.type = args.type local typeData = cfg.types[self.type] self.invalidTypeError = cfg.showInvalidTypeError and self.type and not typeData typeData = typeData or cfg.types[cfg.default] self.typeClass = typeData.class self.typeImage = typeData.image self.typeImageNeedsLink = typeData.imageNeedsLink -- Find if the box has been wrongly substituted. self.isSubstituted = cfg.substCheck and args.subst == 'SUBST' -- Find whether we are using a small message box. self.isSmall = cfg.allowSmall and ( cfg.smallParam and args.small == cfg.smallParam or not cfg.smallParam and yesno(args.small) ) -- Add attributes, classes and styles. self.id = args.id self.name = args.name if self.name then self:addClass('box-' .. string.gsub(self.name,' ','_')) end if yesno(args.plainlinks) ~= false then self:addClass('plainlinks') end for _, class in ipairs(cfg.classes or {}) do self:addClass(class) end if self.isSmall then self:addClass(cfg.smallClass or 'mbox-small') end self:addClass(self.typeClass) self:addClass(args.class) self.style = args.style self.attrs = args.attrs -- Set text style. self.textstyle = args.textstyle -- Find if we are on the template page or not. This functionality is only -- used if useCollapsibleTextFields is set, or if both cfg.templateCategory -- and cfg.templateCategoryRequireName are set. self.useCollapsibleTextFields = cfg.useCollapsibleTextFields if self.useCollapsibleTextFields or cfg.templateCategory and cfg.templateCategoryRequireName then if self.name then local templateName = mw.ustring.match( self.name, '^[tT][eE][mM][pP][lL][aA][tT][eE][%s_]*:[%s_]*(.*)$' ) or self.name templateName = 'Template:' .. templateName self.templateTitle = getTitleObject(templateName) end self.isTemplatePage = self.templateTitle and mw.title.equals(self.title, self.templateTitle) end -- Process data for collapsible text fields. At the moment these are only -- used in {{ambox}}. if self.useCollapsibleTextFields then -- Get the self.issue value. if self.isSmall and args.smalltext then self.issue = args.smalltext else local sect if args.sect == '' then sect = 'This ' .. (cfg.sectionDefault or 'page') elseif type(args.sect) == 'string' then sect = 'This ' .. args.sect end local issue = args.issue issue = type(issue) == 'string' and issue ~= '' and issue or nil local text = args.text text = type(text) == 'string' and text or nil local issues = {} table.insert(issues, sect) table.insert(issues, issue) table.insert(issues, text) self.issue = table.concat(issues, ' ') end -- Get the self.talk value. local talk = args.talk -- Show talk links on the template page or template subpages if the talk -- parameter is blank. if talk == '' and self.templateTitle and ( mw.title.equals(self.templateTitle, self.title) or self.title:isSubpageOf(self.templateTitle) ) then talk = '#' elseif talk == '' then talk = nil end if talk then -- If the talk value is a talk page, make a link to that page. Else -- assume that it's a section heading, and make a link to the talk -- page of the current page with that section heading. local talkTitle = getTitleObject(talk) local talkArgIsTalkPage = true if not talkTitle or not talkTitle.isTalkPage then talkArgIsTalkPage = false talkTitle = getTitleObject( self.title.text, mw.site.namespaces[self.title.namespace].talk.id ) end if talkTitle and talkTitle.exists then local talkText if self.isSmall then local talkLink = talkArgIsTalkPage and talk or (talkTitle.prefixedText .. '#' .. talk) talkText = string.format('([[%s|talk]])', talkLink) else talkText = 'Relevant discussion may be found on' if talkArgIsTalkPage then talkText = string.format( '%s [[%s|%s]].', talkText, talk, talkTitle.prefixedText ) else talkText = string.format( '%s the [[%s#%s|talk page]].', talkText, talkTitle.prefixedText, talk ) end end self.talk = talkText end end -- Get other values. self.fix = args.fix ~= '' and args.fix or nil local date if args.date and args.date ~= '' then date = args.date elseif args.date == '' and self.isTemplatePage then date = lang:formatDate('F Y') end if date then self.date = string.format(" (%s)", date) end self.info = args.info if yesno(args.removalnotice) then self.removalNotice = cfg.removalNotice end end -- Set the non-collapsible text field. At the moment this is used by all box -- types other than ambox, and also by ambox when small=yes. if self.isSmall then self.text = args.smalltext or args.text else self.text = args.text end -- Set the below row. self.below = cfg.below and args.below -- General image settings. self.imageCellDiv = not self.isSmall and cfg.imageCellDiv self.imageEmptyCell = cfg.imageEmptyCell -- Left image settings. local imageLeft = self.isSmall and args.smallimage or args.image if cfg.imageCheckBlank and imageLeft ~= 'blank' and imageLeft ~= 'none' or not cfg.imageCheckBlank and imageLeft ~= 'none' then self.imageLeft = imageLeft if not imageLeft then local imageSize = self.isSmall and (cfg.imageSmallSize or '30x30px') or '40x40px' self.imageLeft = string.format('[[File:%s|%s%s|alt=]]', self.typeImage or 'Information icon4.svg', imageSize, self.typeImageNeedsLink and "" or "|link=" ) end end -- Right image settings. local imageRight = self.isSmall and args.smallimageright or args.imageright if not (cfg.imageRightNone and imageRight == 'none') then self.imageRight = imageRight end -- set templatestyles self.base_templatestyles = cfg.templatestyles self.templatestyles = args.templatestyles end function MessageBox:setMainspaceCategories() local args = self.args local cfg = self.cfg if not cfg.allowMainspaceCategories then return nil end local nums = {} for _, prefix in ipairs{'cat', 'category', 'all'} do args[prefix .. '1'] = args[prefix] nums = union(nums, getArgNums(args, prefix)) end -- The following is roughly equivalent to the old {{Ambox/category}}. local date = args.date date = type(date) == 'string' and date local preposition = 'from' for _, num in ipairs(nums) do local mainCat = args['cat' .. tostring(num)] or args['category' .. tostring(num)] local allCat = args['all' .. tostring(num)] mainCat = type(mainCat) == 'string' and mainCat allCat = type(allCat) == 'string' and allCat if mainCat and date and date ~= '' then local catTitle = string.format('%s %s %s', mainCat, preposition, date) self:addCat(0, catTitle) catTitle = getTitleObject('Category:' .. catTitle) if not catTitle or not catTitle.exists then self:addCat(0, 'Articles with invalid date parameter in template') end elseif mainCat and (not date or date == '') then self:addCat(0, mainCat) end if allCat then self:addCat(0, allCat) end end end function MessageBox:setTemplateCategories() local args = self.args local cfg = self.cfg -- Add template categories. if cfg.templateCategory then if cfg.templateCategoryRequireName then if self.isTemplatePage then self:addCat(10, cfg.templateCategory) end elseif not self.title.isSubpage then self:addCat(10, cfg.templateCategory) end end -- Add template error categories. if cfg.templateErrorCategory then local templateErrorCategory = cfg.templateErrorCategory local templateCat, templateSort if not self.name and not self.title.isSubpage then templateCat = templateErrorCategory elseif self.isTemplatePage then local paramsToCheck = cfg.templateErrorParamsToCheck or {} local count = 0 for i, param in ipairs(paramsToCheck) do if not args[param] then count = count + 1 end end if count > 0 then templateCat = templateErrorCategory templateSort = tostring(count) end if self.categoryNums and #self.categoryNums > 0 then templateCat = templateErrorCategory templateSort = 'C' end end self:addCat(10, templateCat, templateSort) end end function MessageBox:setAllNamespaceCategories() -- Set categories for all namespaces. if self.invalidTypeError then local allSort = (self.title.namespace == 0 and 'Main:' or '') .. self.title.prefixedText self:addCat('all', 'Wikipedia message box parameter needs fixing', allSort) end if self.isSubstituted then self:addCat('all', 'Pages with incorrectly substituted templates') end end function MessageBox:setCategories() if self.title.namespace == 0 then self:setMainspaceCategories() elseif self.title.namespace == 10 then self:setTemplateCategories() end self:setAllNamespaceCategories() end function MessageBox:renderCategories() if not self.hasCategories then -- No categories added, no need to pass them to Category handler so, -- if it was invoked, it would return the empty string. -- So we shortcut and return the empty string. return "" end -- Convert category tables to strings and pass them through -- [[Module:Category handler]]. return require('Module:Category handler')._main{ main = table.concat(self.categories[0] or {}), template = table.concat(self.categories[10] or {}), all = table.concat(self.categories.all or {}), nocat = self.args.nocat, page = self.args.page } end function MessageBox:export() local root = mw.html.create() -- Add the subst check error. if self.isSubstituted and self.name then root:tag('b') :addClass('error') :wikitext(string.format( 'Template %s[[Template:%s|%s]]%s has been incorrectly substituted.', mw.text.nowiki('{{'), self.name, self.name, mw.text.nowiki('}}') )) end local frame = mw.getCurrentFrame() root:wikitext(frame:extensionTag{ name = 'templatestyles', args = { src = self.base_templatestyles }, }) -- Add support for a single custom templatestyles sheet. Undocumented as -- need should be limited and many templates using mbox are substed; we -- don't want to spread templatestyles sheets around to arbitrary places if self.templatestyles then root:wikitext(frame:extensionTag{ name = 'templatestyles', args = { src = self.templatestyles }, }) end -- Create the box table. local boxTable = root:tag('table') boxTable:attr('id', self.id or nil) for i, class in ipairs(self.classes or {}) do boxTable:addClass(class or nil) end boxTable :cssText(self.style or nil) :attr('role', 'presentation') if self.attrs then boxTable:attr(self.attrs) end -- Add the left-hand image. local row = boxTable:tag('tr') if self.imageLeft then local imageLeftCell = row:tag('td'):addClass('mbox-image') if self.imageCellDiv then -- If we are using a div, redefine imageLeftCell so that the image -- is inside it. Divs use style="width: 52px;", which limits the -- image width to 52px. If any images in a div are wider than that, -- they may overlap with the text or cause other display problems. imageLeftCell = imageLeftCell:tag('div'):addClass('mbox-image-div') end imageLeftCell:wikitext(self.imageLeft or nil) elseif self.imageEmptyCell then -- Some message boxes define an empty cell if no image is specified, and -- some don't. The old template code in templates where empty cells are -- specified gives the following hint: "No image. Cell with some width -- or padding necessary for text cell to have 100% width." row:tag('td') :addClass('mbox-empty-cell') end -- Add the text. local textCell = row:tag('td'):addClass('mbox-text') if self.useCollapsibleTextFields then -- The message box uses advanced text parameters that allow things to be -- collapsible. At the moment, only ambox uses this. textCell:cssText(self.textstyle or nil) local textCellDiv = textCell:tag('div') textCellDiv :addClass('mbox-text-span') :wikitext(self.issue or nil) if (self.talk or self.fix) then textCellDiv:tag('span') :addClass('hide-when-compact') :wikitext(self.talk and (' ' .. self.talk) or nil) :wikitext(self.fix and (' ' .. self.fix) or nil) end textCellDiv:wikitext(self.date and (' ' .. self.date) or nil) if self.info and not self.isSmall then textCellDiv :tag('span') :addClass('hide-when-compact') :wikitext(self.info and (' ' .. self.info) or nil) end if self.removalNotice then textCellDiv:tag('span') :addClass('hide-when-compact') :tag('i') :wikitext(string.format(" (%s)", self.removalNotice)) end else -- Default text formatting - anything goes. textCell :cssText(self.textstyle or nil) :wikitext(self.text or nil) end -- Add the right-hand image. if self.imageRight then local imageRightCell = row:tag('td'):addClass('mbox-imageright') if self.imageCellDiv then -- If we are using a div, redefine imageRightCell so that the image -- is inside it. imageRightCell = imageRightCell:tag('div'):addClass('mbox-image-div') end imageRightCell :wikitext(self.imageRight or nil) end -- Add the below row. if self.below then boxTable:tag('tr') :tag('td') :attr('colspan', self.imageRight and '3' or '2') :addClass('mbox-text') :cssText(self.textstyle or nil) :wikitext(self.below or nil) end -- Add error message for invalid type parameters. if self.invalidTypeError then root:tag('div') :addClass('mbox-invalid-type') :wikitext(string.format( 'This message box is using an invalid "type=%s" parameter and needs fixing.', self.type or '' )) end -- Add categories. root:wikitext(self:renderCategories() or nil) return tostring(root) end -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -- Exports -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- local p, mt = {}, {} function p._exportClasses() -- For testing. return { MessageBox = MessageBox } end function p.main(boxType, args, cfgTables) local box = MessageBox.new(boxType, args, cfgTables or mw.loadData(CONFIG_MODULE)) box:setParameters() box:setCategories() return box:export() end function mt.__index(t, k) return function (frame) if not getArgs then getArgs = require('Module:Arguments').getArgs end return t.main(k, getArgs(frame, {trim = false, removeBlanks = false})) end end return setmetatable(p, mt)

revision.text:
-- This module provides functions for getting the target of a redirect page.
local p = {}
-- Gets a mw.title object, using pcall to avoid generating script errors if we -- are over the expensive function count limit (among other possible causes). local function getTitle(...) local success, titleObj = pcall(mw.title.new, ...) if success then return titleObj else return nil end end
-- Gets the name of a page that a redirect leads to, or nil if it isn't a -- redirect. function p.getTargetFromText(text) local target = string.match( text, "^%s*#[Rr][Ee][Dd][Ii][Rr][Ee][Cc][Tt]%s*:?%s*%[%[([^%[%]|]-)%]%]" ) or string.match( text, "^%s*#[Rr][Ee][Dd][Ii][Rr][Ee][Cc][Tt]%s*:?%s*%[%[([^%[%]|]-)|[^%[%]]-%]%]" ) return target and mw.uri.decode(target, 'PATH') end
-- Gets the target of a redirect. If the page specified is not a redirect, -- returns nil. function p.getTarget(page, fulltext) -- Get the title object. Both page names and title objects are allowed -- as input. local titleObj if type(page) == 'string' or type(page) == 'number' then titleObj = getTitle(page) elseif type(page) == 'table' and type(page.getContent) == 'function' then titleObj = page else error(string.format( "bad argument #1 to 'getTarget'" .. " (string, number, or title object expected, got %s)", type(page) ), 2) end if not titleObj then return nil end local targetTitle = titleObj.redirectTarget if targetTitle then if fulltext then return targetTitle.fullText else return targetTitle.prefixedText end else return nil end end
--[[ -- Given a single page name determines what page it redirects to and returns the -- target page name, or the passed page name when not a redirect. The passed -- page name can be given as plain text or as a page link. -- -- Returns page name as plain text, or when the bracket parameter is given, as a -- page link. Returns an error message when page does not exist or the redirect -- target cannot be determined for some reason. --]] function p.luaMain(rname, bracket, fulltext) if type(rname) ~= "string" or not rname:find("%S") then return nil end bracket = bracket and "[[%s]]" or "%s" rname = rname:match("%[%[(.+)%]%]") or rname local target = p.getTarget(rname, fulltext) local ret = target or rname ret = getTitle(ret) if ret then if fulltext then ret = ret.fullText else ret = ret.prefixedText end return bracket:format(ret) else return nil end end
-- Provides access to the luaMain function from wikitext. function p.main(frame) local args = require('Module:Arguments').getArgs(frame, {frameOnly = true}) return p.luaMain(args[1], args.bracket, args.fulltext) or '' end
-- Returns true if the specified page is a redirect, and false otherwise. function p.luaIsRedirect(page) local titleObj = getTitle(page) if not titleObj then return false end if titleObj.isRedirect then return true else return false end end
-- Provides access to the luaIsRedirect function from wikitext, returning 'yes' -- if the specified page is a redirect, and the blank string otherwise. function p.isRedirect(frame) local args = require('Module:Arguments').getArgs(frame, {frameOnly = true}) if p.luaIsRedirect(args[1]) then return 'yes' else return '' end end
return p

revision.text:
{{PolicyNavigation}} Hi there! to ensure a professional and proper environment on the wiki, guidelines are in place and will be enforced to ensure the wiki is up to standards. Please follow the following guidelines when editing. Please forward questions and issues to any administrator, and we will answer your questions. Alternatively, you can post a question in the Dovedale server. '''Important: By browsing, editing and interacting the wiki, you agree that you will follow all guidelines, copyright rules and the exclusion of liability. ''' =='''Style'''== *Here at the Dovedale Railway Wiki, please write in '''British English'''. This applies to the spelling and grammar of the words. ''(Example: colour over color)''. *You will need '''good grammar''' and '''good spelling''' when editing or making articles. Before you publish, please do a quick check of your edits. * Do not use ampersands (&) in replacement of and. You are encouraged to write in full instead of abbreviations. ''(Example: they are not they're)'' *Apostrophes should be used correctly. ''(Example: Its and Its)'' *Always have a space succeeding a comma, like this. * When writing a list, do not repeatedly use the word and, use commas. You are encouraged to use different connecting words. *'''Roblox''' is preferred over ROBLOX. *When mentioning any notable user, like a developer, check that that is their most updated name. ** Searching their previous name can yield their current name in Roblox results. ''(Example: l1z4rdju1ce over happyshalala)'' *Quotations should be in italics, or using the {{Quote}} template. Please write quotations using the quote function in the editor. **Quotes should use () and not ( ) '' (Example:Donated by RAYE.)'' **''BALL was created by an unknown man and has been turned into a meme in the dovedale community. It is now being preserved in this museum owened by Meowtwotonnezoom.'' **If this is the last word of the sentence, do not add an extra . . *When writing a date, write in its full format, like 31 January 2021. Do not shorten the month, year, or anything else. ** Please use the proper dash (-) when writing 2 dates. DO NOT use em dashes, en dashes, or arrows. ** Do not write st, nd, or rd after date numbers. '' (Example: 31 January 2021 - 1 April 2021) *When writing, it is usually not advisable to have exclamation marks or question marks as the end. *No profanity should be used in the articles. Exceptions include external site links or quotes. Please contact a Bureaucrat+ when in doubt. *When using or choosing pictures, the '''main''' photo should be of high quality and in the 'day' mode. Other photos can be taken during night, though it should be placed secondary. *Please use the METRIC system, with the exception for length, where we use studs, the Roblox Standard. **Length - Studs **Speed - Studs per second **Time - Minutes and Hours ('''Do not shorten this''') '' (Example: The maximum speed of this train is 100 studs per second.) '' '' (Example: The timetable allows drivers for a 3 minute break at Satus Services.) '' *When writing numbers over a thousand, include comma separators. '' (Example: There are around 10,000 trees around [[Dovedale East]]) '' *Game currency should be referred to as the following: **'''XP - Experience Points''' **Robux may be shortened to R$. * when describing numbers below 10, they should be written in text format. For larger numbers, please write in number form. '' (Example: She accidentally spawned in two trains.) '' '' (There are over 400 applicants for this round.) '' *Terms should be carefully chosen. For instance, removed should not be interchangeably used with unobtainable. ** If the item is admin only, such as an admin only train, please use the latter, or 'admin-only'. ** If a train was previously available but was removed, and can no longer be used or seen, please use the term removed. '' (Example: The Class 91 Intercity is unobtainable) ''
'' (Example: The Class 323 was unobtainable for some time. ) ''
'' (Example: The old Dovedale Central was removed. ) ''
*When uploading images, please clear all non-essential EXIF metadata. It is possible to view metadata from Image Files. ** We are not liable for any privacy leaks that happen on our wiki as a result of this. * You may use Unicode arrows for pages that require it. Below are arrows listed that are allowed. ** Simple arrows from unicode 2190 through 2199 ** Arrows 21BB and 21BA ** Please do not use double arrows, harpoons and white arrows. ** Arrow namelist: [https://unicode.org/charts/nameslist/n_2190.html] * When using maps, please set the markers to a set color scheme and title. Maps for in-game maps should have at least an Entrance and Exit, and can alternatively include Path Points, Points of Intrest, or Fefatures. * Only game information should be added into the wiki. For example, there should not be any admin inserts. ** Some real world information information is acceptable. For example, explaning with the Class 43 is called Cross Country. == Behavioural == We would like for all users to enjoy the community and this wiki - so do follow the following conduct guidelines. ==Copyright== All photos of original game assets, assets in public domain in game, or assets with prior permission are allowed to be used in this Wiki under terms set by Game Developers. Generally it is okay to screenshot something and add it here, but in doubt or if in a sticky situation, contact our administrators or moderators. All media being uploaded of game assets should follow the following criteria: * Be uploaded to the wiki directly. * Videos uploaded to a channel on YouTube have to not have monetisation enabled, OR monetisation be disabled for the particular video. ** Due to high risks of such videos getting reverted by original owners, please contact enews to upload it to his account if needed. * Have NO monetisation on any other embeds. ** Due to high risks of such videos getting reverted by original owners, please contact enews to upload it to his account if needed. Permission to reproduce items where third-party owned material protected by copyright is included has been sought and cleared where possible. Every reasonable effort has been made to trace copyright holders, but if any items requiring clearance have unwittingly been included, we will be pleased to make amends at the earliest possible opportunity. We sincerly apologise if you believe that your copyrighted content is being used in a manner that you believe violates your rights. While we will be happy to make amends, should you need further help, please contact out wiki host (Fandom) with a Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) takedown notice. You may file one at [https://support.fandom.com/hc/en-us/requests/new?ticket_form_id=360000940393&tf_360017952614=i_have_a_copyright_or_trademark_issue this link]. Learn more about this on [https://community.fandom.com/wiki/DMCA_takedown_notice this Community Central Article]. Note: We nor Fandom are in a position to give legal advice. Please contact your attorney for more. Please note that all contributions to the Dovedale Wiki are considered to be released under the CC-BY-SA '''unless otherwise stated'''. This means that although you the editor are the holder of the copyright, you have given blanket and irrevocable permission to the world at large to reuse, remix, and transform your work as long as you are attributed as the author. Please note that images are not automatically released under the CC BY-SA license. Third party sources can use content from this wiki. This is acceptable under the Creative Commons license. All third parties must provide proper attribution on every article and link back. An example is located [https://www.fandom.com/licensing#Using_Fandom_content here]. If you want to add copyrighted content to our wiki, the use of the material will have to qualify as fair use or similar exception. Four factors are considered by courts to determine whether an item's usage counts as fair use: * Purpose of the use * Nature of the copyrighted work * Amount and substantiality of copyrighted work used compared to the work as a whole * Potential market for the copyrighted work * You have the permission of the copyright holder to use it on Fandom. * The material you want to use is licensed under a Creative Commons or other open license that permits free reuse. * The material is in the public domain. * You have created the material yourself. If your use of content does not fall under one of these broad categories, it likely infringes someone's copyright. It is therefore against our Terms of Use to submit that material. We recommend using content that has a compatible license or is released to the public domain whenever possible. When uploading a file, you should tag it with the appropriate copyright tag, in order to make its copyright status clear. Remember: all images uploaded should be used under fair use or be images that are freely available, with or without conditions or restrictions. You must adhere to any licensing requirements, such as attributing the author and source on the file description page. There are penalties for breaching such copyright laws if you are a user of this wiki/ Fandom. Should you uploads content that accrues three (3) separate DMCA takedown notices, Fandom, Inc. has the right to disable the account, at their discretion, under their repeat infringer policy. Takedown notices for which content has been restored in response to a successful counter-notification do not count as strikes for the purposes of the repeat infringer policy. the wiki will also issue our own separate blocks on the matter, depending on the situation. The staff team will generally NOT counter strike DMCA notices unless deemed absolutely necessary due to the possibility of a lawsuit. == Exclusion of Liability == To the extent permitted by law, we hereby disclaim any and all warranties, representations or statements made or given by employees, staff, agents, contractors and/or service providers of Dovedale Wiki. The reader shall waive all claims against Dovedale Wiki arising from such disputes. Notwithstanding any other conditions stated on our pages, Dovedale Wiki shall not be liable for any loss, damage, embarrassment, inconvenience, cost or expense of any nature (including without limitation for any act, omission, neglect or breach on the part of their agents, contractors, employees and staff) arising out of or in connection with the usage of our wiki service in any way that may be suffered or incurred by the reader or any other person.

= Forms = Find any Dovedale related form here. Apply to become a member of staff, appeal a ban and more!
''' GET A NUMBER '''

Get a real phone number to communicate with other members of the Dovedale community!
[[DTRS|Get A Number]]

''' DISCORD BAN APPEALS '''

If you were banned from the Dovedale Community Discord, you can apply to get back in. Got banned on the wiki? Head over to a staff Message Wall.
[https://dyno.gg/form/c072acd7 Fill in form]

''' GAME BAN APPEALS '''

If you were banned from the Dovedale Game, you can apply to get back in. Got banned on the wiki? Head over to a staff Message Wall.
[[Forms/Dovedale Game Ban Appeals|Fill in form]]

''' WIKI STAFF APPLICATIONS '''

Want to become a member of the wiki staff? Well now is your chance to join an awesomesauce team!
[[Forms/Wiki Staff Applications|Fill in form]]

''' DOVEDALE STAFF APPLICATIONS '''

Interested in moderating the game? Check out this form - it might just be for you!
[[Forms/Dovedale Staff Applications|Fill in form]]
Click [https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScKH9WVSPg3iAEhgfQM5AGUQv0j2gTZ_VNE_pYx5IfGP43jfQ/viewform here] to open the form to submit an in-game ban appeal. [[Category:Forms]]
your device does not support this feature. Please visit https://forms.gle/kYhwXBK1HkorMx9o7 instead. [[Category:Forms]]

{{PolicyNavigation}}
[[File:Dovedale Wiki Staff Light.png|900px]]
[[File:Dovedale Wiki Staff Dark .png|900px]]
Staff are people who work on the wiki and/or the game, either through developing, writing, moderating and scripting. For your reference, we keep a list of staff available. == Wiki Staff Roles == Below are the staff roles on the wiki. For more information on exactly what each role can do, please refer to [[Special:ListGroupRights|this page]]. === Managers/Bureaucrats === Bureaucrats, or Wiki Managers as we call them here, are the people with the most permissions on the wiki. In terms of power, they have slightly more than administrators, and are able to promote new staff, as well as manage trial staff if necessary. === Administrators === Administrators have more permissions than Moderators, and take on further training to handle more serious issues. They also have a few more permissions on the wiki, along with the [https://da.gd/dovedale-w Discord server]. At the moment, only Moderators are able to be promoted to this rank. === Moderators === Moderators are wiki staff who patrol pages, watch out for recent contributions and ensure the wiki is safe and free of vandalism. They issue warns and bans on the wiki. They should be the first person informed if there is an issue on the wiki, whether that be with a false or troll edit, a rule break on a talk page/discussion, or something else related to the wiki. === Trial Moderators === When a member of staff is promoted, they will be placed in a trial period of a month or less. During this time, they will be assessed against their performance and skills by Administrators and Bureaucrats as to their promotion to Moderator. == User Rights Procedures == Apply for most positions in [[Project:Forms|Forms]] during application periods. Hiring of new staff will be conducted by the relevant Manager for their team: General Moderation Team: Recruitment Manager+
Media Team: Media Manager+
Development Team: Development Manager+
WIki Team: Wiki Manager (only)
Our hiring process is generally as follows: Written Application #Shortlist 1 (generally a check question) #Shortlist 2 (grading based on answers) #Shortlist 3 (background checks) #Announcement of results #Training When hiring a member of staff, this process here should always be followed. There should be no other permissible way for staff to be hired. Promotions can be made by the following roles at their own discretion: Creator, Head of Staff, Community Director. Promotions should be issued when a member of staff significantly assists Dovedale Railway, shows good improvement in their current role, and when deemed sensible. Trial Moderator, Moderator, and Administrator roles can be promoted. All other roles are to be hired and followed as in section above. Demotions can be made by the following roles only at their own discretion: Creator, Head of Staff, Community Director. Demotions will be made, when the code of conduct is broken, deemed necessary to prevent problems within the team, and deemed necessary from HR. Unless otherwise said, demoted members of staff can re-apply at the next round of applications though acceptance is not guaranteed. == Wiki Staff == The wiki staff run the show here - from maintaining things backstage to showing you some cool styles and photos, they oversee it all! {| class="fandom-table" style="text-align:center" ! Fandom Username !! Discord Username !! Roblox Username !! Nickname !! Timezone !! About !! Rank !! Date of Promotion !! Status |- | '''[[User:Enewssg|Enewssg]]''' | @enews | @enews01 | enews | Singapore Standard Time UTC+8 | He/Him | Wiki Moderator || [[Special:UserRights/Enewssg|Wiki Manager - 10th September 2023]] | Active |- | '''[[User:Jaiden04|Jaiden04]]''' | @jaidennnn_ | @l1z4rdju1ce | jaiden | British Summer Time UTC+1 / Greenwich Mean Time UTC+0 | She/Her | Game Owner || [[Special:UserRights/Jaiden04|Owner Status - 10th September 2023]] | Active |- | '''[[User:Aeywoo|Aeywoo]]''' | @Aeywoo | @Aeywoo | Aeyeu | Central Standard Time UTC-6 | Any | Wiki Moderator || [[Special:UserRights/Aeywoo|Content Moderator Status - 14 January 2024]] | Active |- | '''[[User:Bigbadbob85|Bigbadbob85]]''' | @bigbadbob85 | @bigbadbob85 | Bob | British Summer Time UTC+1 / Greenwich Mean Time UTC+0 | He/Him | Wiki Moderator || [[Special:UserRights/Bigbadbob85|Content Moderator Status - 3 March 2024]] | Active |} == Game Staff == Game staff are people who work on the game and its community, performing tasks such as moderating or developing Dovedale. Do not ask them for help on wiki issues; refer to wiki staff instead. {| class="fandom-table" style="text-align:center" ! Name !! Roblox Username !! About !! Rank |- | [[Staff/Jaiden|Jaiden]] | @cl0vermead0ws | She/Her | Owner |- | AMAviation | @AMAviation | He/Him | Developer |- | Avro85 | @QuiltedMarker85 | He/Him | Head of Staff |- | ridged | @ridgedfox | He/Him | Senior Administrator |- | immadumus | @immadumus | He/Him | Administrator |- | Realbritishgamer | @bonnethebunny123 | He/Him | Administrator |- | Fishkung | @Fishkung555 | He/Him | Administrator |- | Qwerty | @QwertyZGameZx | He/Him | Developer |- | mstudio | @mstudio4 | He/Him | Developer |- | Boy_Pro | @Boyy_Pro0 | He/Him | Developer |- | Gabe | @Gabe123131 | He/Him | Moderator |- | Meowhub | @minecraft_MAXI2 | He/Him | Moderator |- | ally | @certxfie | Any | Moderator |- | Y3MG34R | @YEMGEAR | He/Him | Moderator |- | jyy | @chuableloverr | She/Her | Moderator |- | cg | @ImGirlvALT | He/Him | Moderator |- | dexx | @dextr_o | He/Him | Moderator |- | HSTK_Chiyuki | @HSTK_Chiyuki | He/Him | Moderator |- | User | @usernumber2of2 | He/Him | Moderator |- | Lucky | @Luckyone4000 | He/Him | Moderator |- | kairi | @Eagle_ii6R | They/Them | Moderator |- | sollie | @solliedarnosc | He/Him | Moderator |- | wingedexodus | @rmaceri26 | He/Him | Moderator |} == Former Staff == A list and record of Former Wiki Staff are below. We do not keep a list of Former Game Staff. {| class="fandom-table" style="text-align:center" ! Name !! Former Rank !! Reason |- | '''[[User:Nset!|meow2]]''' | Moderator | Personal reasons |- | '''[[User:EllaFellah|EllaFellah]]''' | Founder/Bureaucrat | Left Dovedale (see [[Staff/ellafellah|ellafellah]] for more info) |- | '''[[User:RAYEdev|RAYE]]''' | Editor | Resigned from Dovedale role and wiki role (see [[Staff/RAYE|RAYE]] for more info) |} == Verification == A verification template is in place to show that a user has been manually verified by a Wiki Manager. The template will only output a verification message if inputted on certain user pages. If you see the below template on a staff members page, it is trustworthy!
[[File:verification screenshot example.png|800px]] == Connect With Us == {{DovedaleDiscordWidget}}

{{Train |title1=Class 43 Track Inspection | image1= <gallery> File:TrackINspection C43 2.png|View 1 File:Track Inspection C43.png|View 2 </gallery> | top_speed=100 mph | powered_by=Diesel | spawn_points=N/A | coaches=4 | doors=14 | status=Admin Only | date_added=Unknown }}
The '''Class 43 Track Inspection''' is a railway maintenance vehicle used to assess the condition of track so that engineers can determine where to work. In real life, lasers, vertical and horizontal actuators, gyros and accelerometers measure the interaction of the vehicle passing over the track.
In game, it can only be spawned by certain admins.
In real life, the train is similar to other maintenance and measurement trains around the world, like the [[wikipedia:Doctor Yellow|Doctor Yellow in Japan]].

'''Signal Boxes''' are important structures on a railroad that are used by signallers to control signals, points and the communication with other signal boxes. They ensure the safe and efficient movement of trains across the network.
While most of the signal boxes in the game are dedicated to a specific station, [[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]] and [[Benyhone Loop Signal Box]] are an exception for that, controlling a crossing and a passing loop respectively.
All signal boxes have an [[Ranks & XP|XP]] requirement. As you play the game, you gain XP and therefore gain access to more signal boxes. '''[[Fanory Mill Signal Box]]''' and [[Benyhone Loop Signal Box]] are currently the signal boxes with the lowest XP requirement, being 1000 XP. In contrast, [[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]] has the highest requirement, of 5000 XP.
{| class="sortable mw-collapsible fandom-table" !Signal Box Name !Image !XP Requirement !Stations Controlled !Crossings Controlled !Status |- |'''[[Fanory Mill Signal Box]]''' |[[File:Fanory Mill Signal Box v1.2.png|frameless]] |1000XP |[[Fanory Mill]] |[[Narmouth Crossing]] | rowspan="7" style="background-color: green;" |In Operation |- |'''[[Satus Signal Box]]''' |[[File:Satus Signal Box Outside.png|frameless]] |1250XP |[[Satus Services]], [[Jaiden's House]] |[[Steynbath Crossing]] |- |'''[[Dovedale East Signalling Centre]]''' |[[File:DEBox Daytime.png|frameless]] |2000XP |[[Dovedale East]] |[[Dovedale East Crossing]] |- |'''[[Dovedale Central Signal Box]]''' |[[File:Dc box outside.png|frameless]] |2000XP |[[Dovedale Central]], [[Gleethrop End]], [[Perthtyne]] |N/A |- |'''[[Marigot Crossing Signal Box]]''' |[[File:Marigot Crossing Signal Box.png|frameless]] |5000XP |[[Pallion Harbour]] |[[Marigot Crossing]] |- |'''[[Masonfield Signal Box]]''' |[[File:Masonfield Signal Box v1.2.jpg|frameless]] |3500XP |[[Masonfield]] |[[Masonfield Crossing]] |- |[[Benyhone Loop Signal Box]] |[[File:Benyhone Loop Signal Box Day.jpg|frameless]] |1000XP |N/A |N/A |- |'''[[Cosdale Cabin]]''' |[[File:Cosdale outside.png|frameless]] |300XP |[[Dovedale East]], [[Steam Train]] |N/A |style="background-color: #e73d3d;" |Removed |- |} [[Category:Lists]]

The '''Class 450''' is an electric multiple unit (EMU) with a top speed of 80 mph. It is primarily used for commuter and regional services and can be spawned at [[Dovedale Central]] on Platform 7. The train is painted in combination of dark blue and white, resembling the South Western Railway livery, with the Dovedale West Railway logo visible on the side.
{{Train | image1= <gallery> File:450 still shot.png|Exterior File:450 carriges.png|Coaches File:450 interior.png|Interior </gallery> |caption-image1=Example |top_speed=80 mph |powered_by=Electric |spawn_points=[[Dovedale Central]] |coaches=4 |doors=16 |date_added=1st October 2023 |status=Public |operator=Dovedale West Railway}}
== Trivia ==
* This is the first train to receive the Guard System.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:450 crossing riding.png|Class 450 at a makeshift crossing for testing. File:Dovedale East 450.png|A Class 450 at [[Dovedale East]] with its doors open. File:Class 450 at DE.png|Class 450 in Dovedale East at night. </gallery> [[Category:Trains]]

revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:Red Steam Train}} {{Train|title1=Red Steam Train| image1= <gallery> File:Red unnamed steam train.png|Front View red steam behind.png|Back View </gallery> |top_speed=45sps|powered_by=Steam & Coal|spawn_points=[[Fanory Mill]] |coaches=[[Steam Carriage]]|doors=N/A,semi-open cabin|date_added=Unknown|status=Removed}}
The '''Red Steamer''' was a cancelled remade version of the [[Steam Train|steam train]], making this the third version of the train. Plans for this train were scrapped and development was re-focused on other trains.
== Trivia == *There was never any horn for this train in game. *You could not swap sides with this train in game. *The sounds on this model are different from [[Steam Train]].
[[Category:Locomotives]] [[Category:Trains]]

== My final message, goodbye. == Greetings, Dovedale Wiki visitors! I'm a former moderator and contributor Dovedale Railways wiki from 02.10.23 to 11.01.24. Unfortunately, this account is abandoned or rarely visited by me.

local p = {} local WikiStaff = {"Enewssg", "Aeywoo", "Bigbadbob85", "Jaiden04" } function p.main(frame) for _, v in pairs(WikiStaff) do if v == frame:preprocess("{{PAGENAME}}") and frame:preprocess('{{NAMESPACE}}') == 'User' then return frame:preprocess([===[
'''[[File:Verifiedtickicon.png|20x20px|link=https://dovedale.fandom.com/wiki/Project:Staff#Verification]] This user has been verified.
---- '''This account has been verified as a Wiki Staff member. [https://dovedale.fandom.com/wiki/Project:Staff#Verification Learn more] ''' Verification tells us that this is a legitimate staff account, and you can trust what they say.

]===]) end end return ' [https://http.cat/401 Error: Unauthorized.] You are not authorised to use this template. Please remove this template or contact wiki staff for help. ' end return p

{{Train|title1=Class 150|image1=[[150class1.png]]|top_speed=80 mph|powered_by=Diesel|spawn_points=N/A|coaches=2|doors=16|date_added=1st October 2023|operator=Dovedale West Railway|status=Admin only}} The '''Class 150''' is an admin-only diesel multiple unit (DMU) formed of two coaches. It has a top speed of 80 mph. == Trivia ==
* The Class 150 and the [[Class 323]] are the only two trains in the game to carry the livery of the real-life operator Northern Trains. * The Class 150, along with the [[Class 156]] and [[Class 158]] are all the members of the Sprinter family of trains present in game.
== Gallery == [[Category:Admin Only]] [[Category:Trains]]

revision.text: The following is a list of notable '''Landmarks''' in the game. Note that the list does not include [[List of Stations|Stations]] or [[List of Signal Boxes|Signal Boxes/Centres]]. {| class="sortable fandom-table" |+ !Image !Name !Usage !Nearest Station |- |[[File:Training Centre.jpg|250x250px]] |[[Training Centre]] |Designed for trainings, and will be opened soon. It will house two training rooms, mock equitment, a staff room and some extra locomotives. |[[Dovedale East]] |- |[[File:New harbour ship.png|250px]] |[[Cosdale Harbour]] |For unloading and loading maritime cargo. To be integrated with the future freight line. |[[Dovedale East]] |- |[[File:Cosdale coal depot.png|250px]] |[[Cosdale Coal Depot]] |For possible coal loading and unloading. To be integrated with the future freight line. |[[Dovedale East]] |- |[[File:Lighthouse Day View.jpg|250px]] |[[Lighthouse (Structure)|Lighthouse]] |For guiding ships and safety. There is also an [[Lighthouse (Station)|unused station]] nearby. |[[Lighthouse (Station)|Lighthouse]] |- |[[File:Railway Museum Building.jpg|250px]] |[[Railway Museum| Railway Museum (The Rail Story)]] |To showcase the history of the game, alongside exhibits. Also features a ticketing counter. |[[Dovedale East]] |- |[[File:Dovedale East Bus Terminal.jpg|250px]] |[[Dovedale East Bus Terminal]] |For buses stopping at the [[Dovedale East]] station. |[[Dovedale East]] |- |[[File:Jaiden's House.jpg|250px]] |Jaiden's House |The house of [[Staff/Jaiden|Jaiden]]. |[[Jaiden's House]] |- |[[File:Slsyard.png|center|thumb|241x241px]] |[[SLS Maintenance Yard]] |The Yard Of operations for [[Satus Locomotive Services]]. |[[Dovedale East]] |} [[Category:Lists]]

revision.text:
{{Train |image1=releovka system.png | caption-image1=The machine at the old [[Dovedale Central]] }} The Releovka, also known as the Relay Signalling System, was an old signalling system previously found at the former [[Dovedale Central]]. Designed to make signaling a lot easier, it used buttons to route trains and set signals.
To route trains, you would have set the blue button as the starting point, and the white button as its ending point, ensuring there is a feasible path. After doing that, pressing the green button would have changed the switches to the right path and set the signals to clear. (it would have taken a moment to do this.) To clear the route, you pressed the red button (it also took a moment to do this.)
The board also had an integrated system to set [[Destination Boards]]. You could set each row up with a train service. Each update button will update the specific thing is does for the row that you chose. When a train was arriving, the flash button could be toggled.
This system was first suggested by user praha2008 in June 2023. <ref> https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1114238948382888138/1117120714470854667 </ref>
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Releovka front.png|thumb|Front view File:Releovka2 machine.png|thumb|The calculating mechanism File:Releovka3.png|thumb|The board and the mechanism File:Releovka4.png|thumb|The Releovka with a route set to the terminating platform at DC File:Releovka5 player.png|thumb|A player standing on top of the board File:Releovka6 destboard.png|thumb|An empty destination board at DC File:Releovka7 northern.png|thumb|The destination board showing a Northern service to Satus Services </gallery> [[Category:Features]]

revision.text:
'''Phones''' were previously used for communication between signallers. However, they have been slowly phased out and are now no longer used. While they previously were expected to make a comeback, the "Phone Lines" chat channel was mostly used between signallers and drivers or between boxes if there are issues with bells. In December of 2023, chat channels were added for most boxes that can be accessed by the signallers of adjacent boxes. == Usage == To call a box, click the phone, and enter the phone number. This will send a ring and you can chat from there. == Numbers == '''[[Dovedale Central]] Signaller''' - 171
'''[[Dovedale East]] Signaller''' - 143
'''[[Dovedale East]] Dispatcher''' - 119
'''[[Glassbury Junction]] Dispatcher''' - 118
'''[[Marigot Crossing]] Signaller''' - 707
== Trivia == * When the first generation [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre|Dovedale East]] box was underneath the old [[Dovedale Central]], you could call any box from the old Dovedale East box. == Gallery == File:phone example.png| A phone File:bells example.png| Bells at [[Steynbath Crossing]] File:block indicators example.png| Block Indicators [[Category:Features]]

revision.text:
'''Signs''' on the railway inform drivers, guards, dispatchers, drivers, and even passengers about what is up ahead, where a place is or what they should do. Below is a list of signs.
== Speed Limit Indicators == Speed Limit Indicators informs drivers about upcoming speed limits. The current speed limit is repeated in the driving UI below the current movement speed.
{| class="fandom-table mw-collapsible" |+ Types of speed limit indicators !Type !Explanation !Image |- |Permanent Speed Restriction Sign |A white circular sign with a red outline means that the speed limit stated applies to trains after passing the sign. A sign with one or more arrows above a general speed indicator sign indicates that the limit only applies for trains branching off the next point in the stated direction(s). |[[File:Permanent Speed Restriction Sign.png|frameless]] |- |Advance Warning Indicator |A white triangular-shaped sign with a yellow outline informs drivers about an upcoming speed limit which is lower than the currently enforced one. The sign gives drivers enough time to reduce their train's speed to the new limit after passing this sign. |[[File:Advance Warning Indicator.png|frameless]] |- |"SLOW" sign |A sign with the words SLOW means that drivers should slow down as soon as possible. |N/A |}
<gallery> File:different speed limits.png|Different speed limits signs. </gallery>
== Whistle Board== The Whistle Board tells train drivers to whistle. It is often placed near level crossings to inform cars, pedestrians and signallers about approaching trains. The sign can be triangular or circular.
When a whistle board is placed next to a signal, like in the third image below, drivers shouldn't whistle until the signal has been cleared.
<gallery> File:WhitsleBoard.gif|A round whistle board File:W WHISTLE sign.png|A triangular whistle board File:DE Level Crossing Sign.png|A Whistle Board placed next to a Level Crossing Ahead Sign and an exit signal at [[Dovedale East]]. File:Whistle Sign.png|A cut-out whistle sign near [[Jaiden's House]] </gallery>
== SPAD Trap Indicator == <!-- SPAD traps may need their own article for a more detailed explanation --> A SPAD Trap Indicator board is used to warn drivers about an upcoming SPAD trap. SPAD traps (also called catch/trap points) are used to forcefully protect main lines from trains on sidings that are passing signals at danger.
Although there are currently five SPAD traps present in the game (Three at [[Masonfield]] and two at the [[Benyhone Loop]]), none of them are preceded by SPAD Trap Indicators, meaning that these signs are currently not present in the game.
<gallery> File:Stop Board with INstructions.gif|Something how the SPAD Trap information sign looks like. File:Trap points.png|How SPAD traps work </gallery>
== Level Crossing Ahead Sign== This sign informs drivers of an upcoming level crossing ahead. It can be identified by the black cross on a white background.
While [[Satus Level Crossing]] and [[Dovedale East Crossing]] have these signs, [[Marigot Crossing]] and [[Narmouth Crossing]] are not. <gallery> File:Level Crossing Sign.png|Level Crossing Ahead Sign File:DE Level Crossing Sign.png|A Level Crossing Ahead Sign placed next to a whistle board and an exit signal at [[Dovedale East]]. </gallery>
== Limit of Shunt Indicator == A Limit of Shunt Indicator marks the limit that carriages and locomotives are allowed to be shunted. It appears mostly as a white sign with a red label saying 'Limit of Shunt' or 'Shunt Limit'.
<gallery> File:LOS Sign DE.png|A Limit of Shunt Indicator near [[Dovedale East]] File:sat limit of shunt.png|Rusted Shunt Limit Signal </gallery>
== Stopping Marker == A stopping marker tells train drivers where to stop at a platform.
<!-- this list is not complete and only contains the stop markers found in the game --> {| class="fandom-table mw-collapsible" |+ Types of stopping markers !Type !Explanation !Image |- |"S" Car Stop Marker |Found at most of the stations in the game, drivers should stop at those stop markers if there is not a specific one for their train type. |[[File:normal s car marker.png|frameless]] |- |Class specific stopping marker |Special stopping markers for some trains like the [[Class 43|Class 43 (HST)]] and the [[Class 323]] can be found at some stations. These are colored differently and show the train type on the marker. |<gallery> File:MS Car Stop Markers.png|Stopping marker for the [[Class 43]] and trains with 4 cars at [[Masonfield]] File:hst s car marker.png|Stopping marker for the [[Class 43|Class 43 (HST)]] at [[Fanory Mill]] </gallery> |- |Old "S" Car Stop Marker |This version of the "S" Car Stop Marker was used on older stations. |[[File:S Stop Indicator.png|frameless]] |}
== Stop Indicator == Stop indicators is to tell drivers to immediately stop the train before reaching the sign. They are used to warn drivers about the track ending, like at buffers. <gallery> File:STOPNOW Sign.png|Shunt Area Stop Now Sign </gallery>
== Distant Board == Found only on the [[Dovedale Central]] turn and between [[Marigot Crossing]] and [[Pallion Harbour]], these signs tell drivers to be cautious of the signal ahead as the next signal is around a blind corner and might be in their blind spot if they go too fast. This is a permanent signal and can't be changed. <gallery> File:DistantBoard.png|A Distant Board </gallery>
== Platform Sign == This tells passengers, dispatchers, guards and drivers what platform they are standing on. <gallery> File:Platform Sign DE.png|A sign at [[Dovedale East]] showing the platform. </gallery>
== Countdown Markers == A Countdown Marker tells drivers that a station or a signal is ahead. They are often placed subsequently to inform drivers about the distance.
<gallery> File:station ahead.png|A sign denoting that a station is ahead. </gallery>
== Poor Adhesion Site == This sign indicates to drivers that due to various factors, there is less 'grip' (adhesion) on the train to the tracks, and they need to be careful. Low adhesion arises from a number of causes, most notably from leaf contamination arising from lineside vegetation. <ref> https://www.rail-traction.com/what-is-low-adhesion/ </ref> At the end of the site, there is a sign to indicate that the track is back to normal. <gallery> File:poor adhesion site sign.png|Start of site File:poor adhesion end.png|End of site </gallery>
== AWS Gap == The "Commencement of AWS Gap" sign indicates to drivers that AWS is not available on the following line segment, while the "Termination of AWS Gap" sign indicates that AWS is available again on the following line segment.<ref>https://www.railsigns.uk/sect12page1.html</ref>
These signs are currently only installed at the beginning of the line branching off at the [[Satus Services]] sidings.
== Low clearance indicator == [[File:LowClearanceIndicator.png|right|150px]] When you see this red and white chequered sign, this is to inform potential engineering teams that the next section has limited clearance and they will need to take extra measures to make sure they're not involved with an accident with a train. This can be found at places like between [[Pallion Harbour]] and [[Dovedale Central]] or [[Perthtyne]] where either width clearance or height clearance is low.
<gallery> Commencement of AWS Gap Sign.png|A "Commencement of AWS Gap" sign Termination of AWS Gap Sign.png|A "Termination of AWS Gap" sign </gallery>
== References == [[Category:Features]]

revision.comment: Removed empty row at the top of buzz codes table
revision.text:
Guards are appointed by drivers to ensure that all passengers board safely and the doors are operated safely. Drivers can appoint a guard in the UI. (Feature not yet fully implemented, driver-guard agreement for the guard to guard the train)
To start guarding a train, ask for driver permission first. If you have received permission, head to the back of the train and click the panel in the cab until a UI pops up. You are now a guard.
Below are the Guarding Instructions. {| class="fandom-table" !Guarding without a dispatcher !Guarding with a dispatcher |- | * Guard buzzes driver 1 to indicate train stop. The driver buzzes 1 back. * The guard checks if everything is safe, and opens the doors if so. * Guard waits for Green signal, or for all passengers to load, and closes doors once there are no obstructions. * Once the interlock light goes out, the Guard buzzes the driver 2, whistles, and shows the green flag * Train can proceed. | * Guard buzzes driver 1 to indicate train stop. The driver buzzes 1 back. * The guard checks if everything is safe, and opens the doors if so. * Guard waits for the dispatcher to show green, and the Close Doors (CD) sign, and closes doors once there are no obstructions. * Once the interlock light goes out, the Guard buzzes the driver 2, whistles, and shows the green flag * Train can proceed. |}
==Buzz Codes== Buzz codes work similarly to bell codes. Below are a list for communication between driver & guard. {| class="fandom-table" !Buzz Code !Description !Reply Required? |- |1 |Train is to stop at the next station. |Yes |- |2 |Train is ready to proceed. |Yes |} [[Category:Guides]]

revision.text:
The '''Class 158 Express Sprinter''' is a diesel multiple unit (DMU) in the Sprinter family of trains that can be spawned at [[Dovedale Central]] ('Barbie' livery) and [[Masonfield]] ('Saltire' livery). It is designed for regional routes and has a maximum speed of 75 mph, and has no routing limitations.
<tabber> |-| 'Barbie' livery = {{Class 158 Barbie}} |-| 'Saltire' livery = {{Class 158 Saltire}} </tabber>
== Trivia == * The 158 was shown in the Dovedale Update Trailer. * The Class 158, along with the [[Class 156]] and [[Class 150]] are all the members of the Sprinter family of trains present in game. * The 'Barbie' livery version of the train used to get stuck at [[Dovedale East Crossing]] before this was patched in late April of 2024<ref>https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1114201748253442158/1231206145289490453</ref>.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Class 158 New Livery Winter.png|The Scotrail 'Saltire' livery of the Class 158 near the Masonfield Sidings during winter File:Saltire185Interior2.png|Another angle of the interior of the Class 158 Scotrail 'Saltire' livery </gallery>
== References == [[Category:Trains]]
[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fS-8w4bP5E0 The V1.0 update releases in... November 26 2023 03:30:00 +0800!]

revision.text: == Info == Simply paste {{LastEdit}} onto a page to show a full version of the last edit. If you just want a date, heda over to [[Template:LastEditDate]] instead. Will auto update when it gets edited. == Parameters == ===pagename=== Defaults to the page name. To change, just add the pagename addition. ==dateformat== defaults to the DD-MM-YYYY standard of the wiki, using the gregorian calendar. You can change this to any of the following to change the format: mdy, dmy, ymd, ISO 8601 Important: Although the ISO 8601 standard requires that dates be in the Gregorian calendar, the ISO parameter in this function will still format dates that fall outside the usual Gregorian range (e.g. dates prior to 1583). Also, the magic word cannot properly convert between negative years (used with ISO 8601) and years BC or years BCE (used in general writing). Please see the dateformat section on the MediaWiki magic words site. https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Magic_words

{{Station |image1= <gallery> File:Fanory turntable.png|Fanory Mill File:Pallion Harbour turntable thing.png|Pallion Harbour File:Satus Turntable.png|Satus Services </gallery> }} '''Turntables''' were items that drivers can use to switch sides on their trains. As all were removed, there haven't been any turntables in the game since Version 1.0. In Version 7072, there existed two turntables, one at [[Fanory Mill]] and another just north of [[Pallion Harbour]]. Historically, there were three turntables, with an additional one being located at the [[Satus Services]] sidings.
Before the current driving GUI was introduced, switching sidings in trains was not possible. In addition, switching sides was never possible on [[Steam Train|Steam Trains]], though they could reverse, which thus required the presence of turntables.
In later versions, when newer systems came out to switch sides on newer trains, turntables were progressively removed, though switching sides could only occur on straight tracks. Shunting had also played a part in phasing out turntables. Since the release of Version 1.0, drivers can switch sides without the fear of derailing, and there are thus no more turntables in game.
== Trivia == * The turntable at Pallion Harbour could not be used after the [[Dovedale Central]] revamp as there was no lever to change its point. [[Category:Features]]

revision.text:
[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:Jaidens house.png|Station (day) File:Jaidens house night.png|Station (night) File:Jaidens house path.png|Path File:Sign at jaidens house.png|Sign File:Jaiden.png|Jaiden File:Jaiden's House.jpg|House |preceding_other=[[Satus Services]] |following_other=[[Dovedale East]] |preceding_steam=[[Satus Services]] |following_steam=[[Dovedale East]] |signal_box=N/A |station_code= JDH |number_of_platforms= 1 |number_of_tracks= 1 |dispatching= No }} '''Jaiden's House''' is a station located between [[Satus Services]] and [[Dovedale East]]. It consists of only one platform, with signage reading 'Jaiden's House' and 'For Jaiden's house only'. There is also a dirt path to gain access to the platform from the house. Jaiden's House does not have its own signal box, and is controlled by the nearby [[Satus Signal Box]]. There are no starter signals at Jaiden's House. Services typically do not stop at this station and it is generally Not In Operation. This area was created by RAYE and upgraded by qwerty. == Tracks ==
''' 1''' - Through & stopping trains towards [[Dovedale East]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Trivia == * Jaiden's House originated from a joke by BoyPro. * Jaiden can be found in a wheelchair near the platform. * It is featured in all station announcements. == Gallery == File:Jaidens House Station Winter.jpg|The station during winter. File:Jaidens House Winter.jpg|The house during winter. == References ==

revision.text:
[[Category:Signal Boxes]] {{SignalBox |image1 = <gallery> File:Masonfield Signal Box v1.2.jpg|Exterior File:Masonfield Signal Box Interior.jpg|Interior File:Masonfield Signal Box Chart.png|Board </gallery> |stations_controlled=[[Masonfield]] |crossings_controlled=[[Masonfield Crossing]] |nearest_station=[[Masonfield]] |signal_type=Semaphore Signals |xp_requirment=2500XP |home_signals_controlled=12 |distant_signals_controlled=2 |points_controlled=9 |shunt_signals_controlled=13}} The '''Masonfield Signal Box''' is a signal box located at [[Masonfield]]. It houses 12 Semaphore Stop Signals, 2 Distant Semaphore Signals, 13 shunt signals and 9 points.
== Operations == The box controls the Masonfield station, the [[Masonfield Crossing|nearby crossing]] and the Masonfield sidings which house the spawners for the [[Class 43]] and [[Class 158|Class 158 ('Saltire' livery)]].
== Trivia == * The box houses the disused levers 1-4 as well as lever 9 that was located in the old [[Satus Signal Box]] before Version 1.0.

revision.text: Labeled by the number, each function/information available to the driver.

'''{{{1|Dovedale Driving Guide}}}'''
'''{{{1|Dovedale Driving Guide}}}'''
'''Driving''' is an essential operation of every railway network. Players in the Dovedale have a variety of trains and routes available to them with no experience required. The Table of Contents is there to provide you with everything you need to know about driving in Dovedale. '''This guide is not finished. Some parts are still being made.''' ==Start-up== {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid lightblue" ! |- {| !1.1 - The Basics |- |This guide is essential for all train drivers in Dovedale. It covers where to spawn trains, the meanings of signals, train controls, dispatching and guarding, and the different buttons on the HUD. |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid lightblue" ! |- {| !1.2 - HUD (Heads up display) |- |HUD is what every train driver sees and it is important to know what HUD provides. In picture below, track down the numbers which will explain every piece of the HUD. # High Horn - Sounds higher pitch of horn # Low Horn - Sounds lower pitch of horn # Switch sides - Switches direction of travel # Class & Headcode Info - Provides information about Class and Headcode # Lights - Turn on/off lights # Doors left - Open doors on left side of the train # Doors right - Open doors on right side of the train # Speed Indicator - Shows how fast the train is going # Emergency brake - Sets throttle to 0 and brakes to maximum # Appoint guard - Appoints as guard # Buzzer - Sends a buzz to the Guard # Throttle indicator - Bar on left indicates set throttle and bar on right indicates current level of throttle # Brake indicator - Bar on left indicates level of brakes that is set and bar on right indicates current level of brakes applied # AWS - Sounds a horn when approaching any [signals] without a proceed aspect, and sounds a bell where a proceed aspect is shown on the next signal [[File:HUD.png|thumb|920x920px|Heads up display - Labeled controls/Information]] |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid lightblue" ! |- {| !1.3 - Controls |- |Driving controls are essential for safe driving. Acceleration and braking are controlled through these simple mechanisms. It is also important to know how to acknowledge an AWS alarm while driving. # W - Throttle up # S - Throttle down # A - Brakes up # D - Brakes down # E - Emergency brake # Q - Acknowledge AWS # X - Reset throttle and brakes Below is a diagram on controls when playing with an Xbox 360 controller. [[File:XboxControls.png|left|frameless]] |} ==Encountering while on tracks== {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid crimson" ! |- {| !2.1 - Signals |- |Signals are a simple way of letting drivers know if the track ahead is clear. Before signals existed, there were people holding different flags. They used to deploy flags in order to let the driver know what is going on ahead. Both signals and flags exist in the game. What each one represents is explained below. [[File:British home and distant railway semaphore RYG signals.svg|thumb|419x419px]]First we need to know what is each type of signal: # Distant signals (Yellow) - Warns the driver of the state of all home signals until the next distant or end of section. If green all of the related signals are green if yellow at least one of the related signals are red. You may encounter a fixed distant which doesn't have a green lens, these warn of an upcoming buffer stop or a place where signals are often red, for details see below. #Distant boards Distant Boards or Reflectorized distant boards are a white board with a picture of a distant signal superimposed on them. They mean the same as a fixed distant #Home signals (Red) - Alert drivers if they should stop or pass the current signal. #Shunt signals (Circle) - Allow you to pass at caution (when green), the signaller may give special direction to you when passing this signal. [[File:Shunt Signals.png|thumb|330x330px]]Also for example, if you encounter a Yellow Distant signal it means you should slow down, but if you encounter a Green Distant signal you can continue normally. If there is a cross on the signal, it means that it is out of use (although this has little use as signals don't break yet). It is always best to check with the signaller if you can proceed. Additionally, [[Signals]] are also explained in detail on the hyperlinked page. |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid crimson" ! |- {| !2.2 - Flags |- | Flags are an older way of signalling that is not very different from the signalling system mentioned above. They use a slightly different system, but like mentioned, flags are shown by person. The person who is showing a flag needs to be 100% sure of their choice, so it is always better to rely on [[signals]]. [[File:Flags.jpg|thumb|258x258px]]There are 3 flags: #Red flag - Stop the train immediately #Yellow flag - Gives authority to pass a signal at danger #Green flag - Gives authority to pass over a level crossing Flags are commonly used by trollers, thus signals should be followed even if flags are allowing the train to proceed. |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid crimson" ! |- {| !2.3 - Signs |- |''See: [[Signs]]''
|} ==Procedures == {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid #e09f00" ! |- {| !3.1 - Arriving at a Station |- | Before arriving at a station, signal corresponding to your platform or group of platforms could be set to the danger. This means that there is a possibility of slowing down more in order to safely bring a train to the stop, however every driver should be aware of this. Once cleared into the platform you will always encounter "S" marker. It is placed on the end of the platform. You should stop your train at that marker. There can be special markers for different types of trains, for example, a blue marker for the [[Class 323]] at [[Fanory Mill]]. These markers need to be followed in order to reach the TRTS button (more information below). |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid #e09f00" ! |- {| ! 3.2 - Departing from a station |- |Once you are at the platform, if your intentions are different from the standard procedure (Shunting for example) you must make contact with signaller and notify about your intentions. After signaller is aware of your path, you must wait for the corresponding signal to be cleared. Some stations are busy and signallers cannot keep their attention only at one train. That is why TRTS system is introduced. TRTS stands for Train Ready To Start. TRTS is not located at all stations. TRTS is supposed to be used by the Dispatchers but in case there aren't any, Drivers can use it too. TRTS sends the Signaller a bell that the train on the platform is ready to depart. It should be used only in that case, but it is known that trollers like to abuse it. Once the [[Signals|Signal]] on the platform shows that you can proceed, you are free to depart the station. |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid #e09f00" ! |- {| !3.3 - Shunting procedure |- |Shunting procedure is rarely used to send trains to their destination in a way that requires a reversing action. Steps explained below must be followed precisely to avoid confusion with signaller. #Contact Signaller - Make sure that they are fully aware of your upcoming actions. #Await signal clearance #Drive until "Limit of Shunt" sign, or to the point the signaller told you to stop at # Once "Limit of Shunt" sign or the point that the signaller has told you to stop at is reached start reversing to next signal/end of depot. Limit of Shunt signs are only used on double lines when traveling on the left track and they cannot be passed under any circumstances, they act as red signals. |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid #e09f00" ! |- {| !3.4 - Dismissing AWS procedure |- |AWS (Automated Warning System) is system designed to alert the drivers in case of a Danger signal ahead of them. AWS is represented by Yellow circle and audible warning. To dismiss the warning simply left click on the circle or press Q. Audible warning should stop. In case of driver failing to respond to the AWS, audible warning will continue, and unlike to the real-life system the train won't be stopped. |} {| class="article-table mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" width="100%" style="border: .1em solid #e09f00" ! |- {| !3.5 - Passing Signal at Danger |- |Signal Passed at Danger (known as SPAD) means that train disregarded their signal and proceeded against it. This is considered as an in-game offence meaning that you If you passed signal at Danger '''without Signaller approval''', you must: *Stop your train immediately *Check for the derailment *Inform the signaller of the SPAD *Communicate and determine next steps with Signaller |}__FORCETOC__ [[Category:Guides]]

revision.text:
{{Station |image1= File:new perthyne.png|Day File:Perthtyne Night.png|Night File:new perthyne bridge iew.png|Bridge View |preceding_other=[[Gleethrop End]] |following_other=[[Mazewood]] |singal_box=[[Dovedale Central Signal Box]] |preceding_steam=No Operation |following_steam=No Operation |station_code= PT |number_of_platforms= 1 |number_of_tracks= 1 }} '''Perthtyne''' is the terminus station of the branch line from [[Dovedale Central]] via [[Gleethrop End]]. It features a run-down and slightly overgrown brick station building, and a small bridge. This station is now accessible to the public after version 1.2, although a wall and buffers are placed after it, blocking access to [[Mazewood]]. == Tracks ==
'''1''' - Terminating Services from [[Dovedale Central]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Trivia == * Between version 1.1 and 1.2, Perthtyne was blocked off by an invisible wall located at Gleethrop End. == Gallery == File:Perthtyne.jpg|Old Day view of the station. File:Perthtyne Winter.png|The old station during winter. [[Category:Stations]]
