revision.text:
<default>{{PAGENAME}}</default>
General information
 Example usage: 
{{Passing Loop

  | title1=Example

  | image1=Example

  | caption-image1=Example

  | general_information=Example

  | location=Example

  | signal_box=Example

  | tracks=Example

  | catch_points=Example

}}
{ "params": { "title1": { "suggested": true }, "image1": { "suggested": true, "description": "An image of the passing loop" }, "caption-image1": { "suggested": true }, "general_information": { "suggested": true }, "location": { "suggested": true, "description": "The location (e.g. stations/lines) of this passing loop" }, "signal_box": { "suggested": true, "description": "The signal box that controls the signals and points of this passing loop" }, "tracks": { "suggested": true, "description": "The amount of tracks this passing loop has", "required": true }, "catch_points": { "suggested": true, "description": "Whether this passing loop has catch points and, if so, their locations" } }, "sets": [], "description": "Infobox for a passing loop" }

{{Passing_Loop |title1=Benyhone Loop |image1= <gallery> File:A view of benyhone loop and signalbox from the direction of FM.png|Day view File:Benyhone Loop Signal Box Day.jpg|Signal box File:Benyhone overpass.png|Overpass </gallery> |tracks=2 |location=Between [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]], next to [[Benyhone Loop Signal Box]] |signal_box=[[Benyhone Loop Signal Box]] |catch_points=At both ends}}
'''Benyhone Loop''' is a passing loop located between [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]]. It houses two tracks and allows trains to pass each other. On both ends, there are catch points that prevent trains on the passing track to pass a signal showing a danger aspect (SPADing).
It was added in Version 1.1 and is the first passing loop in the game that is not part of a station.
Point 15, one of the catch points, is located on top of an overpass.
This was updated in version 1.2 to feature a wider gap between tracks and new trap points.
This area was created by RAYE.
==Trivia== *Before Version 1.0, [[Greenwood]] was to be on the line extension after [[Fanory Mill]]. However, it was removed and the Benyhone Loop was later added instead.
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Benyhone Loop Winter.jpg|Benyhone Loop during winter File:Benyhone Loop Winter 2.jpg|Overview of the loop during winter </gallery> [[Category:Landmarks]]

[[Category:Signal Boxes]] {{SignalBox |image1 = <gallery> File:Benyhone Loop Signal Box Day.jpg|Exterior File:Benyhone loop interior.png|Interior File:Benyhone Loop Signal Box Board.png|Board </gallery> |stations_controlled=N/A |crossings_controlled=N/A |nearest_station=[[Fanory Mill]] |signal_type=Semaphore Signals |home_signals_controlled=7 |distant_signals_controlled=3 |points_controlled=4 |shunt_signals_controlled=N/A |xp_requirment=1000XP}} '''Benyhone Loop Signal Box''' is the signal box controlling the [[Benyhone Loop]] and some of the surrounding line. It currently houses 18 levers that control 7 Semaphore Stop Signals, 3 Distant Semaphore Signals and 4 switches, two of which act as catch points. It was added in version 1.1 but is not fully complete yet.
The signal box features the new [[Signalling Guide#Electronic Token Block Signallng|Token System]].
While [[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch|Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch Station]] was added to the end of the line, it currently has no signals and is not controlled by a signal box.
Benyhone Loop Signal Box is the only box in game to have wires from levers in signal box to actual signals/points.
This area was created by RAYE.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Benyhone Loop Winter.jpg|The signal box during winter </gallery>

page.title: File:A view of benyhone loop and signalbox from the direction of FM.png

revision.text:
{{Train|title1=Class 377|top_speed=125 mph|powered_by=750V Electric Motor|spawn_points=Fanory Mill|coaches=4|train_information=|doors=16|row1=|date_added=N/A|status=Public|image1=File:Class_387_Dovedale_Sneak.png|caption-image1=The Class 377 at an old version of Fanory Mill.}} The '''Class 377''' is an electric multiple unit (EMU) that can be spawned at [[Fanory Mill]] sidings. The Class 377 is a Commuter Train made for regional routes. The Class 377 has a top speed of 125 mph in game.
== Trivia == * The Class 377 has a green livery, similar to its real life counterpart which is used in East London by Southern. * Even though there is no interior, you can still sit as a passenger in the Class 377.
[[Category:Trains]]

revision.text: A picture of Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch station, in daylight.

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= File:LLA Day New.jpg|Station (day) File:llanfairNoSnowNighttime.png|Station (night) File:LLA Sign.png|Signage |preceding_other=[[Fanory Mill]] |following_other=Terminus (previously [[Abermoore]]) |signal_box=N/A |station_code=LPG |number_of_platforms= 1 |number_of_tracks= 1 |dispatching= No }} '''Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch''' is a small station located on the [[Benyhone Loop]] extension past [[Fanory Mill]]. It consists of a single platform, with two signs reading the full name of the station along with its pronunciation. Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch does not have a signal box, and is uncontrolled with no home or starter signals on or around the station. Services typically do not stop here due to the distance from the previous station. This station is where electric trains terminate, but diesel trains can continue down the line. The station will be removed in the futurehttps://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1192659239278231612/1230856432555921569. == Tracks ==
''' 1''' - Passing and stopping trains towards [[Fanory Mill]] or [[Abermoore]]
[[File:RailwayTrack.png]]
== Trivia == * This station is one of two stations in the game to not feature station announcements. == Gallery == File:LLA Day.png|The station during winter == Audio == [[File:How to Spell.mp3|left|236x236px]] == References ==

{{Place | image1= <gallery> File:Training Centre.jpg|Day View File:Training Centre Night.png|Night View </gallery> | usage=Training | closest_station=[[Dovedale East]] }}
The '''Training Centre''' is a building located near [[Dovedale East]]. It contains 2 classrooms, a staff area and a model replica of a signalling system. It is used as the initial briefing area for Qualified Signaller trainings as well as the holding area while assessments are ongoing.
Originally created by RAYE and upgraded and functionalised by enews.
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Training Centre Winter.jpg|The Training Centre during winter </gallery> [[Category:Landmarks]]

A VR menu that is used in dovedale.

Side profile of the Dovedale van.

{{Insert |title = Dovedale Maintenance Van |image = DovedaleVanSide.png |caption = A side view of the van. |specifications = Specifications |top_speed = 182 mph |0-60 = 11.40 seconds |lights = Yellow Hazard Beacons |sirens = N/A}} The '''Dovedale Maintenance Van''' is a multi-purpose vehicle used for repairs, incident response, and general maintenance. It features 8 seats, a warning light system, and a custom livery. As of now, it can only be spawned by an Administrator or higher.
The yellow hazard beacons can be activated by pressing a button in the console. The vehicle is not fitted with sirens, and has a top speed of 182 mph.
== Gallery == <gallery> DovedaleVanInterior.png|The interior of the Dovedale Maintenance van. DovedaleVanSatus.png|The Dovedale Maintenance van outside [[Satus Services]]. </gallery>

revision.text:
{{Person
| title1=RAYE
| pictureofperson=RAYE.png
| caption-pictureofperson=
| information=Information
| rank=Qualified Signaller (Formerly Head Developer)
|hired_on_the:=13th of June 2023}}Raye was a '''Head Developer''' on the Dovedale Staff team. Raye was hired as of June 13th, 2023.
He was known for causing chaos, which is the origin of the Raye Alert System and the Raye Alert sticker. Raye is also the founder of [[Rayes Transportation Services Limited]], and maintained several locomotives.
Raye is also the creator of the [[Benyhone Loop]] extension.
Raye shared a range of sneak peeks of new areas coming to Dovedale in the future such as "Fisherman's halt" and "Abermoore" stations on the line past [[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]].
Raye resigned on 16 April 2024, his resignation notice can be found [https://telegra.ph/Resignation-notices-04-16 here], among ones from other staff members. [[Category:Staff Members]]

revision.comment: Protected "[[Staff/ellafellah]]": Excessive vandalism: Suspected vandalism target ([Edit=Allow only administrators] (indefinite) [Move=Allow only administrators] (indefinite))
revision.text:
{{Person
| title1=Ella
| pictureofperson=ella.png
| caption-pictureofperson=
| information=Information
| rank=None (Former Head of Staff)
|hired_on_the:=2 August 2023}}Ella, known as ellafellah, was '''Head of Staff''' on the Dovedale Staff team. Ella was hired on 2 August 2023.
Ella is known for rewriting and changing policies, handling administration, and taking care of the staff team.
Ella retired on 19 Febuary 2024, citing personal reasons, then rejoined on 17 March 2024.
Ella resigned from her role and left the Dovedale community on 13 April 2024. Her resignation notice can be found [https://telegra.ph/Resignation-Notice-Shown-to-staff-prior-04-16 here]. [[Category:Staff Members]]

{{Person
| title1=Jaiden
| pictureofperson=
| caption-pictureofperson=
| information=Information
| rank=Owner
}}Jaiden is the '''owner''' of Dovedale Railway. They are known for assisting with development, creating assets such as the [[Dovedale Maintenance Van]], and assisting with moderation and administration. [[Category:Staff Members]]

{{WikiStaffVerification}}
'''MY NEW USERPAGE IS [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/User:Bob HERE], PLEASE DO NOT USE THIS ONE AND INSTEAD USE THE NEW WIKI.'''
== Hiya == Hi! I'm Bob, wiki moderator and frequent Dovedale player. Feel free to message me on [[Message Wall:Bigbadbob85|my message wall]] with any questions or concerns. I am generally very active so should get back to you within 12 hours of your message. If I don't get back to you then direct message me on Discord and tell me to check my message wall.
My favourite things to do on the wiki are:
* Stalk [[Special:RecentChanges|Recent Changes]] until I find something to add on to. * Add to articles that I am working on. * Do categorisation and organisational tasks. * Fix broken grammar/links.
== Dovedale Stuff == My favourite signal box in Dovedale is probably [[Satus Signal Box]], even with all of the trollers it gets.
My least favourite is probably [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]], as the number of SPADs is crazy.
My favourite train in the game is the [[Class 43]].
My favourite station in the game is [[Dovedale Central]], I like the design and platform layout as well as the pretty good (although easily depleted) capacity it holds for the [[Masonfield]] to [[Satus Services]] (and beyond) routes.
== My Wikis == I contribute to a number of wikis, however the main ones are:
* [https://wcr.fandom.com/ Whitecoast City Railway Unofficial Wiki] * [https://britishrailway.fandom.com/ British Railway Wiki] * [https://dovedale.fandom.com/ Dovedale Railway Wiki] * [https://manchester-retrolink-roblox.fandom.com/ Manchester Retrolink Roblox Wiki] * [https://scr.fandom.com/ Stepford County Railway Unoffical Wiki] * [https://gmr.fandom.com/ Great Midlands Railway Wiki]
I am also an admin on these wikis:
* [https://gmr.fandom.com/ Great Midlands Railway Wiki] ''(Moderator, Administrator, Bureaucrat)'' * [https://manchester-retrolink-roblox.fandom.com/ Manchester Retrolink Roblox Wiki] ''(Moderator, Administrator, Bureaucrat)'' * [https://wcr.fandom.com/ Whitecoast City Railway Unofficial Wiki] ''(Moderator, Administrator)'' * [https://dovedale.fandom.com/ Dovedale Railway Wiki] ''(Moderator)''
== Userspace Links ==
* [[User:Bigbadbob85/Sandbox|Sandbox]] * [[User:Bigbadbob85/Building|Building]]
[[File:Maxwell the cat.webp|left|thumb|300x300px|You found Maxwell |link=]]

revision.text: This is the category for all landmarks in Dovedale. For a more detailed overview, see [[List of Landmarks]].

{{Train |image1= <gallery> File:destination board.png|Settings (DE) File:Releovka Board.png|Settings (Releovka) File:Releovka7 northern.png|Board </gallery> | caption-image1=The old machine at the old [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre|Dovedale East Signalling Box]] }} Destination boards were an old feature that worked in tandem with the now removed [[Releovka System]]. They were used to show estimated times, service type, platform and destinations. Data would be manually entered by the signaller through the machine.
To use the machine, users would need to click what they were going to toggle, and then flip the switches below until they are at the right selection.
They were previously located at [[Dovedale East]] and [[Dovedale Central]]. The board at Dovedale Central was connected with the [[Releovka System]].
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Board DE.png|The board at old Dovedale East station. </gallery> [[Category:Features]]

{{Train|image1= <gallery> File:class158.png|Exterior File:Barbie185Interior.png|Interior </gallery> |title1=Class 158 'Barbie'|top_speed=75 mph|powered_by=Diesel|coaches=2|doors=8|date_added=N/A|status=Public|spawn_points=[[Dovedale Central]]}}
The ScotRail 'Barbie' livery was the first livery of the Class 158 to be released. It features an interior with red seats, though players currently cannot sit on them.

{{Train|image1= <gallery> File:Saltire185Exterior.png|Exterior File:Saltire185Interior.png|Interior </gallery> |title1=Class 158 'Saltire'|top_speed=75 mph|powered_by=Diesel|coaches=2|doors=8|date_added=January 3, 2024|status=Public|spawn_points=[[Masonfield]]}}
In version 1.1.4, a new version of the train with a livery similar to the Scotrail 'Saltire' livery was added that can be spawned at the [[Masonfield|Masonfield sidings]]. It has an interior with blue seats and a blue floor.

{{Train | image1 = <gallery> File:Class 411 Front.png|Front File:Class 411 Rear.png|Rear File:Class 411 Coach.png|Coaches File:Class 411 Interior1.png|Interior 1 File:Class 411 Interior2.png|Interior 2 File:Class 411 DriverCab.png|Driver's Cab </gallery> |top_speed = 125 mph |powered_by = Electric |spawn_points = [[Gleethrop End]] |coaches = 4 |doors = 28 |date_added = N/A |status = Admin Only |operator = N/A }} The '''Class 411''' is an admin-only electric multiple unit (EMU) with a top speed of 125 mph. It is primarily used for commuter services and can be spawned using admin commands at [[Gleethrop End]] on Platform 2. The train is primarily painted in a green colour, featuring yellow both at the front and at the back of the EMU. The train's rear coach features a tail lamp.

File:Class 411 DC2.png|Class 411 awaiting clearance at DC 18. File:Class 411 Stationary.png|A stationary Class 411 parked at [[Satus Services]]. </gallery>

[[Category:Stations]] {{Station |image1= <gallery> File:Abermoore Unfinished.png|Day File:Abermoore Unfinished Night.png|Night Abermoore Unfinished Platform View.jpg|Platforms </gallery> |preceding_other=[[Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]] |following_other=Terminus |signal_box=N/A |station_code=ABM |number_of_platforms=5 |number_of_tracks=6 |dispatching=No }}
'''Abermoore''' was a terminus station past [https://dovedale.wiki/wiki/Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch]. It housed 5 platforms.
In addition to the single-track line from Llanfairpwllgwyngyllgogerychwyrndrobwllllantysiliogogogoch, there was also an unfinished double-track line terminating here that was added along with the station. It ran through the sea, was partially embanked on sand and ended after a few hundred meters.
In its state before removal, the station was floating above the sea and its switches couldn't be controlled without assistance from a developer.
== Trivia == * The name of the station was chosen through a name competition. ** In the announcement of the name competition, the station was described as a "grand terminus station which is semi-subsurface and is next to the ocean".<ref>https://discord.com/channels/1113532700121378896/1116458853610037298/1192581438114103316</ref>
== Gallery == <gallery> File:Abermoore Junction Unfinished.png|The junction near the station where two lines seperate. File:Abermoore Column Arch.png|An arch of the station ceiling with emblems showing the flags of England, Wales and Scotland. </gallery>
== References ==

{{Crossing | image1= <gallery> File:Gleethrop Crossing.png|Day File:Gleethrop Crossing Night.png|Night </gallery> | singal_box=N/A (automatic) | tracks=2 | road_lanes=2 | gate_operation=Automatic | crossing_code=Unknown | nearest_station=[[Dovedale Central]] }}
'''Gleethrop Crossing''' is an ''Automatic Barrier Crossing Locally Monitored'' between [[Dovedale Central]] and [[Gleethrop End]].
The crossing is currently operational.
== Trivia == * This is the first level crossing to be located in the area of the [[Dovedale Central Signal Box]].
== Gallery == <gallery> File:GleethropCrossingActivated.png|Gleethrop Crossing when activated. </gallery>

revision.text:
== Rules & Guidelines == In addition to the regular [[Project:Rules|Dovedale game rules]], as a Qualified Signaller (QS), you should follow these extra rules/guidelines. Qualified Signallers are expected to have a good standing in the community. We reserve the right to deny users and remove the role at any time, including users affected by the previous clause. {| class="mw-collapsible fandom-table" !Rule !1st infraction !2nd infraction |- | Do not post confidential information shared with you. |Warning |Suspension 10 days |- |Do not abuse your sword. Swords can be used for kicking trollers out of the box, removing unwanted people out of the box, and removing people who are obstructing the line. Do not abuse your sword for things like killing people to take over the box, or mini-modding. Always ask a person nicely to get out of the box first, or to move. If they do not comply the first time, you may remove them. If in doubt, ask or call a moderator. |Suspension 14 days or Demotion |Demotion and/or Blacklist |- |Behave and listen to staff members. Please listen to what they have to say. |Warning |Suspension 7 days |- |Multiple instances of improper signalling. Examples include causing crashes, derails, or incorrect bell usage. We understand that people make mistakes once in a while! |Warning |Suspension 10 days or Demotion |}
{| class="fandom-table" | style="background-image: linear-gradient(to right, #b28900 50%, #1e0c1b)" |'''Warning''': This is either a game or discord warning.
|- | style="background-image: linear-gradient(to right, #ff6700 50%, #1e0c1b)" |'''Suspension''': You have been suspended for the role for an amount of time, and you can get it back on request after the time has run out.
|- | style="background-image: linear-gradient(to right, #e73d3d 50%, #1e0c1b)" |'''Demotion''': You have been removed from the role due to your infractions, but you can re-apply.
|- | style="background-image: linear-gradient(to right, #4c0306 50%, #1e0c1b)" |'''Blacklist''': You cannot re-apply for this role, either permanently or for a certain amount of time.
|} == Perks == As a QS, you can get the following perks: * Priority to signal in RP Sessions * Ability to help in trainings when required * The swag RP Signaller badge * A sword * In-game name tag == Refresher == If you ever need a refresher on how to signal, you can always read through these pages:
- [[Signalling Guide]]
- [[Signals]]
- [[Signs]]
- [[Charts]]
== Qualified Signaller Handbook == For any extra information, please refer to the [[:File:QSHandbook.pdf|Qualified Signaller Handbook]] for help. Click on the PDF image on the file page to open the file.

{{Company Template | image1=SLS logo.png | caption-image1=Company Logo | owner=Realthebritishgamer | founding_date=November 2023 | location_base=[[SLS Maintenance Yard]] | primary_locomotives=Unknown | fleet_size=14 | fleet_age=N/A}}
<!-- Please only add information verified from developers and not made up stuff, this page is prone to such issues thus warranting this comment !--> '''Satus Locomotive Services (SLS)''' is a company that operates on the network. According to the company, they store, refurbish, preserve and convert rolling stock for use. The company also provides freight work and track work.
Satus Locomotive Services is currently based at the [[SLS Maintenance Yard]].
A new shed is currently in the progress of being constructed and will be delivered at a later date due to delays.
== Current Fleet == {| class="fandom-table" !Photo !Class !Livery !Name !Notes |- |[[File:Pride 150139.png|thumb]] |Class 150139 |SLS Pride - EX LNWR Marstem Vale |N/A |Unit is fit for Mainline |- |[[File:950001.png|thumb]] |Class 950001 |Network Rail Yellow |N/A |Unit is fit for Mainline |- |[[File:08.png|thumb]] |Class 08007 |BR Blue |N/A |Unit is fit for Mainline |- |[[File:SLS 27112.png|thumb]] |Class 27112 |BR Green w/o BR Crest |Poppy |Unit is fit for Mainline |- |[[File:SLS 27762.png|thumb]] |Class 27762 |Network Rail Yellow |Florence |Unit is fit for Mainline (LOANED FROM TYLAD) |- |[[File:SLS 27338.png|thumb]] |Class 27338 |BR Blue |Crystal |Unit is fit for Mainline (LOANED FROM TYLAD) |- |[[File:411757.png|thumb]] |Class 411757 |SLS Red |N/A |In service, sounds are iffy |- |[[File:37419.png|thumb]] |Class 37419 |Intercity |Par Signal Box 1880 - 2024 144 Years of operation |Unit is fit for Mainline |- |[[File:37516.png|thumb]] |Class 37516 |West Coast Railways Red |Phoenix |Entering service soon |- |[[File:37716.png|thumb]] |Class 37716 |MET Police |N/A |Entering service soon |- |[[File:145069.png|thumb]] |Class 145069 |Plain Blue (Arriva Trains Wales Blue Doors) |N/A |Unit is fit for Mainline |- |[[File:92021.png|thumb]] |Class 92021 |BR two-tone grey |N/A |Unit is fit for Mainline |- |[[File:58101.png|thumb]] |Class 58101 |EWS Maroon and yellow |N/A |Out of Service |- |[[File:58102.png|thumb]] |Class 58102 |EWS Maroon and yellow |N/A |Out of Service |} == Former Fleet == {| class="fandom-table" !Photo !Class !Livery !Name !Notes |- |[[File:145101.png|thumb]] |Class 145101 |Arriva Trains Wales |N/A |SCRAPPED |- |} ==Future Fleet== SLS is currently waiting for 150255 to leave Transport for Wales, for delivery to be carried out, and for testing to begin. The group is also awaiting 350135 to get its powerpack installed and interior refurbishment to be completed. Additionally, the company is also waiting for a Class 66 to be delivered from GBRF once a loco overhaul is completed. [[Category:Companies]]

{{Company Template | image1=Placeholder.png | company_information=Example | owner=[[Staff/RAYE|RAYE]] | company_links=N/A | founding_date=Unknown | location_base=[[Abermoore]] | primary_locomotives=Unknown | fleet_size=3 | fleet_age=Example}}
'''Rayes Transportation Services Limited (RTS)''' was a company based around the [[Abermoore]] area of the Dovedale network.
This company operated heritage and modern locomotives on various contracts such as railtours, aggregate haulage, empty coaching stock moves and locomotive drags. RTS operated a fleet of 3 Class 27 locomotives and 2 [[Class 43]] powercars.
RTS operated out of various sidings around the map like [[Fanory Mill]] and [[Masonfield]] Sidings. A workshop was under construction. RTS was planned to operate out of the under construction Newhaven-On-Sea Traction Maintenance Depot (TMD). [[Category:Companies]]

{{Place | image1= <gallery> File:SLS Maintenance Yard Box.png|Signal Box File:SLS Maintenance Yard Depot.png|Depot </gallery>
| usage=Storing admin trains | closest_station=[[Dovedale East]] }}{{Stub}}
'''SLS Maintenance Yard''' is a train maintenance yard used by [[Satus Locomotive Services]] and located on the former [[Cosdale Harbour|docks area]].
== Trains Displayed == {| class="fandom-table" |+ !Train !Image !Description |- |Class 37 |[[File:Class37.png|300px]] |This locomotive has no livery, and is a light grey colour. |- |Class 313 ||[[File:Class313.png|300px]] |The Class 313 consists of 3 carriages, all of which use a different livery. On the front there is a headboard that reads "Gerry's 313 Farewell Tour" |- |Class 56 ||[[File:Class56.png|300px]] |Near the water there is a Class 56 in a Railfreight livery that can be seen hanging from a crane. |} [[Category:Landmarks]]

'''Meow Caf''' is a chain of cafs serving a variety of drinks and snacks. There are two branches of Meow Caf in Dovedale. One at [[Dovedale East]] and another at [[Masonfield]].
==Meow Caf Dovedale East== {{Place | image1= <gallery> File:Meow caf.png|Day File:Meow Cafe Night.png|Night </gallery> | usage=Caf | closest_station=[[Dovedale East]] |title1=Meow Caf Dovedale East}}
'''Meow Caf''' '''Dovedale East''' is a caf kiosk mainly catering to waiting train and bus travellers. It was the first branch of Meow Caf to be constructed. The caf serves up food and drinks, like tea, ice cream and coffee. There is a counter and small seating area with tables and bar chairs. Near the entrance, a panel with train departure times hangs from the wall, however the train departure times are not currently live and as a result do not change.
=== Trivia === *The caf build was inspired by a Cafe Amazon outlet at Vientiane Railway Station (LCR). <ref>https://maps.app.goo.gl/36AEZEzAjArgiDEk8</ref> *The caf worker is Roblox user 'gabrykot'.
== Meow Caf Masonfield == {{Place | image1= <gallery> File:Meow Caf MS.jpg|Day File:Meow Caf MS Night.png|Night File:Meow Caf MS Interior.png|Interior </gallery> | usage=Caf | closest_station=[[Masonfield]] |title1=Meow Caf Masonfield}}'''Meow Caf Masonfield''' is the second branch of Meow Caf.
=== Gallery === <gallery> File:Meow Caf Sign.png|A sign informing about the opening of the new caf at Masonfield </gallery>
== References == <references /> [[Category:Landmarks]]

Below is a list of patch notes for major '''game updates'''.
== Pre Version 1.0 ==
=== Major Updates ===
==== Version 4496 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Experimental Class 323 added, please report bugs. + Huge line expansion past Pallion Harbour + New signal types past Pallion Harbour + Masonfield past Marigot Crossing + Marigot Crossing Signalbox controls added + TDEU at Dovedale East and Glassbury Junction + Bells tilt a little to give a reminder of who is ringing
</syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 30/08/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + New DE added </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 6540 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Dovedale Central completely re-worked + New overhead xp ranks (Shunter, Station Manager) + Class 43 HST now available to the public and spawns at Masonfield + Dovedale East signal box re-worked with new instruments and layout + Dovedale East entrance, ticket office and the new updated railway museum + Repositioning of signals and points + New scenery added at DE and DC + Glassbury Junction has been updated with extended platforms + Docks near Dovedale have been updated with scenery + New signage + Banner Repeaters at DE </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 6844 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Radios fixed + Ticket office has been updated at DE + New entrance and scenery in DC + New RP signaller Nametag + Other various fixes and optimisation + Cosdale Cabin map + Signals updated at DC so more are controlled + 156 spawn at DC returns + Class 323 + RP Signaller Swords + Beginning of AWS
</syntaxhighlight>
=== Minor Updates ===
==== Update 1.2.0 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Map in DE Signal box added + New levers in DE Signal box + Track circuits on DE Signal box map added + Line expansion past DE published </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 1.2.1 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + XP System implemented + Bug fixes + Extra decoration added </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 1.2.2 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Decoration around DE added + Level crossing east of DE added + Crossing control unit now functional + Faults added to crossing control unit </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 10/06/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Additional scenery added to the lineside + New footpath made from Steynbath Crossing to DE + 'Dale Green' request stop added + Farmland added at Dale Green + Footpath extended
</syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 14/06/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + +25XP and +50XP developer products added </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 17/06/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Lamps added on engineering loco, in signalboxes and around map. + Day/night cycle added + New shunt signals at DE + Radio added to DE + Rail Story Museum </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 19/06/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Temporary turntable added at Gleethrop End and Dale Green to combat the 156 glitching in reverse + Two new tracks added to DE Radio + 156 Service extended to Dale Green </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 1872 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Improvements for Moderators + New shunt signals at DE + DC Detailing added + Line past DC extended a small distance + Terrain at DE added + Signal 25 Indicator added at DE
Fixes:
Terrain tearing fixed Various track fixes </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 1916 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Tail light on steam carriages
Balances: Steynbath Crossing XP Requirement changed to 100 XP Satus Signalbox XP Requirement changed to 500XP Dovedale East XP Requirement changed to 1000XP
Fixes:
Steam Train no longer spawns above the track </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2271 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + You will now be teleported out of XP Restricted areas if you do not meet requirements + Tail light added to Class 156
Fixes: Lights on 156 now working again </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2283 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Bell models in DE Signalbox for TES </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2286 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Signals will slowly be given a proximity prompt where you can place a marker to indicate whether the signal is broken or not </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2325 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + All signals now have Wooden Cross prompts + Gantry signals have ladders to access the prompts + Destination boards at Dovedale East </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2429 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Dovedale Central now has signals that function (these do not have to be followed as the control system is buggy) + Dovedale Central Releovka system now available for public testing (not fully complete, please report bugs)
</syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2458 ====
===== Part 1 ===== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + New routes on Dovedale Central Releovka + Signals at Central will now automatically set back to danger </syntaxhighlight>
===== Part 2 ===== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Extra detailing + Telegraph poles + Line extension past Pallion Harbour + Class 66 can reverse
Fixes: Releovka turntable -> DE route fixed Minor behind the scenes bug fixes </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2521 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Signal outside of PH Turntable + Route indicator on array at Fanory Mill </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 3070 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Narmouth Level Crossing + Cameras for Steam Line + Experimental Doppler Effect implemented
Fixes: Minor Bug fixes
Tweaks: Turntable positon changed at Fanory Mill to allow for expansion Streaming changed to only stream out when low memory
</syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 23/07/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Cameras added to DC </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 3076 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Plunger system for level crossing at Fanory Mill + New signs on line past Fanory Mill + Signals on line past Fanory Mill + Points 2 and 3 at Fanory Mill now have levers + Mobile & Xbox Support for Class 156
Fixes: Bug fixes
Tweaks: Crossing signal at Fanory Mill now works </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 30/07/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Votekick System Added </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 3112 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Dynamic clouds added + Grab system implemented + Points 4 Interlocking & Lever + Experimental Signal Interlocking at Fanory Mill
Fixes: Bug Fixes
Tweaks: ~25% done with decoration for Fanory Mill </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 03/08/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + 500+ xp required to call an admin </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 23/08/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Swap sides feature + Horns added for the Class 156, 91 and 43
</syntaxhighlight>
=== Hotfixes ===
==== Update 1.1.0 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Trains can now go back up hills again </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 10/06/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Admin call patched </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2461 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Speed 30 is actually now 30 on engineering train + Minor behind the scenes bug fixes </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 2521 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Train flings when entering + In testing train also seems to spawn above tracks less </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 7042 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Unanchored part at Fanory + SAT Dispatch panel + F3 added to DE map + Drive GUI overhaul </syntaxhighlight>
== Post Version 1.0 ==
=== Major Updates ===
==== Version 1 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + ALL stations have been upgraded + NEW loading menu and main menu + NEW signal boxes + NEW information panel in the top right (admin call, bell codes) + NEW trains + NEW guard panel for selected trains + NEW upgraded scenery + NEW AI passengers + NEW flag next to your name on your overhead name + REVAMPED driving GUI </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 1.1.0 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Map size update which includes: + DE and DC Track circuit indicators! + New scenery around the SAT-DE line which includes:
+ Jaidens house station finally implemented + Longer standard gauge line which stops at the hill near DE + New signal wiring and cable trunking at SAT + More foliage and trees
+ New line after Fanory which includes:
+ New box named "Benyhone Loop" which controls the passing loop it sits on and a few signals up and down the line (1k xp and 18 levers)(Not finished) + Some new taller signal variants which are most commonly used to see over the crest of a hill + "Somersault" signals finally permanently implemented into the game + New trestle bridge over the water + Big embankments and hills + A new viaduct over the water + A deep cutting after the viaduct + New inclining loop which shallows the gradient up to the next part of the line + A lot of new scenery to explore
+ Redone FM to include new signals
+ Menu now has tips and facts and correctly displays all train spawners and the loop bug is fixed hooray
+ New maxwell badge!
+ Discord alert logs work for moderators </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 1.2.0 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + New and updated Masonfield including + New canopies + New Station Building + New terrain + New buildings + New Car Stop Markers + New Banner Repeaters and RA/CD indicators + New TRTS Controls + Updated track layout + Updated Signal box + Updated Platforms + Updated Points
+ New scenery around Marigot Crossing and the viaduct + New terrain + New Dam + New Cliffs + Updated Signal layout
+ Updated DC + New RA/CD indicators + New Banner Repeaters + Levers have been renumbered + New signaling including fixed distant arms + New destination display + Updated Gleethrop End + New station canopies + New Layout
+ Updated SAT + New SPAD indicators
+ Updated FM + New terrain + New station building + New canopy + New Bridge and roads + Updated track layout
+ Updated BL + Updated track layout to feature a wider spacing between tracks + Updated lever numbering
+ Brand New SLS yard + Utilises the old docks area + A new location for admins to store trains + The new home base for @SLS Member 's + A great place to explore
+ New Badges + Caffeinated (Hard - Buy a very special drink from the caf.) + Network Manager (Hard - Get 100,000XP in game.)
+ New Sounds + New rail joint sounds on points + Updated running sound + Added physical button sound to the AWS + Optimised train horn muffling
+ Bug Fixes + Speed limit caution signs at DC fixed to show correct value + Fixed issues on the Signal Guide + Fixed lagging on each input + VR menu + Mobile controls fixed + Fixed 158 derailing on most points + Fixed sprinting + Prices in meow caf are now accurate + Fixed Masonfield Sidings crossover + "Pallion Harbour" now correctly spelt + Fixed the spawn buttons breaking + Fixed translations in the menu + Xbox controls fixed </syntaxhighlight>
=== Minor Updates ===
==== Version 1.0.5 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Standard guage line at satus in beginning stages + Other bugs fixed </syntaxhighlight>
==== Winter Update of 2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Traction has been reduced + Track circuits in SAT and FM + FM-SAT bell is now different </syntaxhighlight>
==== Block Instruments ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + New Block Telegraphs between MS - MC, MC - DC and SAT - FM + All bells have been remade </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 23/12/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + HST sound finally completely fixed + DC has a new point (61...). The speed limit has been changed there as well. + HST spawn button moved down to the worker platform </syntaxhighlight>
==== Christmas Block Instrument Update ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + BR Penguin Modular Block Instruments added to DC - DE and DE - SAT </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 08/01/2024 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Added a Caf Kiosk to the waiting area! Explore the caf, and keep a look out on this space! Its a great place to grab some coffee before your trip, or for a date (Made by @yuwhx ) + Fixed some issues with the Railway Museum and added some small bits </syntaxhighlight>
=== Hotfixes ===
==== Version 1.0.2 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Various Bug Fixes </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 1.0.3 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + DC G( ) signals have been renamed to DE G( ) as DE controls those signals + Quick bug fix in the DE teleport (Theres some writing which tells you how to get out) + FM Roof has been fixed + Other general building and map bugs patched + FM forcefield button click thingy bug should be fixed now + Gleethrop end teleport moved to spawn you at DC instead of in the middle of the tracks + reset bug fixed </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 20/12/2023 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Chat tags should now get removed right. - HST being slower than usual on SAT - DE line. - Pro servers GUI not closing + Anchored snow at DC box - Invisible block at DC + DC Shunt signal 12 name </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 03/01/2024 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> - Snow removed + More track circuits at Masonfield + Bug fixes + HST AWS and speedlimit not working is also fixed + New BL Map </syntaxhighlight>
==== Update 04/01/2024 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + The bell code guide has been updated for easier reading, and to follow the format of other documents. + The Signal Guide is also redone. + Fixed circuit lamps being offset on the DC/GE board + 2 more circuits added (DC and MS) - Removed snow under the tracks at DE - Removed snow infront of SAT box + Added Class 158 to Masonfield spawn button. + Fixed train sound playing at Gleethrop End + Fixed changelog order + Track circuits at Marigot Crossing (13-14 and 04-06) are finally fixed and showing trains again! + Track circuits at Masonfield also added on the upper map. + Track circuit at Pallion Habour now detects the trains earlier so you can set signal DC_31 in time if you need to. + New "Refresh Circuits" buttons for refreshing track circuits! (do not be scared to use them) + Fixed "Go Back" button in the menu. + Fixed menu text being too small. + Bug/Scenery fixes + Radios also work now! </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 1.2.1 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Fixed: + Fixed MS map track circuits missingand wrong numbering on upper map. + Fixed MS track circuits + Fixed MS siding lights + Fixed MS points MS_37 and MS_45 + Fixed SAT box door + Scenery fixes + Fixed FM track circuits + Fixed unanchored signs at SAT and MS + Fixed lighting in the MS building
+ Added: + Added Gleethrop End and Masonfield Box teleports + Added more joint sounds (click click, clack clack on points) + Added MS waiting area + more interior stuff + Added 2nd Meow Cafe door at MS and signs for the Cafe! </syntaxhighlight>
==== Version 1.2.2 ==== <syntaxhighlight lang="diff"> + Added Gleethrop End TRTS for all platforms + Fixed MC + Every clock updates now each second. + Rewrited the settings handler to imporve saving and loading. + Minor meow cafe scenery updates
Fixed: + DC signal and point indicators reconnected + Fixed DC signals + Fixed unanchores parts at Masonfield + MS car stop markers fixed at platform 1 + FM TRTS height increased + Fixed TRTS at FM + Fixed DC signals + Fixed door in the training centre being a seat + Fixed SH18 at Masonfield + Fixed "Lever sounds" setting + Fixed Topbar for VR + Fixed scenery bugs </syntaxhighlight> [[Category:General Information]]

revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} ;Description :'''User Avatar Finder''' lets a user add and keep an up-to-date user avatar image in a page, by using the template, without having to look for the file link. ;Usage :To use it, simply include the template name and the username of the user in the content. :
{{User Avi|Username}}
:You can also change the size of the avatar (minimum size: 16 16px, maximum: 150 150px, default: 100 100px), (leave the px out) like so: :
{{User Avi|Username|Size}}
;Example :
{{User Avi|Tsukinyama|50}}
:Results with the following: :{{User Avi|Tsukinyama|50}} ;See also * [[w:c:dev:User Avatar Finder]] ** [[w:c:dev:Template:User Avi]] [[Category:Design templates]]

revision.comment: Toward perth direction for the crossing
revision.text: == Summary == Toward perth direction for the crossing == Licensing == {{Self}}

{{Crossing|title1=Perthtyne Crossing|image1=<gallery> File:Perthtyne Crossing.png|Day File:Perthtyne crossing 3.png|Night </gallery>|singal_box=N/A (Automatic)|tracks=1|road_lanes=2|gate_operation=Semi-Automatic|crossing_code=N/A|nearest_station=Perthtyne|xp_requirment=N/A}}
'''Perthtyne''' '''Crossing''' is a ''Automatic Open Crossing Locally Monitored'' level crossing located between [[Gleethrop End]] and [[Perthtyne]].
This level crossing was added in Version 1.2.0, alongside [[Masonfield Crossing]].
==Operation== This level crossing is unique in that it lacks any barriers and relies on drivers or train staff for safe operation (hence the name, ''"Automatic'' ''Open Crossing Locally Monitored"''). The level crossing has two parts, the crossing itself (alarms and warning lights) and the '''Level Crossing Indicator'''. The Level Crossing Indicators have two different indications, flashing red and flashing white.
*'''Flashing Red''' - Stop before reaching the level crossing, ensure that it is safe before proceeding over it. *'''Flashing White''' - The level crossing is working normally and providing that the level crossing is clear, it is safe to proceed over it.
The operation for the level crossing is different depending on the direction the driver is approaching.
For trains coming from Gleethrop End, the level crossing will activate automatically. Only thing the driver need to do is ensure that the Level Crossing Indicator is flashing white and whistle accordingly before proceeding over the level crossing. There is however a plunger on this side just in case the level crossing failed to activate automatically.
For trains coming from Perthtyne, the operation is largely different. There will be a stop sign with instructions saying that the driver must operate the plunger and check for obstruction before departing. After the driver pressed the plunger, the level crossing alarms and light will activate automatically (this will also activate the nearby footpath crossing at Perthtyne). Afterwards, the driver has to observe that the Level Crossing Indicator is flashing white accordingly before proceeding over the level crossing.
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Perthtyne Crossing 2.png|Associated Level Crossing Indicator and Plunger for Gleethrop End's direction. File:PerthtyneDPIs(Perth'sdirection).png|Associated Level Crossing Indicator for Perthtyne's Direction. </gallery>
== References == [[Category:Level Crossings]]

revision.text:
Hello, I am Tjmuder_10 (Roblox user) and i like trains and public transportation. I often play [[Dovedale Railway Wiki|Dovedale Railway]] , I am currently a Roleplay Signaler with 15k XP.
My favorite signal box has to be [[Satus Signal Box|Satus]] because it has a mix of everything and not too many levers. Despite everyone wanting to be in this box, still my favorite.
My least favorite signal box is [[Dovedale East Signalling Centre|Dovedale East]] because it has so many levers and is often very busy.
My favorite train is the [[class 158]] in the Scotrail 'Saltire' livery.
I also have retrieved [[Bring Her Back (Badge)|Maxwell]].
(Me in front of the Goobersville signal box) [[File:GoobersvilleBox.png|left|frameless|562x562px|Goobersvilee Signal Box]]

revision.text:
__NOTOC__ {{PolicyNavigation}} === Why Dovedale? === We have a realistic and unique signalling system. Super cool trains. A cozy vibe. Fun people, and a fun community, and no pesky pay-to-win game passes! Hopefully that's enough to convince you. === I'm sad, Dovedale is changing too fast, I really liked the old version of (insert station name here)! === Check out the old and classic versions of dovedale [https://www.roblox.com/games/16481117256/Dovedale-Pre-1-0 here] and [https://www.roblox.com/games/15476910702/Dovedale-Railway-Classic here]! === The game is really slow for me. === Due to the large map and detailed systems, dovedale may not work well on older devices or devices with less fancy specs. We are always trying to optimise the game though, so for now, you can try disabling trees and lowering your graphics to get a smoother experience. === How do I become a Qualified Signaller? === Firstly, complete the theory quiz in the [[Project:Discord|Discord Server]] by running the /apply command with the 'Appy' bot. If you pass (get a score >80%), you will be allowed to take practical sessions! You will be required to signal in certain scenarios here in a live game hosted by staff.
If you pass both of those, you get the role! === These training times really suck. === Sorry, but these are only hosted when are moderators are available, and everyone has different schedules. We still try to incorporate everyone though! === How do I get started with the game? === Check out the 'Help' menu to read the rules and how to operate the different game mechanics! === How do I signal? === Start by reading the [[Signalling Guide]]. Then try it out for yourself in a server! If you feel like it, get a friend or ask someone how to signal, that really helps! And if you still have questions, ask around! Everyone is willing to help! === How do i become one of the cool kids? (a moderator) === Apply [[Dovedale Railway Wiki:Forms|here]] when applications are open. Join the [[Project:Discord|Discord Server]] if you haven't already for all the latest updates. === The wiki isn't accurate! === Sorry that this is the case! Wikis are designed for everyone to pitch in and help to edit. Simply sign up for an account on Fandom (for security purposes), and then click edit!
Some pages may be protected to different user levels, so if that is the case and you cannot change anything, please contact a [[Project:Staff|wiki staff member]] to help you. === Someone is trolling! === Please click the settings button (the one with the cog wheel), and then press 'Call Admin'. This will notify any staff member in game, or send a help request to them if nobody is in game. === Nobody showed up though... === Sorry for this! We try to be online as much as we can, and sometimes we can miss out on calls. Please clip evidence (chats, videos, screenshots) and send them in a support ticket in our [[Project:Discord|Discord Server]]. We can settle it from there. === OMG I love the new design/changes you guys are awesome. === Thanks. === OMG I hate the new design/changes, I want to die. === Sorry. === Whats coming next? === Top secret, hush hush. === Hm, I still havent found the answer I was looking for... === Open a support ticket in the #support channel in our [[Project:Discord|Discord Server]].

Updated default StructuredQuote template. See https://community.fandom.com/wiki/Help:Structured_Quotes for more details.
revision.text:
{{{text|Text...}}}

{{{speaker|speaker}}}{{#if:{{{receiver|}}}|, to {{{receiver|}}}}}{{#if:{{{attribution|}}}|, {{{attribution|}}}}}{{#if:{{{source|}}}|, {{{source|}}}}}

==Description== A template used for displaying Structured Quotes ( ''{{#SQuote:}}'' ). If you want to unlock the full potential of Structured Quotes, please avoid using this template directly, and consider ''{{#SQuote:}}'' markup instead. See https://community.fandom.com/wiki/Help:Structured_Quotes for extra information about Structured Quotes. ==Syntax== 
{{StructuredQuote
| text   =
| speaker =
| receiver =
| attribution =
| source  =
}}
==Samples== {{StructuredQuote |text=Size matters not. Look at me. Judge me by my size, do you? Hmm? Hmm. And well you should not. (...) |speaker=[[w:c:en.starwars:Yoda|Yoda]] |receiver=[[w:c:en.starwars:Luke_Skywalker|Luke Skywalker]] |source=[[w:c:en.starwars:Star_Wars:_Episode_V_The_Empire_Strikes_Back|Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back]] }} 
{{StructuredQuote
|text=Size matters not. Look at me. Judge me by my size, do you? Hmm? Hmm. And well you should not. (...)
|speaker=[[Yoda]]
|receiver=[[Luke Skywalker]]
|source=[[Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back]]
}}
== TemplateData == { "params": { "text": { "label": "Quote text", "description": "quote text", "type": "content", "required": true }, "speaker": { "label": "Person(s) quoted", "description": "individual(s) who uttered or wrote the quoted words (wikitext links, comma-separated)", "type": "content", "required": true }, "receiver": { "label": "Person(s) to whom the quote was spoken", "description": "person the quote was spoken to (wikitext links, comma-separated)", "type": "content", "suggested": true }, "attribution": { "label": "Attribution(s)", "description": "attribution (wikitext links, comma-separated)", "type": "content", "suggested": true }, "source": { "label": "Quote source", "description": "place where it was spoken (wikitext link)", "type": "content", "suggested": true } }, "format": "block" }
